It's simple, really.  Spend some time at Luon Highway (or even Lake 
Kilma) until you've obtained at least one WindCap (ToppleCotton Hat 
dropped by Spiny Cones) and at least four Clear Feather (Feather 
Secondary dropped by Stinger Bees and Gloomoths).

Then, simply add the four Clear Feather to the WindCap.  Sell it for 
a wonderful 26 644 Lucre sum.  What did you pay for it?  Nothing!  
Pure profit, and lots of it.

This is the fastest way of making money in Legend of Mana.

This is a Tempering Riddle. The first person to solve the riddle 
wins!

This Riddle is titled "Witches of Moons?" and is ranked at ***/***** 
(3 out of 5) stars in difficulty.

One day, young Yvanne went to her workshops to do some Tempering. 
She found an old dusty MenosBronze Helmet in her inventory. Looking 
at it, she discoverd that it had the following stats:
Undine: 5
Jinn: 3
Gnome: 5
Salamander: 5

Mystic Cards:
Witch
Ancient Moon
Witch of Moon

Now, Yvanne realizes that Jinn is somewhat low. She wants to have 5 
Jinn, and not 3.
However, she really likes those Mystic Cards! She needs your help 
because she isn't very good at Tempering! Since her MenosBronze Helm 
is so old, she can't even remember what she added last, so she could 
have anything in the Invisible Slot!

Here's what you have to find out:

What items could Yvanne add to her MenosBronze Helm in order to 
raise Jinn to 5 -- without changing any other essences -- but still 
end up with the same Cards - in the same order?

You will receive bonus points if you use six or less items.

Welcome to another Riddle!  This one is titled:
"Yvanne and the Sevent'eight Cards", and is ranked at ***/*****
(3 out of 5) stars in difficulty.

A few days after trying to learn how to temper, Yvanne decided to 
make a MenosBronze Hat.  Realizing that MenosBronze has resistances 
of 8, she decided to add eight items to it.
She added:
2 Gold Coins
2 Crystals
2 Produce
1 Pouch
1 Vial

As she did this, she noticed different Mystic Cards coming and 
going.  After tempering all eight items into her new MenosBronze Hat, 
she was left with:
Tower/Mirrored World/Ancient Moon

You job is to find out what she added.  To help you out, Yvanne's 
friend Dilly-Bob wrote down what kinds of Mystic Cards he saw.  In 
addition, he sneaked on to play Yvanne's game, and added a Lilipods 
to her MenosBronze Hat, noting down what kind of card the final last 
Mystic Card was.
He had noted down that there were 2 Maiden Cards, 2 Essence Cards, 2 
World Cards, and 2 Stage Cards, in no particular order.

Yvanne says that she did not add two of the same item in, so what 
items did she add, and in what order?

Here's a re-cap:
8 Items Added:
2 Gold Coins
2 Crystals
2 Produce
1 Pouch
1 Vial
8 Mystic Cards:
2 Maiden
2 Essense
2 World
2 Stage
(The final Mystic Card is in the invisible slot, which was bumped out 
when Dilly-Bob added his own Lilipods)

Bonus points if you can figure out a way that works that isn't the 
same way Yvanne did it!

Okay . . . 
Witch of Moon requires >4 Undine and Jinn = 0, so Jinn had to be added
 after the Witch of Moon.  Therefore there *should* be a Jinn in the
hidden spot.  Since she wants to keep the current cards, to raise Jinn
she will need to use high energy items that don't produce cards.

So Jinn *should* rise to 5 with the addition of 3 Dialaurels.

Now, you're not quite correct, but it's a good idea.  Essence Cards 
in the Invisible Slot, however, do not give TPs.  So, you wouldn't be 
able to add anything by simply using Dialaurels.  They do, however, 
give TPs on the turn they enter - but they she would have different 
Cards.
Try to think of another way to get Witch of Moon while Jinn > 0, and 
you can easily raise Jinn and then pop on another Witch of Moon 
(especially since Ancient Moon and Witch are very easy to get back 
on).
 
> Okay . . . 
> Witch of Moon requires >4 Undine and Jinn = 0, so Jinn had to be 
added
>  after the Witch of Moon.  Therefore there *should* be a Jinn in the
> hidden spot.  Since she wants to keep the current cards, to raise 
Jinn
> she will need to use high energy items that don't produce cards.
> 
> So Jinn *should* rise to 5 with the addition of 3 Dialaurels.

With Adamantine, I'm not too sure - just try all three, and get back 
to us with which is better.

Swords are difficult to varnish for, because their 
Sharp/Heavy/Force/Tech values are all the same -- It all depends on 
the Material values.

For Dragonscale, I think that the best varnish is the 3 Clown Card + 
Sharp Claw varnish.

For DiorWood, I KNOW the best varnish will be the 3 Volcano + 
Scissors varnish.

Adamantine might be the 3 Cleric + Giant's Horn varnish, but I'm not 
sure.

:)

Alright, folks.  Here's what's done!
I've completed entering the Mystic Card Database - if you have any 
suggestions or questions about it, feel free to ask.  It's in the 
Database section, and if you use 'View Printable Report', it's much 
nicer to read (I think).
Second, I've completed and perfected a request -- a PearlRing.  
However, the recipe will work for both a ring AND a Pendant, and will 
work for any material you wish so long as it has 6, 7, or 8 
resistances all around (so MenosBronze, Pearl, Dragonscales, and so 
on).  The result will have rather good stat boosts (more if you 
double (or triple) up on the Toadstoolsheds), Extra Lucre gain, 
Freeze and Sleep protection, and 3 essences across the board.  Woo!
It's cheap, too, only needing a single Chaos Crystal and 3 Moth Wings 
(other than a couple other things which aren't too difficult, they're 
all listed).
Any other requests?

Now, here's what's to come!
Soon, I will start entering the Item Database, which will be 
rather... well, troublesome for me.  You see, Items have many 
different properties: Bonus (Limitations), Price, Name, Group, ID, 
Mystic Card, Essence Requirements for Mystic Card, Weapon/Armor 
Bonuses, Energy, and Special Effects (not to mention where you can 
find the item, which I'm going to put in a different table due to the 
fact that there's.. well, many places!)..
I've got to fit all of that on one table.  Wish me luck!
After that, I'll start with a Pet List -- telling you each Pet 
Monster, the Type, the Starting Stats, and the Stat Gain per level.
To accompany that will be a Monster List -- telling you where to find 
each kind of monster and what items that monster will drop.
Later, even more tables... Not sure of what, yet.
In any case, that's all hard stuff.  More recipes will be made, 
however, so that will be fun!  ^_^

Alright, thanks folks!

X-Yahoo-Profile: tagged_jc

Here's a simple formula that will work for any Metals (that have the 
same resistance for all essences) and most other things, as well.  
You will need 5 Mercury, 5 Sulpher, 1 Silver of each essence, 1 Chaos 
Crystal, and as many Flaming Quill and Gold Clover as you can get 
your hands on.

Mercury
Mercury
Shade Silver
Sulpher
ADD* UNTIL THIS ESSENCE WON'T RISE ANYMORE: Shade
Sulpher
Wisp Silver
Aura Silver
ADD* UNTIL THIS ESSENCE WON'T RISE ANYMORE: Wisp
Mercury
ADD* UNTIL THIS ESSENCE WON'T RISE ANYMORE: Aura
Mercury
Undine Silver
Gnome Silver
ADD* UNTIL THIS ESSENCE WON'T RISE ANYMORE: Undine
Sulpher
Sulpher
Dryad Silver
ADD* UNTIL THIS ESSENCE WON'T RISE ANYMORE: Gnome
Sala Silver
ADD* UNTIL THIS ESSENCE WON'T RISE ANYMORE: Dryad
Sulpher
Glow Crystal
Mercury
ADD* UNTIL THIS ESSENCE WON'T RISE ANYMORE: Salamander
Jinn Silver
Holy Water
ADD* UNTIL THIS ESSENCE WON'T RISE ANYMORE: Jinn
Holy Water
Holy Water
Lilipods
Giant's Horn

*You will be adding either Flaming Quill (until you raise Jinn -- 
then you MUST use Gold Clover) or Gold Clover.

Be care of Wisp and Shade - don't let Wisp get higher than Shade (so 
if Wisp=Shade, stop adding the Flaming Quill / Gold Clover).
Otherwise, you should be fine!

I hope it makes a suitable weapon for you.

> btw that dont require isheplatinum or dragonscales...i dont got 
> those yet...
> 
> something using videlgold(sp?)

X-Yahoo-Profile: tagged_jc

If you're having trouble getting DiorWood, Dragonscales, and 
Adamantine, you should make yourself a +20 all equipment, or four.
It's rather simple.  Take almost any material (though, you'll want 8 
or less Dryad resistance, or you're going to have to use Gold Clover 
instead of Wicked Eye) (NON-WOOD), and add:

Any Seed
Sulpher
Sulpher
Needle
Wicked Eye
Wicked Eye
Spiny Seed
Poison Fang
Spiny Seed
Card-Making Item
X Meat (until +20 all)
Creepy Eye / Moth Wing (for more Magic Defense)

Then you'll get +80 Luck, if you make yourself three +20 All 
rings/pendants and a +20 all weapon (though, it'll take longer to 
bring down Level 99 Dragons and such, if you do it to your weapon, 
too).

And bring a Polterbox.

By the way - the QuickRecipe works on all kinds of equipment.  You 
can try that...

Note that LorimarIron isn't very good for swords, though.

To: LoM_Kitchen@yahoogroups.com
Subject: Re: Plunge attacks
Message-ID: <b3h9dh+10m57@eGroups.com>
In-Reply-To: <b3h91t+c5i6@eGroups.com>
User-Agent: eGroups-EW/0.82
MIME-Version: 1.0
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=ISO-8859-1
Content-Length: 876
X-Mailer: Yahoo Groups Message Poster
From: "JC Riles <tagged_jc@yahoo.com>" <tagged_jc@yahoo.com>
X-Originating-IP: 24.67.253.204
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=116656188
X-Yahoo-Profile: tagged_jc

In the Mystic Card List I have in the Database of this group, you'll 
see which Cards produce which Plunge Attacks in which Weapons.

Unfortunately, Plunge Attacks do not look any different from the 
usual Thrust / Uppercut / Jump Plunges, though they may have 
different effects.

You can add these in at any time, and they will replace the current 
Thrust / Uppercut / Jump Plunges, depending on which slot the Plunge 
Attack takes.

For more information, go to 
http://www.geocities.com/xo_pitseleh/lom.html and read the section on 
Plunge Attacks.

As far as varnishing goes, you'll have to refer to Material and 
Weapon Tables that I haven't got ahold of yet.  Generally, Force-
weapons include Axes and two-handed Axes, Sharp-weapons include 
Spears, Bows, and Knives, Heavy-weapons include Flail, Gloves, Staff, 
and Hammer, and Swords don't fit into any category.

:)

--- In LoM_Kitchen@yahoogroups.com, "ryuknightzephyr 
<ryuknightzephyr@y...>" <ryuknightzephyr@y...> wrote:
> How do you know what varnishes fit each weapon/material type?

This is something that I had posted on the GameFAQs board. It is 
exactly what you are looking for.

Method 1: Clown x3, Sharp Claw
Method 2: Volcano x3, Scissors
Method 3: Cleric x3, Giant's Horn

Dagger: Method 1
Sword: See Below
Axe: Method 2
2H Sword: See Below
2H Axe: Method 2
Hammer: Method 3
Spear: Method 1
Staff: Method 3
Glove: Method 3
Flail: Method 3
Bow: Method 1

Sword and 2H Sword are special in that they don't have a strong 
aspect to their attack power. So that means you can use any of the 
three methods you like. However, if you have a partner that raises a 
certain attack type by syncing, refer to the attack types listed with 
the Methods.

Method 1 - Slashing/Piercing/Jabbing. With the edge of the weapon.
Method 2 - Force. A deeply cutting hit.
Method 3 - Heavy/Blunt. A bashing attack.

There "should" be a 4th method, but there is no Mystic Card for the 
4th attack stat, Technique. If there were, Knife, Glove, and Flail 
would all use that instead.

Actually, the Knife is still best suited with Sharp-type boosts (3x 
Clown Card, Sharp Claw), whereas the Bow would be better if there was 
a +50% Tech -50% Force Card.  :)

Sharp: Knife, Spear
Force: Axe, 2H Axe
Heavy: Staff, Hammer
Tech: Bow, Flail, Gloves
None: Sword, 2H-Sword

So, originally, there is two weapons in each category except for 
Tech, which also has the Bow.
Now, however, the Bow is moved to the "Sharp" group, and the 
Flail/Gloves to the "Heavy" Group, making it more like:

Sharp: Knife, Spear, Bow
Force: Axe, 2H Axe
Heavy: Staff, Hammer, Flail, Gloves
None: Sword, 2H-Sword

Which isn't really as nicely balanced as what it should be.  ^_^

> There "should" be a 4th method, but there is no Mystic Card for the 
> 4th attack stat, Technique. If there were, Knife, Glove, and Flail 
> would all use that instead.

I'd like to see it. How many is a lot???

Heres a recipe I'm working on which will get to 100 with no mirror 
pieces. Err, at least I think so, I'm only about half way through it 
myself. =_=

Notes:
X=coin of the element you're trying to raise
fq=flaming quill
m=mercury for shade,aura,jinn,undine
 =sulpher for wisp,dryad,sala,gnome

Blocks-2nd element won't raise if the first is present (generally 
the 1st element also drains the second)
(wisp blocks shade, aura blocks dryad, sala blocks gnome blocks jinn 
blocks undine blocks sala)

Supports-2nd element won't drain if the 1st is present (this is a 
BAD thing)
(sala supports jinn supports sala, gnome supports undine supports 
gnome)

0->9
X	1
m	2
m	3
glow	4
fq	5
fq	6
fq	7
3 glow
2 m
X	8
glow	9

Shade/Wisp 0->9 (shade/wisp follow slightly different wizard card 
rules)
2 m
X	1
glow	2
fq	3
fq	4
fq	5
fq	6
fq	7
2 glow
2 m
X
glow	8
2 glow
2 m
X
glow	9

Conflicted 0->9 (use this when the element you are raising is 
blocked)(won't work for shade/wisp)
chaos
X	1
m	2
glow	3
fq	4
fq	5
glow	6
chaos
X
2 m
glow	7
3 glow
chaos
2 m
X	8
4 glow
chaos
2 m
Xgold	9

aligned 9->11 (X to 9, Y to 9, X drains Y)
(use this when the element you're raising also triggers the drain 
(consumption))
chaos	9 9

(use this when the element you're raising doesn't trigger the drain)

raise a 13)

garlicrown

C means you have to raise this element in conflict
L means this was leftover from a previous step

From: "nano_biquts" <jonh@polter.net>

X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=22685443
X-Yahoo-Profile: nano_biquts

Mirrored world is only produced by a mirror piece.
Ancient moon is only produced by a chaos crystal.
Tower is produced by healing claw and rocket papaya. But we know she 
didn't use a claw.
To get two world cards at the same time we need a bed of thorns. So 
either a needle or a needlelettuce.
But we already know our pouch was a mirror piece.
Tower needs wisp present and bed of thorns needs dryad present.
So we're left with 2 maidens which are produced by a vial and a 
crystal.
That must be nymph of dawn(glow crystal) and sacrificed nymph(ghost 
howl).
For order; dryad before needlelettuce, wisp before papaya rocket, 
bed of thorns before world cards,
but still close enough to be active when they enter.

This works:
dryad gold
needlelettuce
wisp gold
glow crystal
chaos crystal
mirror piece
papaya rocket
ghost howl

There are 24 possible arrangements.

--- In LoM_Kitchen@yahoogroups.com, "nano_biquts" <jonh@p...> wrote:
> Mirrored world is only produced by a mirror piece.
> Ancient moon is only produced by a chaos crystal.
> Tower is produced by healing claw and rocket papaya. But we know 
she 
> didn't use a claw.
> To get two world cards at the same time we need a bed of thorns. So 
> either a needle or a needlelettuce.
> But we already know our pouch was a mirror piece.
> Tower needs wisp present and bed of thorns needs dryad present.
> So we're left with 2 maidens which are produced by a vial and a 
> crystal.
> That must be nymph of dawn(glow crystal) and sacrificed nymph(ghost 
> howl).
> For order; dryad before needlelettuce, wisp before papaya rocket, 
> bed of thorns before world cards,
> but still close enough to be active when they enter.
> 
> This works:
> dryad gold
> needlelettuce
> wisp gold
> glow crystal
> chaos crystal
> mirror piece
> papaya rocket
> ghost howl
> 
> There are 24 possible arrangements.

X-Yahoo-Profile: tagged_jc

Well, the best place to start, for me to help you (at least), is if 
you ask questions.  Ask questions.  And then ask more questions.

If I had to recommend a FAQ, I'd suggest reading MMajarra's FAQ (at 
www.gamefaqs.com for those of you who don't know about it) a few 
times, at least the first part of it.

However, MMajarra's FAQ has a number of flaws and missing sections, 
which overall is not too bad, but tends to make me frusterated with 
him for being stingy about recipes (he burns people at the stake, you 
see)... Now, if he were to UPDATE his FAQ, it'd be much better >_>
And he shouldn't use 'don't have the game right now, can't test' as 
an excuse, considering that I don't have the game right now, and I 
still manage to test things, simply by asking other people to do the 
testing for me...

So, after you understand the inial aspects of Tempering, the best way 
to learn for you is to experiment and ask questions about the results.
Wonder why you can't create an Ancient Moon Card when you have 
Yggdrasil/Beast-Headed God/Yggdrasil?  Wonder why Sulpher and Mercury 
are really needed?  Ask.

But read the FAQs first, so that you come with a little bit of 
knowledge, so I can figure out where to _start_.

:)

X-Mailer: Yahoo Groups Message Poster
From: "nano_biquts" <jonh@polter.net>
X-Originating-IP: 128.61.53.11
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=22685443
X-Yahoo-Profile: nano_biquts

1. Learn about the very basics of cards by tempering clear feathers 
into windcaps. The first one you temper has no visible effect but it 
increases the value of the cap. The next one you temper will show a 
Lord of Flies card being added and the value of the item will go up 
again. This will also happen for the next two clear feathers you 
add. But any you add after that will have no effect. This should 
teach you two things. First that there is one invisible slot in 
addition to the three visible card slots. Second that this is a 
great way to make money. (clear feathers come from stinger bees and 
windcaps come from spiny cones, both of which can be found on the 
luon highway)
extra credit: What happens when you add clear feathers to a cap you 
forge yourself? Why?

Quite honestly, Staves suck.  I believe their *maximum* attack power 
is second only to Gloves, with Flails still managing to top them.
The best Staff you can make is out of Dragonscales.  It'd be possible 
to make a 400+ Attack Power Staff simply by using the QuickRecipe on 
this site.
Otherwise, you'll have to use some higher forms of Tempering... You 
could make a 9/9/9/9/9/9/9/9 Staff pretty easily, if you learn about 
energy and such.  That Staff probably won't reach 800 Attack Power, 
but still...

Content-Length: 924
X-Mailer: Yahoo Groups Message Poster
From: "JC Riles" <tagged_jc@yahoo.com>
X-Originating-IP: 24.84.214.53
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=116656188
X-Yahoo-Profile: tagged_jc

If you want Golden Touch, you can't add Cleric Cards to your Staff 
(as Demonicide will replace Golden Touch).  Therefore, your attack 
power potential drops about 100 points, considering the best varnish 
for Staves is 3x Cleric + Giant's Horn.

If you want something similar to Golden Touch, you're better off 
using Gloves and the Hand of Midas Plunge Attack.  Hand of Midas 
turns all experience crystals into Lucre, just like Golden Touch, 
except it's for the Gloves, and is created by the King Card.
Then you can use Cleric Cards to boost your attack power higher, 
since Cleric doesn't add a Plunge Attack to Gloves.

This still needs some work, but the problem areas might be of 
interest.

stinky breath
fire stone
sulpher
sulpher
holy water
zombie claw
blackened bat
sharp claw
water stone
fishy fruit
round seed
sulpher
sulpher
gnome silver
flaming quill
chaos crystal
moon crystal
sun crystal
flaming quill
aura silver
[the ancient moon didn't push on at this point which suprised me, I 
think the dryad card from the round seed is being treated as a world 
card]
chaos crystal [this one works]
wind stone
squalphin
lilipod
lilipod
fire stone
giants horn
chaos crystal
needlelettuce
ghosts howl
spiny seed
ghosts howl
[this didn't push on the yggsdrasil]
after about 4 more spiny seeds I was able to end up with 
yggsdrasil/yggsdrasil/leviathan
So I was able to end up with all elemental markers, all status 
immunities, and +20 all stats without using dragonblood, but I 
wasn't able to tag on virgins sigh like I'd hoped. If I figure out 
whats going on at the end I'll repost.

I finally figured out how to do what marcus had been hinting at.


>> fire stone
>> giants horn
>> chaos crystal
>> needlelettuce

Sala starts at 0 and conflicting elements keep it from rising. The 
needleettuce is put on seeing 0 sala so it makes a bed of thorns. 
And it also pushes on the chaos crystal which allows sala to rise 
which gives the sala marker.

X-Yahoo-Profile: tagged_jc

Actually, I think Marcus was referring to having added a Sala-Card 
Creating item that gives all of its energy to Wisp/Shade/Dryad/Aura, 
and so has no more left for Salamander.  Thus, you have the 
oppurtunity for later Salamander TPs without adding any additional 
Cards after the Bed of Thorn (allowing you to have room for the two 
Yggdrasil Cards).  An example would be having:

(Sorcerer)
Sorcerer
Dryad
[Card]

With Dryad at 4, on Adamantite (resistance 8/6/3/1), Dryad requires 3 
* 2^4 = 48 energy.  Now, if you add a Sala Silver, you'd get 48 
energy, and end up with (Sala)Sorcerer/Sorcerer/Dryad.  At this 
point, you can simply add a Needlettuce, which would raise Salamander 
to 1 (even if you added a Needle, which only gives 8 energy).  Then, 
the next thing that you add will raise Salamander to 2.
Top it off with Spiny Seed + Evil God (more difficult to work in, 
with the above, unless you use a Ragnarok Trick) + Spiny Seed.
Here's how to get a Ragnarok Trick to work.

You have: (Yggdrasil)Bed of Thorn/Salamander/Sorcerer.
Now add a non-Wicked Eye (Pixie)Yggdrasil/Bed of Thorn/Sorcerer.
Now add a Spiny Seed (Yggdrasil)Pixie/Yggdrasil/Bed of Thorn.
Now add a Pine o'Clock (Ragnarok)Yggdrasil/Pixie/Yggdrasil.
Now add any Cardless item, and you'll end up with (---)Yggdrasil/Evil 
God/Yggdrasil.
From there, you can add your Varnish Item (which would be whatever 
you'd like the Effect to be [since Bed of Thorn turns the effect into 
No Regeneration], of course) and top it off with a Creepy Eye (for 
Magic Defense -- on a Pendant, a Moth Wing would work just as well, 
since the reduction in the other defenses is irrelevant).

:)

Helpful much?

^_____^

X-Yahoo-Profile: tagged_jc

It's divide by 4, truncate, then multiply by 3.  If the result is 0, 
the resistance is then equal to 1.  Here's a mini-chart:

1/1/1/1 (there IS no resistance 1, but...)
2/1/1/1 (and there IS no resistance 2...)
3/1/1/1 (nor is there a resistance 3...)
4/3/1/1 (or a resistance 4!)
5/3/1/1
6/3/1/1
7/3/1/1
8/6/3/1
9/6/3/1
10/6/3/1
11/6/3/1
32/18/12/9

^_^

So you could theorize Resistance 13, and so on, using this formula.

If you have (BedofThorn)AncientMoon/Dryad/---
And add a Chaos Crystal... You get (---)BedofThorn/AncientMoon/Dryad?

If that's the case, then the Bed of Thorn is only checked for in the 
three visible slots... and to remedy it, simply add a Grave Dirt 
(etc.) just in front of the World Card you'd like to create multiples 
of.

In Geo, you look in the Cafe "Hello, Carl!" - talk to the Teapo in 
the corner.
In Gato Grottoes, there's a student right at the village.  He's 
selling the materials.
In Lumina, the shop "Mummy Seeker" is where you need to find -- it's 
off to the left, on Morning Moon Alley.
In Polpota Harbor, there's a student right at the seaside shop 
region.  He's selling the materials.

If you don't have a Level 2 Shop anywhere, you'll have to wait until 
your next time through the game (during a New Game + ) to place your 
Lands more carefully, to ensure you can purchase Mercury and 
Sulpher.  Following the www.gamefaqs.com Map / AF Placement FAQ might 
be wise.

Ok, it works now.

stinky breath
fire stone
sulpher
sulpher
holy water
zombie claw
blackened bat (sala=5)
shade silver
*sharp claw
water stone
fishy fruit (shade=4,undine=3)
*squalphin (sala=0) 
round seed
sulpher
sulpher
gnome silver
flaming quill (dryad=5)
wind stone
sun crystal (wisp=1)
flaming quill
flaming quill (gnome=5)
chaos crystal
aura silver
*giants horn
flaming quill (aura=3,jinn=3)
sala gold (aura=4,sala=0)
*needlettuce (sala=1) 
ghosts howl
*spiny seed 
ghosts howl
*spiny seed
*virgins sigh 
~15 meat
moth wing

sharp claw needs sala5+, undine0 to produce god of destruction
squalphin needs undine3+, total5+ to produce ocean god
giants horn needs gnome5+, sala0 to produce leviathan
needlettuce needs dryad1+, sala0 to produce bed of thorns
spiny seed needs dryad5+ to produce yggdrasil
virgins sigh needs shade3+, dryad3+ to produce goddess of love

I thought I had run into another problem but it turned out to be 
just me forgetting goddess of love needing 3+ for shade.

The reason that your Yggdrasil didn't appear is here:

http://s2.cgi.gamefaqs.com/boards/genmessage.asp?
board=24026&topic=7261885

In other words, the older World Card was preventing Yggdrasil from 
appearing, despite the presence of Bed of Thorn.

In-Reply-To: <b6h4f8+gvch@eGroups.com>

MIME-Version: 1.0

Content-Length: 1230
X-Mailer: Yahoo Groups Message Poster
From: "nano_biquts" <jonh@polter.net>
X-Originating-IP: 128.61.53.11
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=22685443
X-Yahoo-Profile: nano_biquts

> How can I play the instrument?
To play for spirits you need to have an unequipped instrument.

> 1. Which better? 2HSword or Staff?
Each weapon has its strengths. Some are fast and allow lots of hits 
(glove/flail). Others are slower and do more damage (2Hswords/2Haxe).
Staff is good if you like using magic. You might also try spears and 
bows as they have good range.

> 2. How can I tempering a great weapon from either 2Hsword and
> staff without dragonscales,dragonblood.But the highest I have
> is VizelGold?
Try using the QuickRecipe. Its under files and should give you a 
pretty good weapon even using VizelGold.

> 3. Where and what monster dropped dragonsclaes(except this,a 
> probability),DiorWood,and Mirrorpiece?
Dragons (sky/land but not kid) drop dragonscales.
Woodings drop diorwood.
And nothing drops Mirror Pieces (there is a fixed number per game)

> 4. What mirror piece use for?
Reversing some tempering properties. You probably won't need them 
useless you get very serious about tempering.
I've never used them and I've got a 529 prevarnish spear.

> Umm.... where can I get this Marcus Majarra's FAQ...?
> I don't seem to find it...
http://db.gamefaqs.com/console/psx/file/legend_of_mana_temper_b.txt

X-Yahoo-Profile: nano_biquts

The recipe assumes that shade/wisp resistances are similar. If 
they're not then wisp rising above shade would drain all the shade. 
Any imbalance at those steps could mess up the dryad/aura steps.
Moving the shade/wisp step til after the dryad/aura step would solve 
part of the problem. And a note not to raise wisp above shade could 
be helpful.

X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=116656188
X-Yahoo-Profile: tagged_jc

They'd have to be from the same of the following set:
[5,6,7] (Resistance 1 with Two Wizards)
[8,9,10] (Resistance 3 with Two Wizards)

With 64 energy, the first group can get to level 6.
With 64 energy, the second group can get to level 5.
When Wisp is in the first group, and shade is in the second group, 
you must ensure that Wisp doesn't grow past level 6.

Thus, you must be careful on these materials:

VizelGold
LorimarIron
All Woods
Marble
PedanStone
LizardScales
ToppelCotton
Sultan'sSilk
All Aerolites

I'll revise the QuickRecipe file as soon as I can.
Thank you, Biquts!  I didn't really mean for the QuickRecipe to be 
anything spectacular, but I might as well do my best.

X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=116656188
X-Yahoo-Profile: tagged_jc

You will find Mana Spirits at Boss Locations after you've beaten that 
boss.  For example, return to Du'Inke's room in the Mekiv Caverns, or 
to the Lorant Tablelands of Luon Highway (where you fought Mantis 
Ant).  You will find Spirits in these places if you have an 
instrument available (not equipped), and have finished Magical 
Instruments 101.  You might also have to enter these areas a number 
of times before the Spirits will come out.

Message-ID: <b6knsm+h7io@eGroups.com>
In-Reply-To: <b6kfa9+pvbq@eGroups.com>

MIME-Version: 1.0

Content-Length: 1689
X-Mailer: Yahoo Groups Message Poster
From: "JC Riles" <tagged_jc@yahoo.com>
X-Originating-IP: 24.67.253.204
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=116656188
X-Yahoo-Profile: tagged_jc

You'll have to do "Magical Instruments 101" before you can find 
Spirits.
To open this event, place the AF Sand Rose (from either "Faeries' 
Light" or "Huntin' Du'Cate") and complete "Reach for the Stars" --- 
don't leave during that Event, however, or you'll fail it, and won't 
be able to start "Magical Instruments 101" this time through.
Then, return to your workshops to start "Magical Instruments 101".  
You'll learn how to catch Spirits once you've found them.  When 
you've finished, be sure to tell Li'l Cactus about it, as this is an 
Event that stays completed even in a New Game +, so this would be 
your only chance to have it recorded in the Cactus Diaries.
Finally, once that Event is done, you may catch Spirits.

Received: from unknown (66.218.66.216)
  by m14.grp.scd.yahoo.com with QMQP; 20 Apr 2003 23:00:45 -0000
Received: from unknown (HELO n22.grp.scd.yahoo.com) (66.218.66.78)
  by mta1.grp.scd.yahoo.com with SMTP; 20 Apr 2003 23:00:44 -0000
Received: from [66.218.67.149] by n22.grp.scd.yahoo.com with NNFMP; 20 Apr 2003 23:00:44 -0000
Date: Sun, 20 Apr 2003 23:00:44 -0000
To: LoM_Kitchen@yahoogroups.com
Subject: Re: attack power increasment
Message-ID: <b7v8qs+gpc9@eGroups.com>
In-Reply-To: <20030415231228.63848.qmail@web21003.mail.yahoo.com>
User-Agent: eGroups-EW/0.82
MIME-Version: 1.0
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=ISO-8859-1
Content-Length: 762
X-Mailer: Yahoo Groups Message Poster
From: "JC Riles" <tagged_jc@yahoo.com>
X-Originating-IP: 24.67.253.204
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=116656188
X-Yahoo-Profile: tagged_jc

First:

int(MaterialStat * modifier)  --- For all four MaterialStats, and all 
four modifiers (three Cards, and the last item tempered).
If the result is over 255, it becomes 255.
Then:

int( MaterialStat * (Essenses + Growth Control)/Growth Control )  --- 
For all four MaterialStats.
Then:

int( MaterialStat * WeaponStat / 128 )  --- For all four Material and 
WeaponStats (paired accordingly).
Then:

Attack Power = SharpResult + HeavyResult + ForceResult + TechResult

Voila!

--- In LoM_Kitchen@yahoogroups.com, Cid Kramer <joker_balade@y...>

I'm in the process of creating a LOM website that will offer a one-
stop, decent looking, helpful guide on how to play and complete LOM.

Here's the url: http://lom.solardreamstudios.com/

The site is still in beta development and it will contain the 
following features:

- Complete Walkthrough including AF Placement. Obviously there are 
multiple ways to complete the game but I will offer a single 
solution. It will allow the user to finish all of the Events, find 
all of the wandering Pets, and obtain all of the levels of material 
from the shops.

- Encyclopedia details including scanned images from the Ultimania 
Guide. So far, I will offer a complete Bestiary with images, 
Produce/Meat info with images, Mystic Card images, and Character 
details with images.

I'm playing through the game on my PC with the ePSXe emulator and I 
will take screenshots along the way.

In the future I will offer a PDF of each page of the site as well as 
a complete PDF with all of the pages.

Hopefully this will benefit the LOM community. If anyone has any 
ideas or comments, please send them my way.

Thanks for your time and assistance.

I was looking over the material properties list and I noticed that 
the hides and skins (Animal Hide, GatorSkin, CentaurHide, DragonSkin) 
all had very low (1) heavy, force, and tech values, but much higher 
value in slash.  I thought this was very unusual since the hides and 
skins make decent gloves and they have a power multiple of 0 for 
Slash and multiple of 56 for Tech.

Is it possible the values for Tech and Slash are transposed for skins 
and hides?  If that is the case the values for the fabrics 
(ToppleCotton, Sultan'sSilk, JuddHemp, AltenaFelt) and other 
materials as well (I think it is odd that things like Adamantite and 
Fullmetal should have a higher Tech value then Slash).

Who came up with the list and how did they arrive at the values 
(which is still awesome, just confusing)?

sable

It was taken directly from charts in the game, by someone I don't 
remember the name of.  They did a rom-dump and took the values right 
out.
I know that ToppelCotton, at least, is correct --- if you make a 
ToppelCotton Flail, you'll see that it'll have 0 Attack Power.

Also note that the order is Sharp, Heavy, Force, and Tech.  :) Not 
Slash, really.
Well, you can call it whatever you want, but the Mystic Card Database 
calls "Slash" "Sharp" when dealing with Weapon Properties.

I've not noticed hides and skins giving decent gloves - I would 
suspect that the gloves would have 0 Attack Power.

That chart does bother me, though, but in a different area than what 
you're thinking:

Marble.  12 / 2 / 21 / 16

It's very bizarre how Marble's lowest stat is Heavy.  I wonder why 
this is?  Would Marble then make a really crappy hammer?

This is either a fault of me, the original rom-dumper, or the 
translators (or even the programmers themselves)...  I don't know.
I'd have to check whether hides make decent gloves and whether marble 
makes a decent hammer...

  ----- Original Message ----- 
  From: sonkoronsk

  Subject: [LoM Kitchen] a little help here please


  i'm new to lom. and have no clue what to do when i'm tempering 
  weapons.. i keep getting these damn pixies...any suggestions ?


  Well, to stop getting pixies I would recommend not tempering any more eyes into your equipment. I'm pretty sure that that's all that gives pixie cards.

  For tempering in general, I would reccomend going to www.gamefaqs.com and reading MarcusMajarra's tempering FAQ. It's incorrect on a few points, but it's by far the best FAQ out there.

  If you have any more specific questions, feel free to ask them here.

  Shiyala

To: LoM_Kitchen@yahoogroups.com
Subject: Re: Stop the Pixies!
Message-ID: <b9jvrp+n20f@eGroups.com>
In-Reply-To: <000501c31740$3c8375e0$00464518@ca.shawcable.net>
User-Agent: eGroups-EW/0.82
MIME-Version: 1.0
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=ISO-8859-1
Content-Length: 1139
X-Mailer: Yahoo Groups Message Poster
From: "JC Riles" <tagged_jc@yahoo.com>
X-Originating-IP: 24.67.253.204
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=116656188
X-Yahoo-Profile: tagged_jc

The following items create Pixie Cards:
Sleepy Eye
Blank Eye
Creepy Eye
Angry Eye
Silly Eye
Dangerous Eye
Rust
Knockout Dust
Poison Powder
Sleepy Powder
Stinky Breath

So if you can avoid it, don't use these items.  If you do, however, 
get a Pixie on your equipment, you can remove it only in two 
different ways.
The first is to add Holy Water or Garlicrown to your item when 
there's a Pixie in Slot 3 --- Holy Water and Garlicrown remove the 
stickiness of a Pixie Card for a single turn, allowing the Pixie Card 
to leave as normal.
The second is to add the Ragnarok Card.  You can't do this if all 
four Slots are Pixie Cards (ie. even the invisible slot is stuck as a 
Pixie card), but if you have three or less Pixie Cards, you can do 
this on any non-Wood item.  First, make sure you have Salamander, 
Gnome, Jinn, and Undine all at least 1.  Then, simply add a Pine 
o'Clock and then any item, and all of the Pixie Cards should turn 
into their corresponding Evil God Cards.  Since Evil God Cards do not 
stick, you can boot them off normally.

Unless you're fairly good at tempering, the first method is obviously 
reccomended.

Content-type: text/plain; charset=iso-8859-1
Content-transfer-encoding: 7BIT


  ----- Original Message ----- 
  From: mrjap23 
  To: LoM_Kitchen@yahoogroups.com 
  Sent: Saturday, May 10, 2003 10:35 PM
  Subject: [LoM Kitchen] Weapons, armors and accesories tempering questions...


  1) Could someone provide me with recipes for tempering weapons (spear 
  and bow) and armors (haurbek, full armor, ring, boots and helmet) 
  good enough to beat Nightmare mode?
  Not me, sorry. Wait until someone who can help with this signs on, I guess.


  2) Is it possible to create/temper a ForbiddenRing and/or a 
  ReviveRing?

  Yes. MarcusMajarra's FAQ has recipes for these.

  3) It is possible to increase the defensive power of a Captain's 
  Helm? When I temper something into it the defensive power drops.

  Most enemy equipment drops have artificially high attack/defense values. When you first temper an enemy drop, the attack/defense drops down to its normal value. After that, you must temper it like a normal item to improve it. I have no recipes.

  4) Which is the best material for weapons and/or armors?

  I think for armour, it's AltenaAlloy for all stats except magic defense, and Adamantite for magic defense. For MOST weapon types, Adamantite is the best with little tempering, DragonScales is the best with moderate tempering, and DiorWood is the best with max essences.

  5) What's the Draupnir Ring good for? Can you improve it by tempering?

  I think it makes enemies drop more money. You can improve the defense power by tempering, but if I remember correctly, it's made of OakWood like all the other starting effect rings, and therefore cannot achieve defense powers even considered "decent", let alone "good".

  6) Do you have any tips on improving my chances of getting DiorWood, 
  DrangonScale and Adamantine?

  Get a Polterbox.

  7) Is LorimalIron the best material I can buy?

  I think so.

  Any help will be appreciated. 

  Hope I helped!
  Shiyala





        Yahoo! Groups Sponsor 
       
       

  If you really don't want to be a part of the Group anymore, simply email to:
  LoM_Kitchen-unsubscribe@yahoogroups.com 

  Your use of Yahoo! Groups is subject to the Yahoo! Terms of Service. 

--Boundary_(ID_XXZj4mYd6lf2hJ/DzT3qyg)

  ----- Original Message ----- 
  From: will gatlin 
  To: lom_kitchen@yahoogroups.com 
  Sent: Sunday, May 11, 2003 8:02 AM
  Subject: [LoM Kitchen] raisin pets ???


  I just got my first polterbox... now what???
  I've been looking for what produce gives luck, but i've had no luck 
  acutally getting the produce I need.
  The only one that I have got is mush-in-a-box, and it seems not to 
  help the polterbox luck at all.
  Anyone know seed placement for rare or very rare +luck produce.

  Dialaurel, Gold Clover, Squalphin, Toadstoolshed, Pine O' Clock.

  Secondly, whats the best personality for a polterbox?


  Actually, luck is completely useless on a polterbox. It only benefits from the luck if it makes the kill, and then it doesn't benefit from the synchro.

  The best personalities would be Friendly and Lonely, which will make the box stand closer to you, and therefore more likely to be standing next to you when you finish the enemy.

  Shiyala

--Boundary_(ID_uNpavnFyl4pQvEzFY0JYCQ)

> Second,  after I added my ele coins to my sword with sulfer, 
> mercury, glow stones , chaos stones, etc... I had some left over 
sun 
> and moon stones..any uses for these that could be helpfull?..

Well, you can hang onto them and use them on a Bow for the Lunar Shot 
and Solar Flare Plunge Attacks --- or simply use them to raise Wisp 
and Shade, respectively, without creating a Wisp/Shade Card (though, 
this has limited uses, since they won't benefit from Wizard Cards).

> Also,  after washing my weapon i used 4 holy waters to produce the 
> clerics, any advice on why the bumpkins that create the clown cards 
> lower the weapons dmg instead of increasing it.. I thought the 
clown 
> cards act as clerics ,when there used behind clerics...

Actually, Clown Cards (if you look at the Database) raise Sharp by 
50%, and lower Heavy by 50%.  Meanwhile, Cleric Cards lower Sharp by 
50%, and raise Heavy by 50%.
Thus, it depends on your weapon.  If you're using, say, a spear...
If you use 4 Holy Waters, you might find your attack power is WORSE 
than it was before!  This is because the highest value was reduced to 
very small (Sharp), and the lowest value was raised a little bit 
(Heavy, since it doesn't have much to start with).
Then, if you add 4 Bumpkins, the Attack Power would raise back up to 
normal, and then go up even more, since Sharp is then being raise and 
Heavy being lowered, when there is more Clown Cards than Cleric Cards.
Theoretically, have a Clown Card AND a Cleric Card should produce no 
change whatsoever in weapon stats, since they cancel each other out.  
However, since rounding is involved, it might end up being very 
slightly less or greater in some isolated situations.

Generally:
3x Cleric, Giant's Horn for Heavy.
3x Clown, Sharp Claw for Sharp.
3x Volcano, Scissors for Force.
And Poison Fang for Tech (;_; There's no +50% Tech Card!)

Actually, it's not missing.  It's under "Clown".

The Clown, King, Princess, and Wolf Cards all have no picture at 
all.  So, I didn't want to upload the picture multiple times for no 
reason.  [Also, the dummy Card "Horse" has no picture, either.]

Likewise, the Nymph of Orchards, Nymph of Dawn, and Sacrificed Nymph 
all have the same picture, and so I catalogued it under Nymph of Dawn.

Likewise, the Tower and Metropolis Cards both have the same picture, 
and so I catalogued it under Tower.

Likewise, the Spirit (of Shoes) and Spirit (of Mountain) have the 
same picture, catalogued under Spirit (of Shoes).

Likewise, the Spirit (of Housework), Spirit (of Ocean), and Spirit 
(of Forest) all have the same picture, catalogued under Spirit (of 
Ocean).

But actually, there IS a missing Card --- that card is Pixie (blue 
hat).  If you can get that picture, please tell me.  :) I'd like to 
complete my collection.

To: LoM_Kitchen@yahoogroups.com
Subject: Without Varnishing?
Message-ID: <b9rr67+gg9v@eGroups.com>
In-Reply-To: <b9rqus+gg3t@eGroups.com>
User-Agent: eGroups-EW/0.82
MIME-Version: 1.0
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=ISO-8859-1
Content-Length: 1045
X-Mailer: Yahoo Groups Message Poster
From: "JC Riles" <tagged_jc@yahoo.com>
X-Originating-IP: 24.67.253.204
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=116656188
X-Yahoo-Profile: tagged_jc

There's only two ways to raise a weapon's attack power - Varnish 
(that is, change the material properties temporarily to improve the 
stats, by raising something that is large and lowering something that 
is small) and raise Essenses (that is, increase the attack power by 
changing the Growth Control Multiplier).

The Growth Control Multiplier is (GC + Essenses)/GC.  Thus, each 
Essense multiplies your attack power by 1/GC.

Thus, if you add essenses equal to your GC, your attack power should 
double from the original amount.
Since IshePlatinum Swords are from 30-50 power (I can't recall 
exactly; what are they really?), you'll need to add 18 Essenses to 
get it to 60-100, and 36 Essenses to get it to 120-200.

> sword without varnishing .... anyone got any advice on getting the 
> dmg even higher without varnishing ....

To: LoM_Kitchen@yahoogroups.com
Subject: IshePlatinum
Message-ID: <b9ss61+3amv@eGroups.com>
In-Reply-To: <b9siss+10m2j@eGroups.com>
User-Agent: eGroups-EW/0.82
MIME-Version: 1.0

Content-Length: 1965
X-Mailer: Yahoo Groups Message Poster
From: "JC Riles" <tagged_jc@yahoo.com>
X-Originating-IP: 24.67.253.204
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=116656188
X-Yahoo-Profile: tagged_jc

The quality of IshePlatinum isn't all that great, as it is topped in 
raw stats by LorimarIron and AltenaAlloy in the metals, and is topped 
in Growth Control by LorantSilver in the metals.  However, it's still 
easily possible to make strong (that is, 100+ attack power) weapons 
out of it.

Regarding Wisp and Shade.  You do realize that Wizard Cards lower the 
energy cost to raise certain Essenses, correct?  Well, since Wisp and 
Shade's Resistance is 7 on IshePlatinum, adding a single Wizard Card 
will reduce this Resistance to 3, while adding two or more Wizard 
Cards reduces it to 1.
The problem with Wisp and Shade, however, are that ONLY Wisp and 
Shade TPs that come from Wisp and Shade Cards that appear AFTER 
(chronologically speaking) the Wizard Card.

Thus, Wisp/Sorcerer/Sorcerer would count Wisp as being Resistance 1, 
while Sorcerer/Sorcerer/Wisp would count Wisp as being Resistance 7.  
That's a huge difference.  Note that TPs added by items are NOT given 
the benefit of Wizard Cards.  Thus, a Wisp/Shade TP can never be 
affected by three Wizard Cards, since the only way to do that would 
be to have four Cards at once (three Wizards, plus a Wisp/Shade Card).

Energy Cost for Resistance-1 to get to X level:
1, 2, 4, 8, 16, 32, 64, 128, 256, 512

Thus, it's possible to get to level 9 (256 energy) using a leaving 
Nymph of Dawn, and possible to get to level 7 (64 energy) using 
Cardless Tempering.
Add the following to a raw piece of IshePlatinum:
2 Mercury
1 Shade Silver [Shade 1
1 Glow Crystal [Shade 2
3 Meat [Shade 5 ; Meat give 16 energy
1 Electricity [Shade 6; Electricity gives 32 energy
1 Flaming Quill [Shade 7 ; Flaming Quill gives 64 energy
3 Glow Crystal
2 Mercury
1 Shade Silver
1 Card-Making Item [Shade 8 ; leaving Nymph of Dawn gives 192 energy
1 Gold Coin [Shade 9 ; any element except Wisp

Do the same if you'd like to raise Wisp, except replace Mercury with 
Sulpher, Shade with Wisp, and Wisp with Shade.

^__^

X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=116656188
X-Yahoo-Profile: tagged_jc

Considering money is easy to get, and armor doesn't have to be 
extensively tempered to have good defenses...  Try different 
materials.

Dragonscales (unbuyable, of course) makes the best physical defense 
armor (except Pierce Defense, which Adamantite and Fullmetal are 
better at -- but Dragonscales has the best other two phsyical 
defenses, and still very high Pierce Defense).

Adamantite makes the best magical defense armor.

So, your best bet is to wear a Dragonscales Armor (full armor), and 
then two Adamantite Rings or Pendants, with the effects/immunities 
you'd like.  The pendant should have all status immunities, and one 
of the two should have Salamander essense (the other two armors 
wouldn't; they'd have to have 0 for Bed of Thorn for boosted 
defense, though they might have a Heaven's Scale to allow healing 
still).

*shrugs*

X-Yahoo-Profile: tagged_jc

Take any material you wish, and add the following:
1 Non-Spiny Seed
2 Needle(ttuce)
1 Springanana
1 Creepy Eye

That's about as good, defensively, as your piece of armor will get 
(except I'm making sure you'll be able to heal, by giving it the 
Heaven's Scale effect; beware, you won't revive if you die).

Use any material you wish.  Tempering armor is quick, easy, and 
done.  Unless you're making rings (and you want to add Special 
Effects or +20 bonuses) or Pendants (for Status Immunities).

There are two Cards under the "Beast" category: Unicorn and Phoenix.  
They are actually the "Beast God" Cards, but I don't think either are 
really Gods.

You might be thinking of the Evil God Card, "Beast-Headed God".

X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=22685443
X-Yahoo-Profile: nano_biquts

> main question is i know you have to use ancient moon to raise the 
> essense of aura when dryad is present...
That is only true if wisp/shade aren't in balance. Since they're 
both zero aura/dryad should raise without interfering with each 
other. Ie. you don't need ancient moons at this point.


> with the res of 7 7 8 8 8 8 8 8 on ishplat... can you get say aura 
> to 5 while dryad is 6 than keep adding auras to add to the tp 
> without the ancient moon being present then add it when the aura
> is at it's tp?
I'm not sure I understand exactly what you mean. But if you had 
shade>wisp then aura TP would drain dryad, so you would want to add 
the ancient moon first to prevent this from happening.

18 | 50 50 50 50 | 50 50 50 50 |
10 10 10 10 10 10 10 10 | 
AltenaAlloy

14 | 60 66 54 54 | 72 72 44 30 |
7  7  7  7  6  7  7  7 | 
DragonScales

is better in everyway and theres an uber recipe for it on this site.

~10% improvement over the max without using them.
You'd only need to beat the game 4 times to get 16 pieces.

But if you just want a functional weapon made fast use the quick 
recipe on dragonscale and you'll have more power than you need to 
finish the game easily.

X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=116656188
X-Yahoo-Profile: tagged_jc

On Dragonscales, without using Mirrored World at all, it's possible 
to get, at least:
15/15/15/15/12/9/12/9 = 102

I think...

I could write a recipe for that, if you really want >_> (please don't 
really want).

You won't be able to get to 15/15/15/14/9/15/9/15 = 107 without 
Mirrored World, as far as I know, since then you'll have to use Upper-
Row consumptions, and those will require Mirrored World utilized to 
drain the upper row in the right places at the right time..

X-Yahoo-Profile: tagged_jc

The Recipe Book is free for anyone to use, if they wish, so long as 
the results posted are correct (or close to being correct; there's 
some little problems with the Uberrecipes, but they're mostly 
fixable...).

As far as Bed of Thorn and Yggdrasil goes, remember a few things:
First, if Bed of Thorn isn't present, you have to make sure there's 
no World Cards present when you try to add Yggdrasil.  If there's an 
Ancient Moon, or Ragnarok, or any other World Card present when Bed 
of Thorn isn't, when you try to add Yggdrasil, it won't add anything.
Second, Yggdrasil requires 5 Dryad.  Make sure Dryad is at least 5.
Bed of Thorn requires that Dryad be at least 1, so it's not all that 
hard to add.  However, it requires that Salamander = 0, so you can't 
raise Salamander if you want to have Bed of Thorn present.
Does that help?

Well, adding:

Chaos Crystal
Glow Crystal
Undine Gold
Mercury <- This is when the Nymph of Dawn leaves!!
Mercury

What you want, is to have Ancient Moon present, AND two Witch Cards, 
AND Nymph of Dawn leaving, AND adding an Undine Gold.  Rather than 
having no Wizard Cards present with an Undine Card when the Nymph of 
Dawn leaves...

Let's see..
With Resistance 9/6/3/1...
Getting to level 6 requires 288/192/96/32 energy... so, really, 
that's going overboard.  You only need to have three Wizard Cards, 
Ancient Moon, and add an Undine TP that gives at least 32 energy.
So, do it like this:

Chaos Crystal
3 Mercury
1 Undine Silver

That should get you to level 6.  Now, to get it to level 7, you need 
576/384/192/64 energy.  So, really, it's going overboard to use Nymph 
of Dawn.  You only need to have three Wizard Cards, Ancient Moon, and 
add an Undine TP that gives at least 64 energy.
So, do it like this:

Chaos Crystal
3 Mercury
1 Undine Gold

That should get you to level 7.

To: LoM_Kitchen@yahoogroups.com
Subject: Re: Definitions
Message-ID: <bak64v+tfhb@eGroups.com>
In-Reply-To: <bajjq0+a5ie@eGroups.com>
User-Agent: eGroups-EW/0.82
MIME-Version: 1.0
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=ISO-8859-1
Content-Length: 2251
X-Mailer: Yahoo Groups Message Poster
From: "JC Riles" <tagged_jc@yahoo.com>
X-Originating-IP: 24.67.253.204
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=116656188
X-Yahoo-Profile: tagged_jc

TP = Tainting Point.  All Essense Cards, and some items (namely 
Coins), contain Tainting Points.  Each Tainting Point allows that 
essense to raise a singple point, provided there's enough energy to 
do so.  The energy required to raise to the next level is dependant 
on the level, the number of wizard cards, and the material's 
resistance.

Energy = All items contain energy, and you can also get energy from 
draining or from a leaving Nymph of Dawn Card.  You need energy to 
raise essenses to the next level.

GC = Growth Control.  This is only relevent when dealing with attack 
power.  This is the number that will determine how much each point of 
essenses will raise the overall attack power.  The lower the Growth 
Control the better.

Shade and Wisp are special.  Wisp can always raise - it never needs 
Ancient Moon to level up.  Shade, however, can not rise if Wisp is 
present.  Therefore, it is best to raise Shade up as high as you can 
go, and then raise Wisp afterwards.  Why?  Because if you raise Shade 
a little bit, and then raise Wisp, you can't raise Shade anymore.  
And, in addition, if Wisp>Shade at any point, Shade will drain to 0.

Dryad and Aura are also special, since their dominance depends on 
Shade and Wisp.  If Shade > Wisp, then Aura will drain Dyrad (and 
Dryad can't rise if Aura is present).  If Wisp > Shade, then Dryad 
will drain Aura (and Aura can't rise if Dryad is present).  If Shade 
= Wisp, then you can raise either Dryad or Aura, without any penalty 
whatsoever.

Does this help?

To: LoM_Kitchen@yahoogroups.com
Subject: Re: Shade and Wisp
Message-ID: <balo63+ofqr@eGroups.com>
In-Reply-To: <bakk1b+3vn2@eGroups.com>
User-Agent: eGroups-EW/0.82
MIME-Version: 1.0
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=ISO-8859-1
Content-Length: 1988
X-Mailer: Yahoo Groups Message Poster
From: "JC Riles" <tagged_jc@yahoo.com>
X-Originating-IP: 24.67.253.204
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=116656188
X-Yahoo-Profile: tagged_jc

Under Mirrored World, Shade and Wisp dominance reverse.
So, Shade can always rise no matter what, and Wisp can't rise if 
Shade is present.  Also, if Shade > Wisp, and there's either a Wisp 
TP or a Shade TP present, Wisp will drain to 0.
Under Mirrored World, if Shade > Wisp then Dryad will drain Aura 
(rather than the other way around), and Aura won't be able to rise if 
Dryad is present.  If Wisp > Shade, Aura dominates Dryad.

You don't ever need Mirrored World, except to pull of some powerful 
draining techniques.  You can use Ancient Moon to raise things that 
are in conflict.
So, you can rase Shade->Aura->Wisp->Dryad->Salmander->Jinn without 
using anything special, since none of them conflict (so long as you 
don't raise Wisp higher than Shade).  Then you can raise Undine-
>Gnome with Ancient Moon.

That doesn't even use consumptions!  :)

Oh, you can also trade items to yourself using a third-party save, 
you know.  That way, you can save one file before tempering, and one 
after, and then trade the item from the one after to the Dummy Save, 
and then from the Dummy Save to your main file, and have a tempered 
item without using any Mirror Pieces whatsoever.

Dragonscale is resistance 7 on everything, so here's some energy 
costs:
7, 14, 28, 56, 112, 224, 448

Since you can't get 448 energy normally, you'll have to reduce the 
resistance with Wizard Cards.  Resistance 7 turns to 3/1/1.
3, 6, 12, 24, 48, 96, 192

You can get 192 energy just from a Nymph of Dawn leaving.  And, if 
you use two or three Wizard Cards.
1, 2, 4, 8, 16, 32, 64

You can get 64 energy from many different items!

So, here's what you can do to raise something up to 7.

Wizard-Item
Wizard-Item
Coin
Any Card-Making Item
1 Gold Clover (or any other 64 energy cardless item)

Since that has two Wizard Cards, you only need 64 energy to get to 
7... And it goes to whichever element Coin you added, since that's 
where the TP goes.  This won't be what you use for Undine/Gnome, 
since they'll require Ancient Moon.  For them, you'd go:

Chaos Crystal
Wizard Item
Wizard Item
Coin
1 Gold Coin (of any essense)

Use a Gold Coin of an essense you've already raised, of course, or 
simply use a Gold Coin of the essense you're raising (and you can 
replace the first Coin with Any Card-Making Item if that's the 
case).  Since Gold Coins give 64 energy, and Chaos Crystal works the 
turn it leaves, you can use this to have two Wizard Cards present, 
while giving the energy to a TP that's on a Card.

When you're raising Wisp/Shade, make sure the Wizard Cards come on 
before the Essense card, or they won't be counted, making you require 
448 energy to get to the next level, again.

X-Yahoo-Profile: tagged_jc

To get the most energy, on Dragonscales, you have to have a Nymph of 
Dawn leaving, two Wizard Cards, and be adding a Gold Coin (or, for 
even more energy, a Glow Crystal, but you can't have any TPs if you 
need Ancient Moon on as well, so...).

So, to do so, you need to do the following:
4 Glow Crystal (so the next Wizard-items won't knock out the last 
Nymph of Dawn)
2 Wizard-items
1 Chaos Crystal
1 Gold Coin

Let's look at the energy requirements on resistance 7/3/1/1 with two 
Wizard Cards:
1, 2, 4, 8, 16, 32, 64, 128, 256, 512

Going from 7->8 requires 128 energy, which can be done using a Silver 
Coin.
Going from 8->9 requires 256 energy, which is exactly as much as a 
Leaving Nymph of Dawn (192) and a Gold Coin (64) give, total.  So you 
can get to 9, and no greater.
Going from 9->10 requires 512 energy... so even if you could have 
Nymph of Dawn leaving (192) and add a Glow Crystal (96), you would 
still not have enough energy (288 < 512).

So, 9 is the highest you can ever get without consumptions.

It's done by formula, really.  The resistance with another Wizard 
Card is:
Old Resistance divided by four, rounded down (or 1).
The result times three.

So, resistance 8 becomes 6, then 3, then 1.
Resistance 7, on the other hand, becomes 3, then 1, then 1.

Resistance 32 becomes 24, then 18, then 12.

The formlua for energy-required-at-level is:
Resistance * 2 ^ (Current Level)

MMajarra's charts assume that no energy requirement can go less than 
8.  This isn't true - you can drain less than eight energy, and it 
still raises some resistances and not others.  Resistance 6, going 
from 1 to 0, gives 6 energy.  It can raise another Resistance 6 from 
0 to 1, but it can't raise a Resistance 7 from 0 to 1.  If you had 
the right TPs, it could raise two Resistance 3's from 0 to 1...  :)

There are only four mirror pieces each runthrough.
They can be found:
Birdcage Lighthouse (Madora Beach)
The Underworld
Bejewelled City
The Mana Tree

Date: Fri, 30 May 2003 08:20:42 -0000
To: LoM_Kitchen@yahoogroups.com
Subject: Re: Card Item
Message-ID: <bb748q+ift1@eGroups.com>
In-Reply-To: <bb6sii+roqh@eGroups.com>
User-Agent: eGroups-EW/0.82
MIME-Version: 1.0
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=ISO-8859-1
Content-Length: 793
X-Mailer: Yahoo Groups Message Poster
From: "JC Riles" <tagged_jc@yahoo.com>
X-Originating-IP: 24.67.253.204
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=116656188
X-Yahoo-Profile: tagged_jc

A "Card-Item" is simply any item that creates a Card.  Examples 
include Lilipods, Bumpkins, Loquat Shoes, Pear o'Heels, Hairball, and 
others.  When "Card-Item" is referred to in a recipe, it usually 
doesn't mean to use Coins or Crystals - these might interfere with 
what else is going on (although, they might not always).  It is also 
a bad idea to use Eyes or any other Pixie-creating items: Pixies are 
a pain to get rid of once they're on a piece of equipment.  If you 
want to be really sure, use Lilipods.  Lilipods creates the 
completely harmless Enticed Nymph and also provides little energy, so 
it can't really get in the way.

--- In LoM_Kitchen@yahoogroups.com, "markage08" <markage08@y...>

> pendant?

Yes- if there's a Yggdrasil present (and no Dying Earth or Evil God 
Card - which will cancel out the +1 of the Yggdrasil Card), and you 
add a cardless item, each bonus will increase by [+1] up to the 
Limitation.  Since Yggdrasil's Limitations are -5~+10 (the highest 
other than a couple Heaven God Cards [which only do certain stats], 
the Evil God Cards, and Clown + Metropolis), you can increase your 
stats up to +10 all by simply adding a single Spiny Seed.

--- In LoM_Kitchen@yahoogroups.com, "cb3itsme" <cb3itsme@h...> wrote:
> <I>Every time you add something, and the Yggdrasil Card remains on 
> your item, you'll get [+1] to all of your stats.</I>
> 
> Ok, i've made many weapons while tempering and i know a bit about 
> it, although i need to learn a few more tips still. I was browsing 
> the files and in one the quote above was there. Does this mean i 
> could add cardless items to gain +1 without bumping the Yggdrasil 
> card off?

X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=116656188
X-Yahoo-Profile: tagged_jc

Yes; however, you can't transfer Mirror Pieces themselves.  Here's 
how it goes:
You have GAME A and GAME Z, which are both different games that have 
access to Prof. Bomb's Pawn Shop.  GAME A has Mirror Pieces and a 
tempering workshop.
Take GAME A and save it (let's call this new save GAME B).
Now, temper your item using the Mirror Pieces.  Put the item up for 
sale at Bomb's Pawn Shop.  Save over GAME A (but leave GAME B the way 
it was).
Now, load up GAME Z.  Go to the Pawn Shop and buy the item.  Now, 
sell it again.  Save over GAME Z if you don't mind the Lucre loss, 
otherwise, save as GAME Y.
Now, load up GAME B.  Buy the item from GAME Y/Z.  You now have an 
item that you tempered Mirror Pieces into, but still have all of the 
Mirror Pieces in your inventory.

There's no need to do this for items that are easily obtained, like 
Glow Crystals, but it's quite useful for Mirror Pieces.

--- In LoM_Kitchen@yahoogroups.com, "cb3itsme" <cb3itsme@h...> wrote:
> Lets say you have 4 mirror pieces, You need 16 for the Uber 
recipes, 
> couldn't you have a third party save and you could use the junkyard 
> to transfer over use the mirror pieces there then transfer back and 
> rince and repeat...people use it to temper without using items so 
> couldn't you do this with anything, ie glow crystals

After the last Piece is pushed in, the essence levels should be like this: 

Wisp 7: Shade7: Dryad 11: Aura 9: Salamander 11: Gnome 9: Jinn 12 : Undine 8

Next add two lilypods and then your plunge attacks and then add X spiny seed then your main power up cards. Example: Holy water for swords, or bumpkin for spears and bows, or ash for axes; you get the picture

<P class=MsoNormal><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 12pt; mso-bidi-font-size: 10.0pt">After the last Piece is pushed in, the essence levels should be like this: <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>
<P class=MsoNormal><SPAN lang=FR style="FONT-SIZE: 12pt; mso-bidi-font-size: 10.0pt; mso-ansi-language: FR">Wisp 7: Shade7: Dryad 11: Aura 9: Salamander 11: Gnome 9: Jinn 12&nbsp;: Undine 8</SPAN></P>
<P class=MsoNormal><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 12pt; mso-bidi-font-size: 10.0pt">Next add two lilypods and then your plunge attacks and then add X spiny seed then your main power up cards. Example: Holy water for swords, or bumpkin for spears and bows, or ash for axes; you get the picture<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P></DIV><p><hr SIZE=1>

I suggest you look in the Recipe Book.
RECIPE #4 is a powerfully Magic-Defensive Pendant with all status 
immunities and all elemental resistances, and +20 all.
RECIPE #3 is a ring or gauntlet with +20 all.
And it's easy to make good Armor.  Take a hunk of Dragonscales, add 
the following:
1 Any Seed
2 Needle(ttuce)
1 Springanana
1 Creepy Eye / Dangerous Eye

Using the Springanana instead of the third Needlettuce makes it so 
you can regenerate HP.  You could also sacrifice defense for +20 all, 
but you'd only have a single Bed of Thorn then...

20, for an essense level?  That's impossible.  Entirely, completely 
impossible.
Even if you had infinite energy, you can only ever raise an essense 
to 15.  It's a half-byte per essense, leaving you with any number 
from 0 to F [15].
Bows can't 'cause all stats', either...

First i'd like to say that something terrible happened to me a few 
days ago. my playstation was struck by lighting during a 
thunderstorm near my home. so not only was the playstation ruined 
but the memmory cards were ruined, so I bought myself a new ps2 and 
started lom all over again.

Now knowing quite a bit more about the game than I did the first 
time around. I decided to contact a few of my friends who played the 
game a few years ago, and ask for a bit of info on a small project I 
wanted to do. This is how it turned out.

First i'd like to say this recipe started as the ubberrecipe found 
on this site, but we undertook it as a way to make the best weapon 
(no future mode) as we could the first time thru the game.

So basicly we cut it down to only 3 mirror pieces, but we ended up 
with a dragonscale 2h sword with 920 dmg 93 total essences (shade-9)
9 to all stats on the first time thru.

This recipe is a little less expensive than the recipe that Timothy 
Hughes posted. We only ended up using about 150,880 lucre.(btw tim 
thx for the info on the dior wood recipe. I might have to take you 
up on that offer, and see if I can cut down the price on making the 
dior wood items.) 

First the land placement is a must the first time around we used the 
land placement guide found on this site 
(http://db.gamefaqs.com/console/psx/file/legend_of_mana_map_a.txt)
*for the newbies like me or worse off than me, i'd recommend reading 
thru the entire guide on this site.* If you already know a bit about 
it scroll down to the Map A: Symmetry At Its Best section, that is 
the map we used. Its very important to using this for the essences 
coins + the forging items you'll need namely dragon scales.

If anyone has a better way of getting the coins + forging items in 
the first game ( dior wood, dragon scales altena alloy etc ).

I'll be either emailing the recipe to jc.Or posting it on the site 
after it's overlooked by a mod to see if it can be better made.

Thx... SonK   Ex-lom newbie w/a cause  ^_^

Content-Length: 995
X-Mailer: Yahoo Groups Message Poster
From: "JC Riles" <tagged_jc@yahoo.com>
X-Originating-IP: 24.67.253.204
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=116656188
X-Yahoo-Profile: tagged_jc

"Pokemon Level Modifier Code" actually would go up to 255 (FF), since 
Pokemon's levels can be anywhere from 0 to 255.  It's just that, in 
the game, there's a limit up to 100 - at that point, the program 
takes over and prevents it from going any higher.  If you have a 
Pokemon at level 101, you can level it up to 255, and then it will 
loop back around to level 0.
However, in LoM, the data for each essense can <i>only</i> be from 0 
to 15.  If you have another value there, then there's some kind of 
mistake.  Because there's only four bits allocated to each essense, 
and '1111' in binary is 15.

--- In LoM_Kitchen@yahoogroups.com, "Timothy Hughes" 
<sandrock901@y...> wrote:
> From what I know all of the cheat devices use 0-F(0-15)too, so how 
did

I've made a 100 essences dragonscale spear without mirror pieces.
15/15/14/14/12/9/12/9
Here are the key steps
wisp/shade/dryad/aura (is that the right order?)
0/14/14/0->0/15/13/1 
14/15/13/1->15/15/12/2

I think you need 5 mirror pieces to get 107
0/0/14/14
0/1/14/14->0/1/13/15
1/1/13/15->1/1/14/15
Then use a mirror to get rid of wisp, so shade will raise normally.
0/14/14/15->0/14/15/14->0/15/14/15
Use a mirror piece to raise shade to 15
14/15/14/15<=>14/15/15/14
Use three mirror pieces to raise two 12s to 15s on the bottom
14/15/14/15->15/15/15/14/(15/9/15/9)

Raising 14s is pretty straight forward, just a long and expensive 
consumption fest.

From: "nano_biquts" <jonh@polter.net>

X-Yahoo-Profile: nano_biquts

There are three ways to go with armor
1. Max armor- use three bed of thorns to get the highest possible 
armor values at the expense of not being able to regenerate.
dragonscale armor (seed, 3 needles, sleepy eye) 98/98/99/6
adamantite pendant (seed, 3 needles, creepy eye) 0/0/0/95
dragonscale ring 1/1/0/7

2. Practical armor- use two bed of thorns and a heaven's scale to 
get decent armor values while still being able to regenerate, but 
you lose the ability to revive.

3. Stat armor- use yddrasil and EGC to get +20 to all stats. With 
99hp you should regenerate at a fast enough rate to make up for your 
poor armor values. (and you have a 99defense/spirit stat) If you 
want high luck you're pretty much forced to go this way.

know them. is using a sci calculator. (number)/decimal = 
(number/letter)/hexy decimal.

Computers never work in hex - they work in binary.  They work in 
bits and bytes.  One full byte, however, can go from 0 to 255.  
That's FF in hexadecimal, which is only two digits.  That's why 
people use it.
However, in LoM, the game only uses a half-byte to store each 
essense's data.  This, if 1F is stored in the byte (that's 31), then 
you're really going to get 1 in the first essense, and 15 in the 
second essense.
It's the same with + Bonuses.  Each Bonus has an internal, hex 
value.  From [0] to [15].  [4] means +0, [0] means -10, [14] means 
+15, and [15] means +20, with the other values being other bonus 
values.
However, there's eight values, and the game only stores their 
information in four bytes - each one only needs a half-byte.  So, if 
the value of that byte was 4E (78), the first stat would be [7] (or 
+3), and the second stat would be [14] (or +15).

There's no possible way to make them anything other than that, 
simply because that's how the game stores the data.

Gameshark uses hexidecimal.  300????? 00xx.
???? is the byte number that you want to change.
xx is what you want to change that byte to.

A code that starts with 500????? is a repeater code, and is just 
there so you don't have to enter a similar code over and over (like 
255 of each item, which would take a long time to enter if you had 
to do it for each item).

800????? xxyy is for changing two bytes at the same time, in the 
same way.  It simply changes the byte at ????? and ?????+1 into xx 
and yy, respectively.
I'm not sure what 801 means at the start of a code, but..

X is a variable.  "X Meat" means you put in any Meat (though, you 
might not want to use Magical Meat or Dragon Steak, as those are 
more rare and expensive than other Meats) until your stats are +20 
all.

Hey Everybody!

The guy who runs this place was nice enough to let me upload my first
recipe ever. It's not complete, as I haven't really tackled varnishing
yet. But as far as raising essence levels go, I think it's a fine
first attempt. I mean, it is 88 essence levels, after all. If only
Lorant Silver had a lower resistance to Wisp (say 7, for instance,
instead of 8), I could've gotten a nice round total of 90 essences...
Ah, well. Maybe I'm missing something...

Anyway, if anybody has anything to say about it, please feel free to
share it with me. I'm actually hoping for some comments that will help
me improve the recipe, or possibly shed some light on something new
which I don't even know about.

Well, I hope it helps someone. I tried to make it easy to follow and
instructional for those who, like me, are rather new to tempering. I
don't know how to do the math to figure out the strength of the
various weapons that this recipe would make, but my honest estimate is
that it should just about break an attack power of 400, or so, with
the right varnish.

Now I'm going to sleep. I've got work tonight... XP

Why do you raise Undine first?  It'd make more sense to simply raise 
Salamander up, and trigger Salamander consumptions with Undine to 
raise up the upper-row essenses, without having to use Chaos 
Cyrstals.
You'd have to aim it so that there's no energy left, of course, 
because otherwise, Undine will raise a point as well... And that's 
not good.
^_^;
It's just that there's cardless items with Undine TPs, so you can 
drain Salamander once, without using a Chaos Crystal after every 
time you drain it.
Of course, if Undine raises above 0, you'll have to use a Chaos 
Crystal to raise Salamander back up, but that's still one less Chaos 
Crystal than before...
And if you can get Salamander to 9 every time, instead (which would 
require Undine to be at 0, rather than above 0, or it would require 
you to drain Sala to 0 every time you drain it, then drain Undine 
using Jinn, then drain Jinn using Gnome, and then raise Salamander 
while draining away all of the Gnome... which would take forever and 
use a lot more Glow Crystals than before).

I don't see why you can't use the same method you were using before 
to raise Wisp up to 12 as well.. Wouldn't it be possible to get 
12/12/12/12/9/12/9/12 that way, to get 90 total essenses?  :) Not a 
lot better, but still...
And you can get 14/14/14/14 on the upper row, I believe, by raising 
Salamander to 12 (with Gnome consumptions) and draining that instead 
of draining it from 9.  ^___^

*shrugs*

From: jude_ian_2002 <no_reply@yahoogroups.com>

X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=148173392; email=no

Well, I never thought of any of these things... I am
rather new to tempering (with my own recipies and
whatnot), and it never occurred to me.

I did things the way that I did them because I thought
that if I drained an Essence that uses Sulpher to raise
an Essence that also uses Sulpher (Sala to raise Wisp,
for instance) that I wouldn't release all the energy
that I possibly could. So if there are 2 Sorceror cards
and a Wisp card present when I add in an Undine TP,
I'll only really be draining 64 energy in a Level 7
Sala Consumption, instead of 448. Am I wrong in my
presumptions... If I am wrong, then I guess that I
could re-write the whole thing from scratch...
Actually, I could definitely get Shade, Dryad, and Aura
all the way to 14!!! It would also raise overall costs
to over 1,000,000 Lucre if I just modified the current
recipe... OUCH! I don't like the thought of spending
the next two weeks fighting for Wind caps and Clear
Feathers. I think an entirely new recipe based on what
I've learned is a better idea.

But back to your question regarding Wisp, I couldn't
figure out HOW to raise Wisp above Level 10 on
LorantSilver because I would need a total 3072 energy
to do so. As I previously understood it, I could only
have 2 Sorceror cards for Wisp and Shade that actually
count for their respective Tainting Points. And
LorantSilver has a Resistance of 8 to Wisp, 6 to Shade,
and 7 to everything else. This means that I would've
had to somehow make 3 Sorceror cards available to the
Wisp TP to lower the energy requirement down to 1024.
I already know that I cannot do this because I had
already tried to use 3 Sorceror cards to raise Wisp to
Level 8 without draining essences.

4 Glow Crystal
3 Sulpher
1 Wisp Silver/Gold 236/256 = NOTHING : ONLY NEEDED 128

Anyway, I didn't see what I could possibly drain to
get that kind of energy. The most that I could come up
with was 2048. However, I think that I understand how
to harness 14336 energy now. I also see that I could
have made a tempering scheme that was
13-14-14-14-9-12-9-12 by draining either Undine or
Gnome after getting them to Level 12 to fill the top
essences. 97 Essences, instead of 88! If only I had
better understood this stuff yesterday... ;_;

But, again, Wisp will still fall behind due to the
requirement for a third (active) Sorceror card because
of the High Resistance to Wisp. Or am I missing
something else, which is highly probable?

> > instructional for those who, like me, are rather new to

> > that it should just about break an attack power of 400, or so,

I'm fairly certain you can get, at the least 14/14/14/14/12/9/12/9 
on AltenaAlloy, totalling 98 Essenses... And if not 9 on those two, 
than at least 7.  Which would mean 96 Essenses.

How much have you got on yours, total?  If it's less than 90, then 
yes, it's certainly possible to raise your attack power a little 
higher :)

Swords are difficult, because they are so balanced, and making them 
out of metal doesn't help, either.

> Anyone know seed placement for rare or very rare +luck produce.
> 
> Dialaurel, Gold Clover, Squalphin, Toadstoolshed, Pine O' Clock.

first off, check out the pet guides on www.gamefaqs.com there's a 
guide there to maxing out your pets, and it has a table showing seed 
combinations and the % chance of getting what you want. 

and, as it says in the faq, don't worry about growing the playing 
card suite produce; basil, dialaurel, clover and mint, since you can 
buy those relatively cheap at the bone fortress. (but you'll have 
more mint than you know what to do with anyway) and secondly, don't 
worry about growing toadstoolsheds unless it's for tempering, because 
as the guide says, they're nearly useless for pets. 

and since i'm here i might as well say IIRC either big/round or 
big/oblong (can't recall exactly which) seems to get pine o'clock 
often.

From: "Myst Erik Ery" <tagged_jc@yahoo.com>
X-Originating-IP: 24.67.253.204
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=116656188
X-Yahoo-Profile: tagged_jc

You can only varnish with one item - basically, your weapon damage 
is determined by five things:

Base Damage (this is affected by the Element Total you have, as well 
as the materal and weapon type).

Card Slot 1
Card Slot 2
Card Slot 3
Last Item Tempered

If you want to raise Force, add three Volcano Cards (from Ash), and 
THEN add a Scissors at the end.  You'll see the raise to 300 attack 
about that time.

Cardless tempering simply uses the energy of Cardless Items (like 
Gold Clover) to raise essense levels.  Since essense levels are 
permanent until you drain them (and sometimes, it's impossible to 
drain certain essenses after you raise others), yes - cardless 
tempering effects are permanent..

X-Yahoo-Profile: tagged_jc

There's been no hard testing to prove it either way, but, as far as 
I know, ONLY the Essense Marker determines elemental resistance.

The only reason to raise essenses on armor past the Essense Marker 
is for either looks, or to get specific Mystic Cards.

Hey all, just thought I'd put down the essence path to 105 total 
essences on Diorwood for your lookover.

0-0-9-9-9-0-0-0

6-6-15-15-15-0-0-0

0-9-15-15-15-0-0-0

0-11-14-15-15-0-0-0

11-11-15-15-15-0-0-0

0-14-14-15-15-0-0-0

14-14-15-15-15-0-0-0

0-15-14-15-15-0-0-0

14-15-13-15-15-0-0-0

15-15-15-15-15-9-12-9

I did of course leave out certain parts, but ya'll should get the 
basic idea of it (namely all the gnome draining that you had to do 
while getting wisp and shade to 15).

Cid Kramer <joker_balade@y...> wrote:


im now working on an armor. I raise the essence, but no improvement
on 
the defend properties---im using an ishe platinum, total defense
start 
at 50. The defence only raise when i add 3 bed of thorn




Elemental Essences don't work for armor the way they do for a weapon. 
The only reason to pump the essense levels is to get an element 
resistance flag, or to meet requirements for a cool card that you 
want.




As for Michael Illuminate... 


You ONLY got Dragon scales and Altena Alloy? Those materials are 
nothing to sneeze at. And unless you are actually going out of your 
way to hunt materials, the fact of the matter is, you won't get them. 
Don't be so discouraged!

Normally, people just add Bed of Thorn (x3) to their armor, and cap 
with an item.
Of course, that will prevent you from regenerating HP.

Adding Elemental Resistance markers and Status Immunities can be 
useful as well, along with adding certain (not "No HP Regeneration") 
Effects.

Dragonscales is the best physical-defense armor material, while 
Adamantine is the best available magic-defense armor material.

Ash can only be found in treasure chests, and these locations are:
Madora Beach
Bone Fortress
White Forest

I hope this helps.

Subject: Re: need help..something wring with pendant recipt?
Message-ID: <bfkkv1+tfr0@eGroups.com>

User-Agent: eGroups-EW/0.82
MIME-Version: 1.0
