Content-Length: 2088
X-Mailer: Yahoo Groups Message Poster
From: "Myst Erik Ery" <tagged_jc@yahoo.com>
X-Originating-IP: 24.67.253.204
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=116656188
X-Yahoo-Profile: tagged_jc

I made that recipe to be energy-effective.  What happened was Shade 
became much higher than Wisp, causing you to be unable to raise 
Dryad any more due to it being in conflict.  Because of this, a few 
things happened.  First, Yggdrasil was not created.  You NEED 
Yggdrasil in order to raise stats to +20, since it gives +1 to all 
stats, without it, you're just going to lose stats.  Second, Wings 
of Darkness was created from the Blackened Bat due to you having 5 
Shade and 0 Wisp.  This is bad, because you don't want it.  Since 
you had Wings of Darkness around, the Sacrificed Nymph at the end is 
never allowed on the equipment -- it sacrifices itself for the Evil 
God.  Thus, you don't have the Petrification Immunity.  It also 
complicates other things, and adds another -1 to your equipment, 
making it even worse than just losing out on Yggdrasil.
Because Undine was only raised to 2 (I am not sure why Wisp didn't 
rise, but it's because of the energy being used differently than I 
intended, I think), the Squalphin did not create the Ocean God Card, 
so that's why you don't have Flameburst Immunity.

I would suggest you follow the recipe, using a jewel (Emerald, 
Pearl, Lapis Lazuli).  Since these also have Resistance 8 (as does 
MenosBronze, FullMetal, and some others), they will work just right.

Toadstoolshed at the end will work because adding shade TPs at that 
point won't change anything - as you should have Wisp, and have 
shade too high to raise with just a Toadstoolshed.  You can only use 
Dragon's Blood if Salamander is at 1 or 2.

If you'd like to adapt it to your own recipe, feel free.  Remember 
that you need to have 1 point in an essense to get its Resistance.
You will need the following:
1 Shade, 1 Wisp, 1 Aura, 5 Dryad, 1 Sala, 1 Gnome, 1 Jinn, 3 Undine
Shade cannot be 5 or more.

If you get those essenses, it should work out just fine.
Start with Shade and Aura, then raise Wisp to Shade's level (careful 
not to go over) and then Dryad up to 5.  Then raise Undine and 
Gnome, and then Sala and Jinn with Ancient Moon.

Hope I helped :)

Since a pendant only needs 1 in an essense to get a marker, I went 
over and beyond that and raised everything to 3 except Dryad (needed 
at 5) and Sala (needed at 2). That's because I already had a working 
recipe to get all essenses to 3 on All-8 Resistances.

This recipe will work on any Resistance-8 material, including 
Adamantine, MenosBronze, Pearl, Lapis Lazuli, and Emerald..
Don't replace the Silver with Gold.  Follow the recipe, and it 
should work just fine.  I used this recipe to make Yaynomicon, my 
+20 All, All Immunity, All Resistances, Extra Lucre, +25% Magic 
Defense pendant.

AdamPendant
Shade Silver  [Sh1
Aura Silver   [Sh2         Au1
Gnome Silver  [Sh3         Au2
Wisp Silver   [Sh3 Wi1     Au3     Gn1
Undine Silver [Sh3 Wi2     Au3     Gn2     Un1
Moth Wing     [Sh3 Wi3     Au3     Gn2     Un1
Gnome Silver  [Sh3         Au3     Gn3     Un2
Moth Wing     [Sh3         Au3     Gn3     Un3
Chaos Crystal
Jinn Silver   [Sh3 Wi3     Au3     Gn3 Ji1 Un3
Moth Wing     [Sh3 Wi3     Au3     Gn3 Ji2 Un3
Sala Silver   [Sh3 Wi3     Au3 Sa1 Gn3 Ji3 Un3
Moth Wing     [Sh3 Wi3     Au3 Sa2 Gn3 Ji3 Un3
Any Seed      [Sh3 Wi3 Dr1 Au3 Sa2 Gn3 Ji3 Un3
Sulpher       [Sh3 Wi3 Dr2 Au3 Sa2 Gn3 Ji3 Un3
Sulpher       [Sh3 Wi3 Dr3 Au3 Sa2 Gn3 Ji3 Un3
Card-Item
Wicked Eye    [Sh3 Wi3 Dr4 Au3 Sa2 Gn3 Ji3 Un3
Wicked Eye    [Sh3 Wi3 Dr5 Au3 Sa2 Gn3 Ji3 Un3
Virgin's Sigh [Extra Lucre effect
Pine o' Clock [                    Slp
Stinky Breath [Psn         Cnf
Angry Eye     [Psn         Cnf
Squalphin     [Psn         Cnf             Frz
Fishy Fruit   [Psn         Cnf Fbt         Frz
Ghost's Howl  [Psn         Cnf Fbt Slp     Frz
Blackened Bat [Psn Drk     Cnf Fbt Slp     Frz
Zombie Claw   [Psn Drk Prz Cnf Fbt Slp     Frz
Spiny Seed
Ghost's Howl  /POW DEX DEF INT CON CHM SPI LUK
Dragon Blood* \+20 +20 +20 +20 +20 +20 +20 +20
          x15
Moth Wing**   [Psn Drk Prz Cnf Fbt Slp Pet Frz

*or Toadstoolshed
**or Creepy Eye

That should work.  I do not see a reason why it shouldn't, if you 
follow it correctly.

  by mta1.grp.scd.yahoo.com with SMTP; 24 Jul 2003 03:23:39 -0000
Received: from [66.218.67.158] by n19.grp.scd.yahoo.com with NNFMP; 24 Jul 2003 03:23:38 -0000
Date: Thu, 24 Jul 2003 03:23:38 -0000
To: LoM_Kitchen@yahoogroups.com
Subject: Re: I'm right, I think
Message-ID: <bfnjfq+c5qt@eGroups.com>
In-Reply-To: <bfnhrr+3mro@eGroups.com>
User-Agent: eGroups-EW/0.82
MIME-Version: 1.0
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=ISO-8859-1
Content-Length: 2483
X-Mailer: Yahoo Groups Message Poster
From: "Myst Erik Ery" <tagged_jc@yahoo.com>
X-Originating-IP: 24.67.253.204
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=116656188
X-Yahoo-Profile: tagged_jc

What material are you using, and have you been following the recipe 
exactly so far?  Your recipe seemed to have been using a lot of Gold 
Coins, which are detrimental in this case.

>  in your area that I have marked + the Sulpher why that, because, 
it 
> will NOT raise Dryad. 

(Sala)
Spirit (of Forest)
Jinn
Ancient Moon

These are the Mystic Cards after you add the Sala Silver.
Adding a Moth Wing at this time gives enough energy for Sala to 
raise to 2, but not enough for Jinn to raise to 4.

(Spirit [of Forest])
Sala
Spirit (of Forest)
Jinn

Adding any Seed will raise Dryad by 1, making the Mystic Cards as 
follows.  Note that none of the energy can go to Sala, since it's in 
Conflict (Undine is present)

(Dryad)
Spirit (of Forest)
Sala
Spirit (of Forest)

Sulpher provides 24 energy.  Adding Sulpher will raise Dryad by 1 in 
this case, since on Resistance 8, it requires 16 energy to get to 
Level 2.  Now Dryad is at 2.

(Sorcerer)
Dryad
Spirit (of Forest)
Sala

Sulpher, again, provides 24 energy.  Since there will be Card 
Movement, and there'll be a Sorcerer present, Dryad's Resistance is 
no longer 8.  It's now 6.  It requires exactly 24 energy to raise 
Dryad to level 3 now (6 * 2^(3-1)).

(Sorcerer)
Sorcerer
Dryad
Spirit (of Forest)

Lilipods does not have enough energy to raise Dryad, but it does 
change the cards:

(Enticed Nymph)
Sorcerer
Sorcerer
Dryad

Now, when we add two Wicked Eye, the Cards do not change.  Wicked 
Eye provides 48 energy.  Dryad, to raise to 4, requires even less 
energy than before - TWO Wizard Cards reduces the resistance 
further, from 8 to 6 to 3.  Now, it requires (3 * 2^(4-1)) = 24 
energy to raise to level 4.  That's fine!  We have 48.  Then, we add 
the second Wicked Eye.  It requires (3 * 2^(5-1)) = 48 energy to 
raise to level 5.  What do you know?  You have 48 energy!  Dryad 
raises to 5.


If Dryad isn't raising, it's because it is in Conflict - ensure that 
Shade is not higher than Wisp.

In addition, it does NOT matter whether you use Toadstoolshed or 
Dragon's Blood.  They both do the exact same thing, except that 
Toadstoolshed provide an additional Shade TP, and Dragon's Blood 
creates a Mystic Card when Salamander is 3 or more.
The reason you're getting strange endings is because you don't have 
Yggdrasil present.  You had two Evil Gods present, so you're going 
to end up with everything at -10 except for Power and Spirit (at 
+15, due to the Bonus Limitations of the two Evil God Cards).

I've used the recipe twice and never had a problem with it.

The two situations which I could see going wrong with what you're 
doing.

1.  Shade > Wisp and thus Dryad can't rise (though it would not of 
risen to 1 if this were the case)

2.  in the Any Seed part, you're adding a Spiny Seed which is a NO 
NO.  Add any other seed OTHER than Spiny (to get the dryad card).

If you're doing either of these, Dryad won't rise when you add in 
the Sulpher and Wicked Eyes.

If neither of the cases are happening, then you're not telling us 
something we need to know to help you :p

PS

Dragon Blood and Toadstoolsheds do the exact same thing assuming 
Sala < 3

> 1 Sulpher       [Sh3 Wi3 Dr2* Au3 Sa2 Gn3 Ji3 Un3 Nothing
> 1 Sulpher       [Sh3 Wi3 Dr3* Au3 Sa2 Gn3 Ji3 Un3 Nothing

This is wrong. Even if you used a spiny seed the sulpher should 
still push on a sorcerer. The only way it wouldn't is if you're 
using dummy items from a gameshark. Dummy items aren't 
labeled "Secondary Item (Bottle)" or whatever. The real item is the 
last one of the duplicates.

From: "Myst Erik Ery" <tagged_jc@yahoo.com>
X-Originating-IP: 24.67.253.204
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=116656188
X-Yahoo-Profile: tagged_jc

In my newer recipes, you'll notice I say 'Non-Spiny Seed' instead.

I really didn't expect anyone would use a Spiny Seed in that place, 
when the other seeds are FAR more common, and still fit into 
the 'any seed' place.
Just as I assume people won't use Dragon Steak for 'Meat' (they can, 
as it makes no difference... but, why?  Why, when you can use Odd 
Meat?).

But, in any case, anyone who knows how tempering works can tell that 
Spiny Seeds are different from the other Seeds.
All seeds do the same thing, in tempering - provide a little energy 
and create a Dryad Card.  The exception is the Spiny Seed.  This 
creates the Yggdrasil Card.  Because of this, it can't be used when 
you need a Dryad Card.
Many of the 'any seed' spots can be replaced with Dryad Gold or 
Dryad Silver, as well.

Dryad Cards are produced by so many things, they're the most common 
Card!  Small Seed, Long Seed, Big Seed, Round Seed, Oblong Seed, 
Crooked Seed, Flat Seed, Dryad Silver, Dryad Gold, and all cardless 
items on a wooden equipment produce Dryad Cards.
No other Card boasts that many different producers, even if you 
discount the effects that wood brings...

:P

It's like me putting 'Card-Item' in, and having people ask where to 
get a Card-Item.  >_>;;;

  by mta3.grp.scd.yahoo.com with SMTP; 25 Jul 2003 15:13:55 -0000

Date: Fri, 25 Jul 2003 15:13:54 -0000
To: LoM_Kitchen@yahoogroups.com
Subject: Re: Answers
Message-ID: <bfrhfi+ll0h@eGroups.com>
In-Reply-To: <bfqis8+f63a@eGroups.com>
User-Agent: eGroups-EW/0.82
MIME-Version: 1.0
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=ISO-8859-1
Content-Length: 2192
X-Mailer: Yahoo Groups Message Poster
From: "Myst Erik Ery" <tagged_jc@yahoo.com>
X-Originating-IP: 24.67.253.204
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=116656188
X-Yahoo-Profile: tagged_jc

For that particular recipe, the Grave Dirt _must_ be used - the 
Creepy Eye comes last.

Here is a recipe that should work on most non-wood materials (like 
Ishe Platinum):
1 Round seed 
3 Sulpher
1 Round seed
1 Needlelettuce
1 loquat shoes
1 Spiny seed
1 Poison fang
1 Spiny seed
1 Grave Dirt
X Meat
1 Creey Eye

You could have used the same recipe, and it would still have worked, 
though - the only difference in the two is the Dryad Cards that 
would have been made by the meats in the Wooden Item.  Since we 
don't want those when we're Bonus Raising (at the end), we have to 
use World-Card Creating Items.  Since these _technically_ create a 
Card, they don't make Dryad Cards, but then don't push anything in, 
either.  Which is what we want - to stall.  That way, nothing 
happens except that the bonuses go up and up!

The Spirit (of Shoes) Card adds the Extra Experience Effect as soon 
as it appears, and the Extra Experience Effect remains for as long 
as there is no other Effect added.
The first Effect added was the No HP Regeneration Effect, from the 
Bed of Thorn.  Then, the Spirit (of Shoes) Card removed this Effect, 
and added the Extra Exp Effect.  Since there's no other Effect-
making item in the recipe, the final result is that it has the Extra 
Exp Effect.

Does this answer your questions? :)

Sincerely,
JC "Myst Erik Ery" D

Each piece of armor will only have one effect. The last one added 
will cancel any previous ones.
Heaven scales prevents reviving and therefor makes the effects which 
speed reviving useless. Bed of thorns prevents hp regen so the 
effects which allow you to regen while moving are wasted. But I 
don't think any of the others interfer with each other.

You can't have been reviving faster - Unicorn requires that you have 
Spring as well, to get the Effect.
However, you're sure you were sharing experience?
And you're sure it was the Spirit (of Housework) you added, and not 
a different one?
Hmm...
You also could have been wearing another Ring with the Share-Exp 
Effect.  You can have more than one operative Effect, since you can 
wear three pieces of armor, but can only have one Effect on each 
armor piece.

Sincerely,
JC

> Information on immunity applications would be nice, too.

This is the basic recipe I use

Stinky Breath <- (black pixie) <- Confusion/Poison
fire stone
sulpher
sulpher
holy water
Zombie Claw <-- Paralysis
Blackened Bat <-- Darkness
Ghost Howl <- Sacrificed Nymph <- Petrification
Sharp Claw <- God of Destruction <- Freeze (sala 5+, undine 0)
water stone
Fishy Fruit <- Spring <- Sleep
Squalphin <- Ocean God <- Fireburn (undine 3+, total 5+)
Holy water

The stinky breath comes first because it will negate any other 
immunities that come before it. The only two cards with essence 
requirements are God of Destruction and Ocean God. I raise the sala 
before the undine to avoid conflicts. The first holy water pushes 
off the pixie. The Zombie Claw and Blackened Bat are used for their 
energy to raise sala to 5. I use the Ghosts Howl before the Sharp 
Claw so that the Sacrificed Nymph is sure to show up instead of 
pushing around the EGC (evil god card). After the Sharp Claw is on I 
start raising undine while consuming sala. The Fishy Fruit and 
Squalphin both have undine TP so sala is 0 by the end of the 
tempering. The last holy water just pushes on the Ocean God and it 
can be replaced by almost any other carded item.

From: "Myst Erik Ery" <tagged_jc@yahoo.com>

X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=116656188
X-Yahoo-Profile: tagged_jc

When most enemies drop experience crystals and lucre coins, they 
drop a set amount of crystals and coins.  There are sometimes two 
levels of these drops, since Crystals and Coins are the "level 1" 
and "level 2" drops of most creatures (and are removed from possible 
item drops when you have a Polterbox in Synchro).
Chess Knights are the exception, with their level 3 drop being 
Crystals and Coins.

Basically, here's what you do:
Kill something with the ring.  Count the Coins (or coint the couns, 
whatever.. >_> Hehe, don't ask) that are dropped.
Kill the same thing without the ring.  Count the Coins again.

If you get one more coin with the ring, the Extra Lucre is working.  
Otherwise, the Extra Lucre likely isn't working.

You might want to try it a couple times, in case the enemies drop a 
different amount of lucre sometimes, in addition to how much they 
normally drop (that is, their level 1 item drop might be 3 coins, 
while their level 2 item drop might be 5 coins).

I hope this helps.

--- In LoM_Kitchen@yahoogroups.com, "nano_biquts" <jonh@p...> wrote:

> > implemented?)  If this is really that sensational, I'll do it.
> 
> Kill the golem at bejeweled city with and without the ring. See if 
> you get different amounts of money.

From: "Myst Erik Ery" <tagged_jc@yahoo.com>
X-Originating-IP: 24.67.253.204
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=116656188
X-Yahoo-Profile: tagged_jc

There are three Plunge Attacks:
Uppercut: Down+Toward + Power Attack
Jump: Away, Toward + Power Attack
Thrust: Toward, Toward + Power Attack

For the bow, Uppercut is replaced with 'Shot', and Thrust is 
replaced with 'DoubleShot'.

Any special Plunge Attacks you add replace one of the existing 
three, and are performed exactly the same way.  Their graphics will 
be the same, and won't change.  You might see the result of the 
effect, though (status, such as Flameburst, or a 'MAG DOWN' message).

X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=116656188
X-Yahoo-Profile: tagged_jc

In the LoM Forgecode, there are two ways to change immunities.
One is:
Immunity = Immunity OR Petrification
This means that you'll get Petrification Immunity in addition to the 
Immunities you already have, but only if you don't have 
Petrification Immunity alread.
Immunity = Petrification
This means that you'll get Petrification Immunity, and ALL OTHER 
IMMUNITIES will be nulled, because you're setting it to ONLY be 
Petrification Immunity.

It is this second kind that makes Immunities go away.  The following 
three items use the second form of Immunity changing:
Pine o'Clock = Sleep
Rhinoloupe = Poison
Stinky Breath = Poison and Confusion

So, once you add any immunities, don't add those items.  :)

> And I definitely, positively get XP sharing.

Are you sure you didn't have another Ring Equipped that could have 
had experience sharing?

There is just NO way for the Spirit Card to _not_ grant the Extra 
Lucre Effect, since it's the newer of the Cards (between it and 
Fertility Goddess), and it always grants the Extra Lucre Effect if 
it's present, on a ring...

So you are either mistaken, or your item ended up differently 
(Spirit first, for example).

> I firmly believe I put the ear of wheat first.  Is there any 
> mechanic that could shuffle the order of cards from their usual, 
> should I check and see that the spirit precedes?

There's not much that changes the order of Cards.  However, it IS 
possible that the Hairball didn't even appear - though, you did say 
your item did have the Spirit Card.

Check the order.  If the Fertility Goddess is above the Spirit Card, 
it makes sense.  If the Spirit Card is above the Fertility Goddess, 
however, you're either mistaken about sharing experience, or you're 
wearing something else that shares experience, or you've discovered 
a very, very strange bug.

User-Agent: eGroups-EW/0.82
MIME-Version: 1.0
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=ISO-8859-1
Content-Length: 3061
X-Mailer: Yahoo Groups Message Poster
From: "Myst Erik Ery" <tagged_jc@yahoo.com>
X-Originating-IP: 24.67.253.204
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=116656188
X-Yahoo-Profile: tagged_jc

No problem!  Don't worry about it.  It wasn't a complete waste of 
time - you know more about tempering, and I know that I still do 
know about tempering.

Bonuses work as follows:
Since the Bonuses are stored in a half-byte, there are only sixteen 
different values, from 0 to 15 (F).
0 = -10
1 = -5
2 = -3
3 = -1
4 = +0
5 = +1
6 = +2
7 = +3
8 = +4
9 = +5
10 = +7
11 = +9
12 = +10
13 = +12
14 = +15
15 = +20

When an item is [+1] to a stat, it raises the number on the left.  
So, it goes from +15 to +20 with one such item.
Here's how the bonuses are applied:
First, the item's [+1] is added to the stat.  Then, the third card 
slot's [+1] or [-1] is added to the stat.  Then, this is done for 
the second card, and finally for the first card.
At the end, the bonuses are brought down to the Limitations, which 
are the most extreme of all of the Card Limitations.  For example, 
having an Evil God anywhere on your equipment automatically makes 
the Limitations -10~+20, since those are the most extreme 
Limitations.
However, if you're at [15] and you add one, it remains at [15], even 
without Limitations looked at yet.  That means if you had 
Leviathan/Yggdrasil/Yggdrasil and added a Toadstoolshed, you'd end 
up at +15 if you were at +15 already, even thought it's [+1+1+1+1-
1], or [+3].  This is because of the order things are looked at.  
Since it's at [14] (+15), the Toadstoolshed raises it to [15].  
Then, the Yggdrasil Card does nothing.  So does the next Yggdrasil 
Card.  Finally, the Evil God Card lowers it to [14].
:)

Get all that?

Bonus Limitations are somewhat more complicated.
Basically, if the current Bonus, at the time of looking at the Card 
(for the Bonus), is withing the Card's Limiations (not the overall 
Limitations), one stat's Minimum Limitation is set to be a higher 
value.  For example, every Evil God Card will set a stat to a 
Limitation of [14] (+15), because the bonuses are _always_ within 
the Evil God Card's Limitations.  If you have three different Evil 
God Cards, you'll have three stats at +15, and they won't lower the 
stats below that because they are basically minimums for the 
Limitations, although a bit different.  That's why I call them Bonus 
Limitations.  :)

I hope this helps.. Heh.

The Wicked Eye is the only Eye that you can use - all others create 
Pixie Cards, which would be 'A Bad Thing'.
The Wicked Eye is a cardless item that gives 48 energy.
The only substitute is Acid.

Wicked Eyes can't be THAT hard to come by.  I think I find them more 
in treasure chests...
The Flames and the Junkyard have chests with Wicked Eyes in them.

They're also the highest-level drop of the Beholders, as you said.  
Their level IS important - it should be 64 or higher.  And you 
should go hunting with your Polterbox in Synchro (its luck doesn't 
matter, only yours does).

Big Baby and Slime, however, drop Acid very easily - but DON'T bring 
your Polterbox along, because I think it's a level 1/2 drop.

^_^;

I am not sure if Effects have any effect on Golems, although I'm 
pretty sure they do not, unfortunately.

As far as feeding your Polterbox Gold Clover - the main thing, is 
that most people like their pets to have 99 of each stat.  Luck is 
one stat that never raises on its own (except in the case of 
Rabites), and so it requires special attention.
On a Polterbox, it's mostly wasted - you want a Polterbox so that 
YOU do the killing, while it's in Synchro.

As far as using Acid for Creep Eye - that's not possible.  You can 
use Acid instead of Wicked Eye, but not Creepy Eye.
Moth Wing would usually make a good substitute for Creepy Eye, 
however, as both raise Magic Defense.  However, Moth Wing raises 
Magic Defense _more_, but lowers the other defenses.  Note that you 
should only replace a Creepy Eye with a Moth Wing IF the Creepy Eye 
is the last item to be added, as then it's effective as a capper.  
If it's not the last item added, the Pixie Card created is probably 
important.  :)

Sincerely,
JC "Myst Erik Ery"

Well, I'm not exactly sure on the process, but Majarra lists in 
his "Tempering for Dummies" text that you can boost luck with an Evil 
God card in place (he uses Leviathan, maybe it only works for that 
one?) if you use a lot of hairballs and Aura coins. 

I haven't tried it, but no matter what, you'll probably have to keep 
placing the Evil God in, otherwise if it left for good, you'd lose 
all your bonuses due to default restrictions.

Meaning:

Orcaplant
Aura Silver
Aura Silver
Orcaplant
Aura Silver
Aura Silver ... and so on.

He also states that it'll probably give you a -5 or so in every other 
stat but Def.

Hope this helps! Maybe with some trial and error, you can tell me how 
to do it!

From: "Matt Fitzpatrick" <rigel@starmail.com>

X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=157818637
X-Yahoo-Profile: m_fitzpat

- One option: Ghetto Luck -

This recipe will give you +12 Luck, and not much else.  It's not 
great, but it requires zero rare items, making it ideal if you're 
just starting out and want to conserve all your rares.

This should be done on some sort of armor, using any material that 
doesn't have an innate essence (i.e., woods give Dryad all over the 
place).  It'll work on a weapon too, though the very low essence 
levels will result in a weak weapon.  An AnimalBone Pendant or 
similar junk is fine; again, this recipe uses no rare items at all, 
so don't worry about wasting anything.

1> Shade Silver, Moon Crystal, Mush-in-a-Box, or Raven Feather.  This 
raises Shade essence a little bit, which will allow the Metropolis 
card to appear.  Make sure there's zero Salamander essence; 
Salamander will prevent Metropolis from manifesting.
2> Dialaurel.  Buy it from the Bone Fortress after the Field Trip is 
over, just 1000 Lucre.
3> Bumpkin.  In your orchards, crooked seeds plus oblong seeds make 
lots of Spiny Carrots, and a good amount of Bumpkins.  The Metropolis 
card will appear at this step.
4> Aura Silver.  The Clown card will appear at this step.  Clown 
normally relaxes the stat limit on your item to +9, but in the 
presence of the Metropolis, it goes all the way up to +12.
5> Any card producing item.  Holy Water or elemental Mana Stones 
work, Lilipods is fine too.  Crooked seeds plus round seeds makes 
mass amounts of Lilipods in your orchards.  No matter what you use as 
your filler, the Aura card will appear at this step, adding +1 Luck 
to your item, per turn, as long as it's present.
6> Meat, meat, meat, meat, meat, until your Luck maxes at +12.

- Another option: Uberstats -

Using just a couple semi-rares, +20 to all stats can be reached 
fairly easily.  All +20 can be done on DiorWood and other pre-tainted 
materials, but this procedure won't work-- a much scarier and 
costlier procedure is needed.  These recipes include the required 
Dryad essence boost to 5; you may add more essences, just make sure 
Salamander is at 0 before you try putting the Needle/ttuce on.

Material: Orihalcon, any Hide (except Centaur), DragonScales, Ivory, 
any Fabric:

Dryad Silver OR non-Spiny Seed
Sulpher
Sulpher
Needle OR Needlettuce
Any Meat
Spiny Seed
Poison Claw
Spiny Seed
Lilipods (or another filler card of your choice)
Any Meat, repeat until +20 in all stats

Material: Any Metal (except Orihalcon, MaiaLead), any Stone, 
CentaurHide, any Scales (except Dragon), any Bone (except Ivory), any 
Aerolite, any Shell (except Coral), any Gem:
Dryad Silver OR non-Spiny Seed
Sulpher
Sulpher
Sulpher
Dryad Silver OR non-Spiny Seed
Needle OR Needlettuce
Spiny Seed
Poison Claw
Spiny Seed
Lilipods (or another filler card of your choice)
Any Meat, repeat until +20 in all stats

You may optionally add another filler card at the end of either 
version of the recipe.

From: "Myst Erik Ery" <tagged_jc@yahoo.com>

X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=116656188
X-Yahoo-Profile: tagged_jc

Yes, the pawn-item trick is what people mean when they talk about 
copying items.

Sacrificed Nymph works as follows.

If an Evil God Card is leaving your equipment, and there is a 
Sacrificed Nymph present, the Sacrificed Nymph will leave instead 
and the Evil God Card will move to where the Sacrificed Nymph was.

For example, let's say your equipment has (Sacrificed Nymph)
Dryad/Dryad/Beast-Headed God.

You add a Dryad Silver.  Now, first the Cards become (Dryad)
Sacrificed Nymph/Dryad/Dryad, with the Beast-Headed God Card 
leaving.  However, since an Evil God Card is leaving, and Sacrificed 
Nymph is present in Slots 1-3, the Evil God Card moves to where the 
Nymph is, and she leaves instead.  So, now your Cards become (Dryad)
Beast-Headed God/Dryad/Dryad, with the Sacrificed Nymph Card leaving.
Note that in this particular example, the Sacrificed Nymph doesn't 
add Petrification Immunity or anything else, since it hasn't been 
checked and evaluated by the time it gets removed and replaced.  :)

Most people use the following recipe on armors to get +20 all in 
order to save on Dragon Blood...

Needle(ttuce)
Spiny Seed
Some Evil God Card Producing Item
Spiny Seed
Some Card Producing Item #1
X Meat (till +20 all)
Some Card Producing Item #2 (usually a "varnish" item Like Moth Wing 
or Creepy Eye)

In the Full Metal Gauntlet Recipe hosted on this site, Item #1 is 
Springanana. However, I don't think this recipe would work. Although 
the Heaven's Scale card is there to replace the Bed of Thorns 
effect, it can't be prduced because the Bed of Thorns has already 
been pushed off by the second Yggdrasil card. Item #2 would just 
replace it...

I might be wrong tho.

You can get 9/9/9/9/9/9/9/9 only if your resistances for the final 
pair of elements (Sala-Jinn or Undine-Gnome) are BOTH less than 8.
If that's the case, you can get to 9 using 2 Wizard Cards, a leaving 
Nymph of Dawn, and a Gold Coin.
What material were you using?  Dragonscales?  Shouldn't be a 
problem, then.

Just add:
4 Glow Crystal
2 Sulpher
1 Chaos Crystal
1 Gnome Gold
4 Glow Crystal
2 Mercury
1 Chaos Crystal
1 Undine Gold

Since Scales is 7-across, with two Wizard Cards it becomes 1.  1*2^8 
= 256.  So, we need 256 energy to get from 8->9.  Leaving Nymph of 
Dawn is 192, plus 64 from the Gold Coin... Is 256!  Yay!

Well, let's look at it step-by-step.  Assuming all essense levels 
are met..

Needle(ttuce) = (Bed of Thorn)???/???/???
Spiny Seed = (Yggdrasil)Bed of Thorn/???/???
Some Evil God Card Producing Item (EvilGod)Yggdrasil/Bed of Thorn/???
Spiny Seed (Yggdrasil)EvilGod/Yggdrasil/Bed of Thorn
Springanana (Heaven's Scale)Yggdrasil/EvilGod/Yggdrasil

You see, since there was a Bed of Thorn present before tempering, 
you're free to add another World Card.

HOWEVER - you ARE correct, in another sense.  As soon as you add a 
meat to this, you'll end up with (---) in the Invisible Slot, since 
it will remove the World Card that is there.  So it won't quite work 
right :<

I'll have to take a look at that recipe to see if I can make it work 
without having to use Dragon Blood or Toadstoolshed.  It's better on 
a ring, since then you can get an Effect other than NO-HP-REGEN 
without using a World Card.

^_^ Thanks.

Subject: Re: Cursed Bone & Consumptions
Message-ID: <bkatl0+3bjr@eGroups.com>
In-Reply-To: <bka91e+ud00@eGroups.com>
User-Agent: eGroups-EW/0.82
MIME-Version: 1.0
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=ISO-8859-1
Content-Length: 1931
X-Mailer: Yahoo Groups Message Poster
From: "Myst Erik Ery" <tagged_jc@yahoo.com>
X-Originating-IP: 24.67.253.204
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=116656188
X-Yahoo-Profile: tagged_jc


You cannot get CursedBone as a primary.

However, the following items are pre-made out of CursedBone:

Deathstroke (Knife, Dainslaif)
PeaceMaker (Hammer, Cursed Doll)
Skuldesect (Gloves, Ape Mummy or Narcissos)
SkullHead (Helm, Skeleton)
Dragonbone (Pendant, Spectre)

Consumptions are fairly simple.  A consumption happens when there is 
a TP of the consuming essense, and there is nothing stopping the 
consumption.

For example, under normal circumstances, Salamander will consume 
Gnome.  So, if Gnome is at 5, and you add a Salamander TP (from a 
Sala Gold, for example) Gnome will drain to 4, releasing energy.
However, if Undine was present (Undine > 0), then Salamander can no 
longer consume Gnome (Salamander TPs are ignored when Undine > 0).

The energy released is equal to the energy it takes to get to that 
level, without Wizard Cards.  Thus, you can theoretically drain 
Salamander 1 level, and have it raise 2 levels, by having enough 
Wizard Cards present, draining Salamander, and still being able to 
raise Salamander (not normally possible, since only Undine drains 
Salamander usually, and when that happens, Undine raises to 1, 
leaving Salamander unable to rise...)...

Have I made anything clearer? :/

Ash (primary) is not the same as Ash (secondary).

The first is a kind of wood.  The second is like soot, and it used 
to create the Volcano Card, usually.
They're not the same.

No enemy drops the secondary Ash.  Woodings drop Ash (primary).  As 
I said, you can only find Ash in three places.

That's okay!  I could have been wrong, after all, so doubting is a 
good thing.  Of course, on this, I was not wrong.  But IF I was, and 
you just blindly assumed I must be right, even when I didn't seem to 
be, then we'd BOTH be wrong.  Right? :D

Note:

If you try to temper something, you obviously won't find 'AshWood' 
in the list of items, since tempering something shows only Secondary 
items.  Perhaps you were looking there?

In any case, you probably found your other Ash either (a) from the 
Bone Fortress again, on your second time through, (b) from the White 
Forest, or (c) from Madora Beach -- the last two, without noticing :D

Sincerely,
JC

From: "poisonpikachu" <justyn@undeadinternational.com>

> > > --- In LoM_Kitchen@yahoogroups.com, "xing_loong" 
<xing_loong@y...> 
> > wrote: also how do i add the sun god's plunge attack and the 
> moon 
> > > goddess plunge into the sword without affecting it's attack 
> power 
> > if 
> > > possible none or little to make a difference?

I can help with this: The Sun God and Moon Goddess add a plunge 
attack into the same plunge slot, so you'll have to pick which you 
want. The Moon Goddess is the easiest to get, I think, and its good 
against water-attributed enemies.

To get the Sun God to appear, you have to have Wisp's levels at 3 at 
the least, and have the overall levels equal 5 or more. For the Moon 
Goddess to appear, Shade has to be level 3 or more. If you want to 
try both, raise Shade's levels first, because you can always raise 
Wisp after Shade, but not vice versa.

Raising the elemental levels will always raise the attack power, but 
the increase is determined by the material, I think. But since you 
only 5 total levels (just do Shade and Wisp, respecively, if you 
don't want to do any more), the overall increase won't be that much.

As for 1H swords, varnishing is 3 Bumpkins and a Sharp Claw.

As far as Plunge Attacks go, if you look at the chart(s) on the 
Majarra guide (found here: 
http://db.gamefaqs.com/console/psx/file/legend_of_mana_temper_b.txt) 
any Plunge attack that is in the same category will always replace 
that slot. Like the Sun God and Moon Goddess's plunges will always 
lose the 'Jump'.

Hope any of this helps!

X-Yahoo-Profile: tagged_jc

There are four Mirror Pieces per game.

Madora Beach, the Underworld, the Bejewelled City, and the Mana Tree.

You can get more than just four, though, because of the New Game +.  
When you beat the game, you can continue your save and start all 
over again, from the beginning, but with the stuff you had before 
(items, equipment, pets, golems, instruments, level, etc.) on a new 
map.

So you can get 16 Mirror Pieces in four runthroughs, if you remember 
to get them all each time.

To: LoM_Kitchen@yahoogroups.com
Subject: Re: Energy
Message-ID: <bklf26+m3ea@eGroups.com>
In-Reply-To: <bkktv2+rqft@eGroups.com>
User-Agent: eGroups-EW/0.82
MIME-Version: 1.0
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=ISO-8859-1
Content-Length: 2152
X-Mailer: Yahoo Groups Message Poster
From: "Myst Erik Ery" <tagged_jc@yahoo.com>
X-Originating-IP: 24.67.253.204
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=116656188
X-Yahoo-Profile: tagged_jc

Energy is what you need to raise an essense level.

The energy requirement to get to X level is equal to: (Resistance) * 
2^(X-1)

So, if your Resistance is 7, and you're wanting to get to level 9, 
you'll need (7 * 2^8) or 1792 energy.

This is impossible, of course.  The highest energy you can get from 
an item is 96 (Glow Crystal), and you can get 288 from a Glow 
Crystal + Nymph of Dawn (when Nymph of Dawn leaves, you gain 192 
energy).

However, Wizard Cards (Sorcerer for Wisp/Dryad/Salamander/Gnome, 
Witch for Shade/Aura/Jinn/Undine) lower resistances.
So, with two Wizard Cards, Resistance 7 becomes Resistance 1.
That means you only need (1 * 2^8) or 256 energy to get to level 9, 
with two Wizard Cards.
This can be done rather easily with a Nymph of Dawn leaving and 
either a Gold Coin or some other 64+ energy item, while there's a TP 
present (as you can only raise one point per TP, no more).

However, how would you get past 9, then?  You'll have to use 
consumptions, since that's the only way to get more than 288 energy.
If you had resistance 32, and you were going from level 15 to level 
14, you would get a total of (32 * 2^14) energy, or 524288 energy.  
As you can see, that's QUITE a bit more than 288 (although, it IS a 
bit extreme, since you're going to need about that much energy to 
GET to level 15 in the first place :P ).

Does THIS help at all?

Subject: Re: Varnish
Message-ID: <bklf6e+deur@eGroups.com>

MIME-Version: 1.0

Content-Length: 2122
X-Mailer: Yahoo Groups Message Poster
From: "Myst Erik Ery" <tagged_jc@yahoo.com>
X-Originating-IP: 24.67.253.204
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=116656188
X-Yahoo-Profile: tagged_jc

> As for 1H swords, varnishing is 3 Bumpkins and a Sharp Claw.

1H Swords are balanced.  That is, they have no best varnish.  It 
will depend solely on the material used.

3/4 Bumpkin, Sharp Claw (for Sharp)
3/4 Ash, Scissors (for Force)
3/4 Holy Water, Giant's Horn (for Heavy)

You'll have to look at the material's properties to determine what 
to use.  For example, DiorWood works best with Sharp, whereas 
Dragonscales is better for Heavy.

*nods*

At that point, you can't do anything to lose any essenses.

Just add:
4x glow crystal
chaos crystal
2x mercury
jinn gold

Again, and it'll raise to 9.  There's a simpler way, but I can't 
think of it at the moment.

You'll have to repeat the last four steps of the Salamander raising, 
too, to get it to 9.

Received: from [66.218.66.116] by n15.grp.scd.yahoo.com with NNFMP; 22 Sep 2003 05:16:20 -0000
Date: Mon, 22 Sep 2003 05:16:20 -0000
To: LoM_Kitchen@yahoogroups.com
Subject: Re: Plunge Attacks
Message-ID: <bkm0j4+lpvg@eGroups.com>
In-Reply-To: <bklthf+er7u@eGroups.com>
User-Agent: eGroups-EW/0.82
MIME-Version: 1.0
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=ISO-8859-1
Content-Length: 2635
X-Mailer: Yahoo Groups Message Poster
From: "Myst Erik Ery" <tagged_jc@yahoo.com>
X-Originating-IP: 24.67.253.204
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=116656188
X-Yahoo-Profile: tagged_jc

Actually, Sunlight (the Plunge from Sun God) is an Uppercut, whereas 
Moonlight (the Plunge from Moon Goddess) is a Jump.
So you can have both Sunlight and Moonlight on the sword.  Just add 
1x Moon Crystal, 1x Sun Crystal to the end of your tempering, but 
before capping/varnishing.
Vampsword (Witch of Moon) and Flametongue (God of Destruction) are 
also Uppercut Plunge Attacks, so if you want either of those two, 
you'll have to not have Sunlight.

Those are a bit trickier to add, too.  You'll have to use Ragnarok 
and a Pixie, at the end, to properly get them on there.  :)

--- In LoM_Kitchen@yahoogroups.com, "xing_loong" <xing_loong@y...> 
wrote:
> I see, thanks for the help, one more question, if i can't get the 
> moon goddess with the sun god then what other plunge attacks can i 
> get with the sun god in the sword?
> if also using the uber recipe
> 
> --- In LoM_Kitchen@yahoogroups.com, "poisonpikachu" <justyn@u...> 
> wrote:
> > 
> > > > > --- In LoM_Kitchen@yahoogroups.com, "xing_loong" 
> > <xing_loong@y...> 
> > > > wrote: also how do i add the sun god's plunge attack and the 
> > > moon 
> > > > > goddess plunge into the sword without affecting it's 
attack 
> > > power 
> > > > if 
> > > > > possible none or little to make a difference?
> > 
> > I can help with this: The Sun God and Moon Goddess add a plunge 
> > attack into the same plunge slot, so you'll have to pick which 
you 
> > want. The Moon Goddess is the easiest to get, I think, and its 
> good 
> > against water-attributed enemies.
> > 
> > To get the Sun God to appear, you have to have Wisp's levels at 
3 
> at 
> > the least, and have the overall levels equal 5 or more. For the 
> Moon 
> > Goddess to appear, Shade has to be level 3 or more. If you want 
to 
> > try both, raise Shade's levels first, because you can always 
raise 
> > Wisp after Shade, but not vice versa.
> > 
> > Raising the elemental levels will always raise the attack power, 
> but 
> > the increase is determined by the material, I think. But since 
you 
> > only 5 total levels (just do Shade and Wisp, respecively, if you 
> > don't want to do any more), the overall increase won't be that 
> much.
> > 
> > As for 1H swords, varnishing is 3 Bumpkins and a Sharp Claw.
> > 
> > As far as Plunge Attacks go, if you look at the chart(s) on the 
> > Majarra guide (found here: 
> > 
> 
http://db.gamefaqs.com/console/psx/file/legend_of_mana_temper_b.txt) 
> > any Plunge attack that is in the same category will always 
replace 
> > that slot. Like the Sun God and Moon Goddess's plunges will 
always 
> > lose the 'Jump'.
> > 
> > Hope any of this helps!

X-Yahoo-Profile: tagged_jc

It's completely different.

You're at the end, right?  Just need to raise Sala, and that's it?
If so, just add:
4 Glow Crystal
2 Sulpher
1 Chaos Crystal
1 Sala Gold

That should bump you up to 7...

For armor, your only way of raising defense is basically Bed of 
Thorns.
So, add any seed, and then add 3 Needlettuce, and you've got the best 
armor you can get --- but, you can't restore any HP.
Also note that Dragonscales makes the best physical-defense armor, 
whereas Adamantite makes the best magical-defense armor...

From: "Myst Erik Ery" <tagged_jc@yahoo.com>

X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=116656188
X-Yahoo-Profile: tagged_jc

It is very difficult to raise all essenses and still get Bed of 
Thorn - Bed of Thorn requires 0 Salamander, so you can't raise 
Salamander at all.

Here's the Armor .txt:

DragonScaleArmor and AdamantitePendants are the "best" armor because
they have the highest values for material and equipment type.
Pendants also allow you to get all of the status immunities on a
single item.

1. Max armor values
Great high defense, but you can't regenerate hp.
  DragonScaleArmor 98/98/99/6
    round seed
    3 needle(ttuce)
    sleepy eye
  AdamantitePendant 0/0/0/95
    stinky breath
    fire stone
    sulpher
    sulpher
    holy water
    zombie claw
    blackened Bat
    ghost howl
    sharp claw
    water stone
    fishy fruit
    squalphin
    round seed
    3 needle(ttuce)
    moth wing

2. High armor values
Pretty much the same the same as the first one but uses heaven scales
card from springana to you can regenerate hp (even while moving), but
now you can't revive.
  DragonScaleArmor 65/65/68/4
    round seed
    2 needle(ttuce)
    springana
    sleepy eye
  AdamantitePendant 0/0/0/78
    stinky breath
    fire stone
    sulpher
    sulpher
    holy water
    zombie claw
    blackened Bat
    ghost howl
    sharp claw
    water stone
    fishy fruit
    squalphin
    round seed
    2 needle(ttuce)
    springana
    moth wing

3. High stats
With a maxed out hp stat you'll regenerate damage faster than you can
take it in most situations. This setup also raises your luck more 
than
the others can. Since the armor values aren't critical to this setup
you can make the first three items out of anything (the shoes show 
what
needs to change to work on wood). The pendant recipe relies on the
particular resistances of adamantite in a number of places, but it 
can
be replaced with menos bronze and any other material with the same
resistances.
  Mantle
    round seed
    3 sulpher
    round seed
    sun crystal
    needle(ttuce)
    spiny seed
    poison fang
    spiny seed
    white feather (regen while moving)
    X meat
    lilipod
  Ring
    round seed
    3 sulpher
    round seed
    needle(ttuce)
    spiny seed
    poison fang
    spiny seed
    ear of wheat (exp share)
    X meat
    lilipod
  Shoes
    round seed
    3 sulpher
    round seed
    needle(ttuce)
    spiny seed
    poison fang
    spiny seed
    loquat-shoes or pear o'heels (extra exp crystals)
    X meat
    lilipod
  WoodenShoes
    3 sulpher
    needle(ttuce)
    loquat-shoes or pear o'heels (extra exp crystals)
    spiny seed
    poison fang
    spiny seed
    X grave dirt
  AdamantitePendant
    stinky breath
    fire stone
    sulpher
    sulpher
    holy water
    zombie claw
    blackened bat
    shade silver
    sharp claw
    water stone
    fishy fruit
    squalphin
    round seed
    sulpher
    sulpher
    gnome silver
    flaming quill
    wind stone
    sun crystal
    flaming quill
    flaming quill
    chaos crystal
    aura silver
    giants horn
    flaming quill
    sala gold
    needlettuce
    ghosts howl
    spiny seed 
    ghosts howl
    spiny seed
    virgins sigh (extra lucre)
    X meat
    moth wing

> Thorn - Bed of Thorn requires 0 Salamander, so you can't raise 
> Salamander at all.
> 
> Here's the Armor .txt:
> 
> DragonScaleArmor and AdamantitePendants are the "best" armor 
because
> they have the highest values for material and equipment type.
> Pendants also allow you to get all of the status immunities on a
> single item.
> 
> 1. Max armor values
> Great high defense, but you can't regenerate hp.
>   DragonScaleArmor 98/98/99/6
>     round seed
>     3 needle(ttuce)
>     sleepy eye
>   AdamantitePendant 0/0/0/95
>     stinky breath
>     fire stone
>     sulpher
>     sulpher
>     holy water
>     zombie claw
>     blackened Bat
>     ghost howl
>     sharp claw
>     water stone
>     fishy fruit
>     squalphin
>     round seed
>     3 needle(ttuce)
>     moth wing
> 
> 2. High armor values
> Pretty much the same the same as the first one but uses heaven 
scales
> card from springana to you can regenerate hp (even while moving), 
but
> now you can't revive.
>   DragonScaleArmor 65/65/68/4
>     round seed
>     2 needle(ttuce)
>     springana
>     sleepy eye
>   AdamantitePendant 0/0/0/78
>     stinky breath
>     fire stone
>     sulpher
>     sulpher
>     holy water
>     zombie claw
>     blackened Bat
>     ghost howl
>     sharp claw
>     water stone
>     fishy fruit
>     squalphin
>     round seed
>     2 needle(ttuce)
>     springana
>     moth wing
> 
> 3. High stats
> With a maxed out hp stat you'll regenerate damage faster than you 
can
> take it in most situations. This setup also raises your luck more 
> than
> the others can. Since the armor values aren't critical to this 
setup
> you can make the first three items out of anything (the shoes show 
> what
> needs to change to work on wood). The pendant recipe relies on the
> particular resistances of adamantite in a number of places, but it 
> can
> be replaced with menos bronze and any other material with the same
> resistances.
>   Mantle
>     round seed
>     3 sulpher
>     round seed
>     sun crystal
>     needle(ttuce)
>     spiny seed
>     poison fang
>     spiny seed
>     white feather (regen while moving)
>     X meat
>     lilipod
>   Ring
>     round seed
>     3 sulpher
>     round seed
>     needle(ttuce)
>     spiny seed
>     poison fang
>     spiny seed
>     ear of wheat (exp share)
>     X meat
>     lilipod
>   Shoes
>     round seed
>     3 sulpher
>     round seed
>     needle(ttuce)
>     spiny seed
>     poison fang
>     spiny seed
>     loquat-shoes or pear o'heels (extra exp crystals)
>     X meat
>     lilipod
>   WoodenShoes
>     3 sulpher
>     needle(ttuce)
>     loquat-shoes or pear o'heels (extra exp crystals)
>     spiny seed
>     poison fang
>     spiny seed
>     X grave dirt
>   AdamantitePendant
>     stinky breath
>     fire stone
>     sulpher
>     sulpher
>     holy water
>     zombie claw
>     blackened bat
>     shade silver
>     sharp claw
>     water stone
>     fishy fruit
>     squalphin
>     round seed
>     sulpher
>     sulpher
>     gnome silver

To: LoM_Kitchen@yahoogroups.com

Message-ID: <bkomlg+9eid@eGroups.com>

Content-Length: 8993
X-Mailer: Yahoo Groups Message Poster
From: "great_legend_of_mana_audio_play" <great_legend_of_mana_audio_play@yahoo.com>
X-Originating-IP: 24.67.253.204
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: public

Each type of armor requires a different essense value to get 
an "Elemental Defense Marker".  That's all you need - the actual 
value doesn't matter, so long as you have the marker.  However, 
these markers aren't exactly all that useful either, since I don't 
know how much they reduce anything by ACTUALLY (and who gets hit 
with magic, anyway?).

You cannot make a ring with all status immunities.  Only Pendants 
can have all status immunities.  Yes, you can make a Pendant with 
all status immunities and the instant-Revive Effect (or make it a 
Ring with many status immunities, but not all).

No, you can't equip one thing that stops regeneration and one that 
doesn't, and regenerate.  Any equipment you have that has the Bed of 
Thorn's "No HP Regen" Effect will make sure you don't restore ANY HP 
at all, ever, if you have it equipped.  No matter what else you have 
equipped.

No HP Regen isn't a big loss.  You can make a "Candy Machine Golem", 
or grab a Lizardon for Pak'n Choco.  Or, you can just use Quick 
Attack + Tackle + Tackle + Tackle + Tackle + etc... Until a Candy 
Pops out, if you NEED to heal.

X-Yahoo-Profile: tagged_jc

The Armor that has Heaven's Scale present, while letting you 
Regenerate HP while moving and while standing still (unlike armor 
that has Bed of Thorn's NO HP Regen effect), has one bad side 
effect - you do not revive.  That is, your gray meter never fills 
up.  So yes, if you're knocked out and you have a partner still 
fighting, it won't raise back up to 100% and fully revive you.

To make a pendant with Revive, simply put Volcano and Phoenix on it 
at the same time.  Those are all you need for the Revive Effect.  
Note that the Volcano Card can leave after the Effect is added, but 
if Phoenix leaves, you will actually LOSE the Effect.  The Revive 
Effect also only works once, as after it is used up the topmost 
Phoenix Card will be removed and it will lose the Effect.  Neither 
Volcano nor Phoenix have anything to do with losing Essense Markers 
or Status Immunites, so you're save there.
However, the fact that this is a two-Card Ability makes it very 
difficult to have +20 All Stat Bonuses on the same Pendant, 
especially since you'll want to be adding more Phoenixes afterwards 
to re-add the Revive Effect.

> > these markers aren't exactly all that useful either, since I 
don't 
> > know how much they reduce anything by ACTUALLY (and who gets hit 
> > with magic, anyway?).
> > 
> > You cannot make a ring with all status immunities.  Only 
Pendants 
> > can have all status immunities.  Yes, you can make a Pendant 
with 
> > all status immunities and the instant-Revive Effect (or make it 
a 
> > Ring with many status immunities, but not all).
> > 
> > No, you can't equip one thing that stops regeneration and one 
that 
> > doesn't, and regenerate.  Any equipment you have that has the 
Bed 
> of 
> > Thorn's "No HP Regen" Effect will make sure you don't restore 
ANY 
> HP 
> > at all, ever, if you have it equipped.  No matter what else you 
> have 
> > equipped.
> > 
> > No HP Regen isn't a big loss.  You can make a "Candy Machine 
> Golem", 
> > or grab a Lizardon for Pak'n Choco.  Or, you can just use Quick 
> > Attack + Tackle + Tackle + Tackle + Tackle + etc... Until a 
Candy 
> > Pops out, if you NEED to heal.

i have a question about polter boxes.  when attempting to get a rare 
item while synchro-ing with my polter box (mr. pokey) do i synchro at 
the moment of impact, at the moment the enemies explode, just before 
the bag drops, or during the entire time from impact until the bag 
drops.  help on this will save much time, thank you!


From tagged_jc@yahoo.com Thu Sep 25 07:53:32 2003
Return-Path: <tagged_jc@yahoo.com>
X-Sender: tagged_jc@yahoo.com
X-Apparently-To: LoM_Kitchen@yahoogroups.com
Received: (qmail 76217 invoked from network); 25 Sep 2003 14:53:31 -0000
Received: from unknown (66.218.66.218)
  by m17.grp.scd.yahoo.com with QMQP; 25 Sep 2003 14:53:31 -0000
Received: from unknown (HELO n31.grp.scd.yahoo.com) (66.218.66.99)
  by mta3.grp.scd.yahoo.com with SMTP; 25 Sep 2003 14:53:31 -0000
Received: from [66.218.67.165] by n31.grp.scd.yahoo.com with NNFMP; 25 Sep 2003 14:52:06 -0000
Date: Thu, 25 Sep 2003 14:52:03 -0000
To: LoM_Kitchen@yahoogroups.com
Subject: Re: Rare Item
Message-ID: <bkuvej+v2p8@eGroups.com>
In-Reply-To: <bkujej+ib6l@eGroups.com>
User-Agent: eGroups-EW/0.82
MIME-Version: 1.0
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=ISO-8859-1
Content-Length: 759
X-Mailer: Yahoo Groups Message Poster
From: "Myst Erik Ery" <tagged_jc@yahoo.com>
X-Originating-IP: 24.67.253.204
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=116656188
X-Yahoo-Profile: tagged_jc

A Polterbox's Synchro takes effect only on the strike that defeats 
the enemy.
So, just ensure that your last hit against the enemy was in Synchro 
with the Polterbox, and you're guaranteed to get an item (except 
against Chess Knights) due to the Synchro, even if you wander away 
from your Polterbox while the enemy explodes.

--- In LoM_Kitchen@yahoogroups.com, "canis_lupus_baileyi"

weapons!!!

so far this is what i have:
1HAxe=Tetsaiga
2HSword=Ragnarok

These give invisible bonusses, it won't show on your weapon stats
but you will get +1 to all essences, +5 to luck, +10 to Offence!!!

Don't worry more are on the way!!!

Prove it.

Naming your weapon _never_ changes the attack power, so it doesn't 
give you +1 to all essenses, first off.

Second, Ragnarok is the name of an ordinary dropped 2HSword, if I 
recall correct.  Remember that dropped equipment has different 
attack power and bonuses than ordinarily forged equipment, but that 
if you add anything to it, they'll all be recalculated.

Welcome to the Group!  I like seeing new members actually being 
active.

Dior Wood is dropped by high-level Woodings.  I suggest No Future - 
you can fight the lone Wooding in Gato Grottoes by selecting 'To The 
Waterfall', and then backtracking into the Dungeon and heading to 
the right.

Altena Alloy is a reward for late-end "Metal" Events.  For 
information on Metal Events, you should read my AF/Event FAQ 
(located here: http://www.gamefaqs.com/console/psx/game/24026.html ) 
although I do not know the exact Land Strength required for Altena 
Alloy.
Fortunately, Altena Alloy is not as good as Dior Wood or 
Dragonscales for tempering, and not as good as Dior Wood for magical 
instruments.

Gaeus's Tears is dropped by Chimera Beasts.  I suggest No Future - 
other than the few on Lucemia, the only other place I know of with 
Chimera Beasts is deep, deep down in the Underworld.  I'm not 100% 
of their location, but they're down there somewhere.

Sincerely,
JC Myst Erik Ery

I've only had the dizzy-ing problem when I'm spinning without 
attacking, or spinning and Quick-Attacking.

You can try spinning and Power Attacking, instead, although I'm not 
sure if it prevents you being dizzy.

It's not based on anything, as far as I know, other than simply the 
fact that Spin can Dizzy you.

To: LoM_Kitchen@yahoogroups.com
Subject: Re: Essences
Message-ID: <bnfsqb+5qbr@eGroups.com>
In-Reply-To: <bnfno4+vo6n@eGroups.com>
User-Agent: eGroups-EW/0.82
MIME-Version: 1.0
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=ISO-8859-1
Content-Length: 1621
X-Mailer: Yahoo Groups Message Poster
From: "Myst Erik Ery" <tagged_jc@yahoo.com>
X-Originating-IP: 24.67.253.204
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=116656188
X-Yahoo-Profile: tagged_jc

The higher your essence total, the more attack power you get from 
weapons.
This is due to something called "Growth Control".

Each material property is multiplied by this formula:

(Growth Control + Essence Total) / Growth Control

Thus, lower Growth Control and higher Essence Totals make for better 
weapons.  With 100 Essence points total, you're nearly multiplying 
the original attack power by 9, and that's without multiplying due 
to Varnishing (which usually doubles the attack power at least)...

On armor, the only thing that matters is Essence Markers - each type 
of armor has a different essence requirement for Essence Markers.  
For pendants, for example, you need only one Essence for a marker.  
For armor, you need four (I think).
Once you have the Essence Marker, you'll get reduced damage from 
that element, although nobody is exactly sure how much, or if 
multiple Aura-marker armors will protect you more from Aura than 
only one...

Finally, essences are important for getting certain Mystic Cards.  
Yggdrasil, for example, requires 5 Dryad, while Nymph of the Sky 
requires Wisp essence of 3 or more, and a total of 5 or more, to 
appear.

^__^

Does this help?

> 
> Notes:
> X=coin of the element you're trying to raise
> fq=flaming quill
> m=mercury for shade,aura,jinn,undine
>  =sulpher for wisp,dryad,sala,gnome
> 
> Blocks-2nd element won't raise if the first is present (generally 
> the 1st element also drains the second)
> (wisp blocks shade, aura blocks dryad, sala blocks gnome blocks 
jinn 
> blocks undine blocks sala)
> 
> Supports-2nd element won't drain if the 1st is present (this is a 
> BAD thing)
> (sala supports jinn supports sala, gnome supports undine supports 
> gnome)
> 
> 0->9
> X	1
> m	2
> m	3
> glow	4
> fq	5
> fq	6

> 3 glow
> 2 m

That recipe will give you FAR more than 316 Attack Power - closer to 
800, I'd think.

107 Essences (the maximum on Dragonscales, I think) doesn't let you 
reach 999 with Gloves, sadly, but it's better than 103 / 104 
Essences on DiorWood, due to the material...
So if you use the Uberrecipe, that's the BEST glove you'll ever 
get.  Using the 100-Total one, you won't have the BEST--- but it'll 
be pretty darned close.

Bumpkins are produce that must be grown (that is, you can't buy them 
at the Bone Fortress).  However, they're not very rare.  Simply try 
Small Seed + Small Seed --- Bumpkin is an Orange-coloured produce.

From: "Myst Erik Ery" <tagged_jc@yahoo.com>

X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=116656188
X-Yahoo-Profile: tagged_jc

Just buy Gold Clover for 1000 Lucre a pop at the Bone Fortress.

Just 1 Wind Cap + 4 Clear Feathers is worth a little over 26 of these 
beauties, so if you have done any money-tempering at all, you've 
likely enough to buy 99 Gold Clovers..

If you REALLY want to know, Spiny Seed + Round Seed has the best 
chances of yielding a Gold Clover (6.25%).

> > 100 essences
> 
> How'd that recipe work out? 

It worked out ok. Its mainly an exercise in understanding 
consumptions. Sort of a meta-recipe to share some of the idioms of 
tempering.

The uber recipe is much shorter, but it doesn't really try to get you 
to understand tempering at all. A number of people get lost when the 
last step mistakenly uses mercury instead of sulpher.

Future mode and gather the materials first.  Slowly but surely 
starting to understand the process bit by bit.  Just the whole thing

grand scheme of things is something I've never been good at.

questions and get an answer.

able to start smithing anything I want without a pre-published recipe.

--- In LoM_Kitchen@yahoogroups.com, "prudence_halliwel_beresford" 
<prudence_halliwel_beresford@y...> wrote:
> Hi people!!!
> Ive seen your posting in Gamefaqs about this group, and it seems to 
> be a fun a group.
> I have few question regarding of item, especially rare item
> Is there any way to increase the chance to get this item? Ive bring 
a 
> polterbox, kill a wooding, chimera beast, chess knight,etc, and all 
i 
> get is not what i want. Hollywood, marble,healing claw...
> And,is the land effect you to get and item. Like i get a devil fork
> (altena alloy spear)from imp in lucemia, and not in other land
> Thanks for your answer
> 
> Prue

Level is also another factor.  If a monster is lvl 40 or under, 
there's like nil chance you'll get a rare item like DiorWood or 
DragonScales.  So beat the game and change to Nightmare or No Future 
mode to help increase your chances.

I'm sure I don't need to remind you to stand next to your polter box 
when you land the finishing blow for the synch effect, but also 
wouldn't hurt to max his luck up to 99.  Kinda tedious, but all pet 
growth is.  Buy Gold Clovers from Bone Fortress and put them in the 
polter box's feed box (two at a time), and then go xp with him a 
little until he levels up, go back, put in two more, go level him, go 
back, etc, etc, etc.  Should take somewhere near 50 clovers and 25 
levels to get his luck all the way up.  It may or may not have a big 
impact, but still never hurts.  If anything, it's at least good 
superstition =p

Also reported better rare item drops if you farm them on Aura day.

So max out your box's luck, put it on No Future mode, go on Aura day, 
and have some patience.  I was farming a bunch of dragon blood for 
the beefy amulet, and in the like 4 hours it took in Fieg Snowfields 
to get 15 vials, I seen 2 DragonScales drop.  So the rare components 
can take a while.

Good luck!

Was just fixing to finally settle down and spend some time to Red 
Mage up a pet.  I think I settled on a Sky Dragon as the partner I 
want to take out when I want to do some damage.  But was trying to 
plot out a diet, and I got curious...

Only meats I know of that increase pet stats are Animal, Bug and 
Lizard.  I have 74 Dragon Steaks from farming blood for the pendant, 
so I figured I'd look around and see if they did anything.  Having 
not found any data on the subject, I decided to parse some data for 
myself.  Got my level 1 Sky Dragon, fed him one Dragon Steak, went 
and leveled him, fed him one Dragon Steak, leveled him, rinse, 
lather, repeat.  Well, my original plan was to get him to level 11, 
each time feeding him one steak per level, then subracting the values 
he would normally gain from leveling to see what the steaks gave him 
stat wise.  Well, after 4 levels, his stats are exactly congruent 
with what they normally would be as if you fed him nothing at all.  
So I guess I've come to the conclusion that Dragon Steaks give no 
beneficial or detrimental stats per feeding.

But what about other meats?  Odd, Morph, etc.  Do those give any 
beneficial stats?  Or is Animal/Bug/Lizard the only ones?  I figure 
someone else has probably done the parsing already within the last 3 
years, so wanted to check and see if anyone else knew anything in 
that regard before I go spend a week parsing the effects of all 
meats, only to find that those previous 3 listed were the only ones 
with any beneficial properties =P

You are correct.  Only Animal/Bug/Lizard Meats affect pets at all, 
and all meats have the same effect in tempering - they provide 16 
energy and that is it.

Dragon Steaks are best sold.

> > I would also like to know. I'm new and would like to have a semi 
> > accurate list of planting combinations to help build my armor and

> > --- In LoM_Kitchen@yahoogroups.com, "ragnar0kzero" 
> <mr_cool_604@h...> 
> > wrote:
> > > plz help again

My advice is to go buy them.  1000 Lucre a pop at the vendor at Bone 
Fortress, but even if they were 5000 a pop, I'd still buy them.  
They're stupidly rare to actually grow.  About 6% if you use 
Spiny/Round combination, and about 3% if you use Flat/Round 
combination.

1k is really absolutely nothing.  Go to Lake Kilma (or Luon Highway) 
and farm WindCaps from Spiny Cones and Clear Feathers from Stinger 
Bugs.  Get 4 Feathers per Cap.  Forge 4 Feathers into one Cap.  Go 
sell.  Poor man's way of Lucre farming.  Also posted a recipe that 
adds 40k Lucre value to a weapon in Files.  Yields more Lucre return, 
but requires Pine 'O Clocks to temper in for the Ragnarok card.  
They're a bit uncommon to farm though.

Also note a few things about raising Luck in pets.  Gold Clovers 
yield 2 Luck per Clover when your pet levels up.  I think the max 
stat growth you can have in a pet per level up is 2.75.  So if you 
feed him one Gold Clover (L1000), his Luck goes up by 1.  If you feed 
him two Gold Clovers (L2000), his Luck goes up by 2.75.  If you feed 
him three Gold Clovers (L3000), his Luck goes up by 2.75.  So don't 
bother feeding your pet 3 at a time.  And only feed him two at a time 
if you're very insistant on maxxing his Luck quickly.  Just adding 
one Gold Clover per feeding is the most economical and effecient way 
to spend your Lucre/time spent farming Gold Clovers.

Someone chime in if I'm wrong.

You're right, but he was asking about all sorts of produce, and not 
just Gold Clovers (which I already suggested to simply buy).

One small thing to note: Luck only helps the person who does the 
killing.  So, raising a Polterbox's Luck is pointless.  Why?  A 
Polterbox does NOT benefit from its own Synchro.
You'll get rarer items killing the enemy yourself with the Rare Item 
Synchro than by letting the Polterbox (or any other Pet, for that 
matter) kill them.

Of course, you should try to max the Luck of any pets you like to 
use - then you'll find rarer items when just plain wandering!

^_^

Subject: Regarding Spam
Message-ID: <boc7ic+lg6s@eGroups.com>
User-Agent: eGroups-EW/0.82
MIME-Version: 1.0
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=ISO-8859-1
Content-Length: 1452
X-Mailer: Yahoo Groups Message Poster
X-eGroups-Announce: yes
From: "Myst Erik Ery" <tagged_jc@yahoo.com>
X-Originating-IP: 66.218.66.104
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=116656188
X-Yahoo-Profile: tagged_jc

This Group is for discussion of Legend of Mana.  I realize that the 
topic can stray somewhat, at times - this is not bad.
Talking about any of the Seiken Densetsu games - or games in 
general - is perfectly acceptible and welcomed.

However, if you come here just to post spam (that is, unsolicited 
advertising or messages that are completely different from the 
subject of this Group), please be advised that I delete the spam 
from the Group's Message Archive and remove you from the group.

I do not ban unless there is a recurring problem, so you can always 
join again if you realize you were out of line.  So don't feel 
afraid to talk about things that MIGHT be considered off-topic.  So 
long as you're here to talk about Legend of Mana, too, there's no 
problem!
And, as always, you can contact me via Messenger or personal email 
to ask if something is too off-topic, or even ask for permission to 
post a link to another site even if it isn't a Legend of Mana-
related site.

Finally, do not reply to messages that could be considered 'spam'.  
Doing so is also 'spam' itself, considering #1 --- it gets sent to 
the group.  It's nice to know other people don't like it, but it's 
just as constructive as the original message, so it's a little 
hypocritical.  #2 --- the original message is often sent in the 
reply.  I can't just delete the message, then - the message remains 
intact and available for viewing.

Thank you for your time!

from imp in lucemia,so can you get it in other place?
> 
> 
> ---------------------------------
> Do you Yahoo!?
> Protect your identity with Yahoo! Mail AddressGuard

Furthest extent of my knowledge... Level is what affects the drop 
rate on rare items.  Which is why most farming is done on Nightmare 
or No Future mode.  If the mob is under level 40, there is nil chance 
of getting access to the rarer items from it's loot table.  Also, 
some 'superstition' in regards to farming on Aura days.  Some say on 
any day, it takes like an average of 2 hours to get a piece of 
DiorWood.  Some say on Aura days, it takes half hour to an hour.  
Takes less than a minute to arrange your farming to land on Aura day, 
so why not try?  Also, drops are mob based, not location based.  So 
you can get DiorWood from the Woodlings in Gato, White Forest or Mana 
Tree, just whichever yields the highest level Woodlings is where you 
want to farm.

Also, as far as a map goes for like Jungle... Could self map it.  If 
no graph paper, could make squares on a regular sheet of paper with a 
pencil and a ruler.  And just mark down what direction you went, and 
maybe put a little note like what mobs are in that particular screen.

Was trying to farm Moth Wings one day in the Jungle with the x2 
Zombine/Gloomoth combo in a screen, and after like an hour, got what 
I needed, and on my way out, I came across a screen that was just 2 
Gloomoths.  Took 10 minutes to get the same amount of wings from them 
as it did the previous encounter, due to loading time between screens 
as well as twice the chances of getting the drop.

X-Yahoo-Profile: darkenesis

Err, sorry.  Meant to say Level is the only thing that affects drop 
rate as far as land placement goes.

Luck on the one who landed the finishing blow is another factor you 
can control (eg: get your Luck as high as possible).

Also, the synch on Polterbox pets makes them your farming friend.  If 
you're in synch with the box when you land the finishing blow, it 
forces the mob to drop an item.  More specifically, a higher chance 
of a rare item.

So head to the Junkyard and get some eggs until one hatches into a 
Polterbox and use it's synch to help you farm rare items.

If I knew where the edit was, I would have editted my previous 
message instead of replying with another, so forgive me =p

It's dependant on the enemy's level only.  Land Placement affects 
enemy levels, but if you place Lucemia early and close to home, then 
the Imps at the Junkyard will probably be a higher level (especially 
if you place it far away and very late).

Poison Blade takes up the same slot as quick blade so you won't be
able to use the usual varnish. But using the tempering_1.0.txt recipe
and ending with

pine oclock
bumpkin
bumpkin
dangerous eye
lilipod
sharp claw

should get you a 208 lorant silver knife with poison blade.

  by mta1.grp.scd.yahoo.com with SMTP; 15 Nov 2003 00:56:12 -0000

Date: Sat, 15 Nov 2003 00:56:11 -0000
To: LoM_Kitchen@yahoogroups.com
Subject: Re: Consume/draining wisp/shade  aura/dryad
Message-ID: <bp3tjb+o10b@eGroups.com>
In-Reply-To: <bp377e+lval@eGroups.com>
User-Agent: eGroups-EW/0.82
MIME-Version: 1.0
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=ISO-8859-1
Content-Length: 1986
X-Mailer: Yahoo Groups Message Poster
From: "Myst Erik Ery" <tagged_jc@yahoo.com>
X-Originating-IP: 66.218.66.80
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=116656188
X-Yahoo-Profile: tagged_jc

TP = Taining Point.  You get one of these per Essence Card, and one 
from some items, of a particular Essence.  Each TP allows the Essence 
to raise by 1.

If Wisp > Shade and there is a Wisp or Shade TP present, Shade will 
drain to 0.
If Wisp > Shade and there is a Dryad TP present, Aura will drain one 
level.
If Shade > Wisp and there is an Aura TP present, Dryad will drain one 
level.
If Shade = Wisp, Aura and Dryad are free to raise freely.

Under Mirrored World:
If Shade > Wisp and there is a Wisp or Shade TP present, Wisp will 
drain to 0.
If Shade > Wisp and there is a Dryad TP present, Aura will drain one 
level.
If Wisp > Shade and there is an Aura TP present, Dryad will drain one 
level.
If Shade = Wisp, Aura and Dryad are free to raise freely.

Energy gained from a drain is equal to:
( Resistance * 2^(New Level) )
This is done BEFORE lowering resistances with Wizard Cards, so you 
can theoretically drain something, and then use the energy it 
produces to raise itself AND something else up, by lowering the 
Resistance through the use of Wizard Cards.

If Shade and Wisp are at 7, it's likely possible to drain ONE of them 
to 0, but the other will have to be at least at 8, then.  You can 
never lower the Wisp-or-Shade Total below whatever it's at now.  So, 
if you have 0/1, you can never get to 0/0.  Only to 2/0 or 0/2 (or 
2/1 or 1/2, but those are like 'duh', yesno?).  At 2/0, you can only 
get to 0/3 or 3/0 or some other combination involving a 3.
So if you have 7/7, you can only get 8/0 or 0/8.  ^_^
See?

Strongest 1HSword is 977 (986 or somesuch with the 105 Essences 
recipe), with +9 all stats and any plunges you like.  DiorWood is 
best for Swords, but swords generally are some of the worst 
equipments in existance due to their balanced attributes.

Highest 1hand sword possible is 986 with +9 to all stats using Dior 
Wood.  If you wanted higher stat bonuses you'd really lose out  on 
the attack power and sala essence.

On the other hand, you can make a 999 DragonScale Hammer with +20 
stats + plunge.  But this only because Hammers have an obscenely 
high natural Force rate which makes the Varnish do wonders with the 
attack value.  A 2 Handed Axe version would be in the low 900's (999 
for Diorwood, but no Salamander)

Here are 2 numbers for ya

DragonScales 1handed Sword with +20 stats: 585 attack power

Diorwood 1handed Sword with +20 stats: 687 attack power (Salamander 
must be 0)

Not being a smithing guru, I can't quite offer recipes and comments 
to add, other than maybe go 2hs instead of 1hs.

Then you can craft up a master suit of armor, put on a sick pendant 
(recipe found in the recipes posted on the site, 20 to all stats with 
resistance to everything), and have a spot for a smithing up a 
ForbiddenRing 2.0, or another stat buster item if you're done with 
raising pets.

I really wanted to do the "sword of mana" for fun. Seriouly, I have=20
made a VizelGold glove (named HolyThief) in the past that helps me=20
throught the No Future mode easily, so I don't need ubber weapons.

Now, it is possible to make a 999 2h sword? At the time I played,=20
there was only one essence forging formula (made by Kevin or=20
something like that); nowadays there are many formulas. And without a=20
computer, I can=B4t truly analyze those. That's why I am asking; I=20
didn't even knew that stats could go up to 10...

And by the way: did somebody already discovered how to put the=20
Icebrand plunge on a sword? There was many plunges undiscovered last=20
time I played...

Last: About the 40k formula: it is a very good formula, but i prefer=20
to forge 4 clear feathers in a WindCap. It is much more cheaper (just=20
need an hour in Luon Highway to get the ingredients) and they sell=20
for 20k. Saves the precious Pine O'Clock...

See ya!

You can get a 999 2handed Sword from either Diorwood(Slash +9 stats)=20
or DragonScales(Force +1 Stats) (Slash version would be 991 +9=20
stats).  As for recipes, just look under the files section, recipe=20
folder, uber recipes.

There is no such plunge of Icebrand for Swords.  Closest thing is=20
Icicle which is an Unique Plunge on some Bows the Chobinhoods drop=20
(just in case, I took a peek in Terences Forge Code.txt just verify=20
before I typed this, plunges ain't my thing :P ).

No problem!

No, as far as I know, the unobtainable Plunges are just as special 
as ordinary Plunges - that is, not very.
They slightly change damage and provide various bonuses or statuses 
against certain monster types and sometimes raise or lower your or 
your enemy's stats... But other than that, there isn't anything 
particularly unique about any Plunge Attacks other than Golden Touch 
and Hand of Midas --- these, if used to defeat the enemy, change all 
Exp Crystals to Lucre.

--- In LoM_Kitchen@yahoogroups.com, "Myst Erik Ery" <tagged_jc@y...>
wrote:
> TP = Taining Point.  You get one of these per Essence Card, and one 
> from some items, of a particular Essence.  Each TP allows the
Essence 
> to raise by 1.
> 
> If Wisp > Shade and there is a Wisp or Shade TP present, Shade will 
> drain to 0.
> If Wisp > Shade and there is a Dryad TP present, Aura will drain
one 
> level.
> If Shade > Wisp and there is an Aura TP present, Dryad will drain
one 
> level.
> If Shade = Wisp, Aura and Dryad are free to raise freely.
> 
> Under Mirrored World:
> If Shade > Wisp and there is a Wisp or Shade TP present, Wisp will 
> drain to 0.
> If Shade > Wisp and there is a Dryad TP present, Aura will drain
one 
> level.

> If Wisp > Shade and there is an Aura TP present, Dryad will drain
one 
> level.
> If Shade = Wisp, Aura and Dryad are free to raise freely.
> 
> This is done BEFORE lowering resistances with Wizard Cards, so you 
> can theoretically drain something, and then use the energy it 
> produces to raise itself AND something else up, by lowering the 
> Resistance through the use of Wizard Cards.
> 
> If Shade and Wisp are at 7, it's likely possible to drain ONE of
them 
> to 0, but the other will have to be at least at 8, then.  You can 
> never lower the Wisp-or-Shade Total below whatever it's at now. 
So, 
> if you have 0/1, you can never get to 0/0.  Only to 2/0 or 0/2 (or 
> 2/1 or 1/2, but those are like 'duh', yesno?).  At 2/0, you can
only 
> get to 0/3 or 3/0 or some other combination involving a 3.
> So if you have 7/7, you can only get 8/0 or 0/8.  ^_^
> See?
> 
> --- In LoM_Kitchen@yahoogroups.com, "cane554" <cane554@y...> wrote:
> > how do you drain these?  if wisp and shade is both at 7 can you 
> drain
> > them?  If not, why?  If so how?  On any material or just some
> > materials?  What is the process the weapon goes thru when you 
> drain? 
> > how much energy is released at each step and how is it applied to 
> the
> > item?  How does the sorcerer and witch cards fit into all of this
as
> > well.
> >

Concerning the Wisp Shade draining.

Lets take your example of have 6 Wisp and 6 Shade.

If you Drain Shade by making Wisp 7, you'll get ALL the energy from 
Shade 0 => 6.  Meaning you'll get

10*2^0 + 10*2^1 + 10*2^2 + 10*2^3 + 10*2^4 + 10+2^5 = 630 Energy

OR

(10*2^6) - 10 = 630 (you'd subtract whatever the essence resistance 
to get the correct value)

When it comes to draining Wisp/Shade Essences, it would look like 
you'd get more energy than you actually do.  To date there haven't 
been any "practical" uses for draining Wisp/Shade.

Without Draining, you could get Wisp/Shade/ConflictEssence to 7.  
Everything else can get to 9. (7/7/9/9/9/7/9/7) *have done this*

I should point out that in your example, you won't be able to get 
Shade => 7 without the use of Draining and a Mirrored Piece (this is 
due to the fact Wisp is present).  Normally you could go 6 => 7 by 
adding Glow, Glow Glow, Mercury, Mercury, Shade, Glow.

With JUST draining I "think" that you can get the final essence 
values of 12/12/11/11/10/7/10/7 On AltenaAlloy  <= This is still 
possible with your setup.  Though it would take an absurd amount of 
Glow Crystals + more than average Gold Coins.  *personally never 
done this*  Though... now that I think about it, you might need a 
mirror piece or two for it.

If you try to get fancy with the above Draining recipe, and feel 
confident about your tempering abilities, you may as well try 
AsianGrinch Uber Recipe via Mirrored Pieces.  Final Essence values 
would end up 15/15/14/14/15/7/15/7.  It seriously cuts down on "raw" 
materials at the expence of using about 15+ mirrored pieces.  *have 
done this*

*Disclaimer* All numbers are based off the Material of AltenaAlloy
