MIME-Version: 1.0
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=ISO-8859-1
Content-Length: 5671
X-Mailer: Yahoo Groups Message Poster
From: "Myst Erik Ery" <tagged_jc@yahoo.com>
X-Originating-IP: 66.218.66.104
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=116656188
X-Yahoo-Profile: tagged_jc

The problem with Wisp and Shade is that only Shade and Wisp CARDS 
which are NEWER than the Wizard Cards are affected by the Wizard 
Cards.  Otherwise they're normal.
If you were to drain Shade with Wisp, if Shade was level 6 before, 
you'd now have:
10 * 2^5 + 10 * 2^4 + 10 * 2^3 + 10 * 2^2 + 10 * 2^1 + 10 * 2^0
= 10 * 32 + 10 * 16 + 10 * 8 + 10 * 4 + 10 * 2 + 10
= 320 + 160 + 80 + 40 + 20 + 10
= 630 energy.

You won't be able to drain Shade just by adding Wisp - you'll have 
to drain Shade by having Wisp GREATER than Shade, and then adding 
EITHER Shade or Wisp.

If Wisp and Shade are both 6, then I'm fairly certain it's 
impossible, without draining, to raise Shade to 7.
Raising Shade to 7 is only possible with at least two Wizard Cards 
(with two Wizard Cards, it requires 192 energy, which can be 
obtained from a Nymph of Dawn Card).
However, that means you're stuck with three Cards - two Wizard Cards 
and a Shade Card.  That leaves you with only one more spot to work 
with - the leaving card, since it can either be Mirrored World (to 
allow Shade to drain Wisp) or Nymph of Dawn (to give energy).  If 
you pick the former, you won't be able to raise Shade anyway, due to 
the lack of energy.  If the latter, you won't be able to raise Shade 
due to the conflict.
So, unless you can manage to drain something into Shade that allows 
you to raise it to 7 using only one Wizard Card (384 energy 
required), you're probably stuck.

If you raise Salamander (or anything on the lower row, really) to 6, 
you can do it.

If Sala is at 6, you'd just add:
Mirror Piece
Mercury
Shade Silver
Gnome Gold

So, when you add the Gnome Gold, Sala drains to 5 and gives off (10 
* 2^5) 320 energy.  Adding the 64 from the Gnome Gold itself, that's 
384 energy, which is promptly used on Shade, which then drains Wisp 
to 0 for 630 energy, which is used to raise Gnome to 1 (:P) and 
wasted.
Then you'd have 0/7/0/0/5/1/0/0

Also, you can do this:
Mirror Piece
Mercury
Shade Silver
Lilipod / Glow Crystal / something else
Gnome Gold

That way, when you add your next item, Salamander won't drain any 
more (the top way had it draining next time, too, which would be a 
waste).


--- In LoM_Kitchen@yahoogroups.com, "cane554" <cane554@y...> wrote:

> wrote:
> > TP = Taining Point.  You get one of these per Essence Card, and 
one 
> > from some items, of a particular Essence.  Each TP allows the
> Essence 
> > to raise by 1.
> > 
> > If Wisp > Shade and there is a Wisp or Shade TP present, Shade 
will 
> > drain to 0.
> > If Wisp > Shade and there is a Dryad TP present, Aura will drain
> one 
> > level.
> > If Shade > Wisp and there is an Aura TP present, Dryad will drain
> one 
> > level.
> > If Shade = Wisp, Aura and Dryad are free to raise freely.
> > 
> > Under Mirrored World:
> > If Shade > Wisp and there is a Wisp or Shade TP present, Wisp 
will 
> > drain to 0.
> > If Shade > Wisp and there is a Dryad TP present, Aura will drain
> one 
> > level.
> 
> > If Wisp > Shade and there is an Aura TP present, Dryad will drain
> one 
> > level.
> > If Shade = Wisp, Aura and Dryad are free to raise freely.
> > 
> > This is done BEFORE lowering resistances with Wizard Cards, so 
you 
> > can theoretically drain something, and then use the energy it 
> > produces to raise itself AND something else up, by lowering the 
> > Resistance through the use of Wizard Cards.
> > 
> > If Shade and Wisp are at 7, it's likely possible to drain ONE of
> them 
> > to 0, but the other will have to be at least at 8, then.  You 
can 
> > never lower the Wisp-or-Shade Total below whatever it's at now. 
> So, 
> > if you have 0/1, you can never get to 0/0.  Only to 2/0 or 0/2

> only 
> > get to 0/3 or 3/0 or some other combination involving a 3.

From: ekm3777 <no_reply@yahoogroups.com>

No such recipe has been written out.  My AltenaAlloy Spear 
(Longinus) I made was kinda my initiation into tempering in knowing 
how it works and why it did.  Taking all the scraps of information I 
found Marcus' Faq, everything that Myst said about using Drain 
Energy to raise MORE than just one Essence level, etc...

While I've never used the DragonScale recipe, I'd imagine its 
essiently the same thing thing when you start the draining process.

But here's what to do to get started

Dryad => 9, Aura => 9, Any Bottom Essence => 9 (just 1)

Once thats done, the real fun begins.  If you can figure out what to 
do from there, pat yourself on the back ;)

The basic idea though is to Drain Dryad/Aura/Bottom Essence off each 
other in such a way, that'll you'll get all 3 to 15.  While raising 
Shade and Wisp only when absolute necessary.

With the Essence Values you have on your weapon now, this won't be 
possible because Shade/Wisp are too high for the manipulation.

Keep 2 save files.  The original save file before you do ANY 
tempering, and the Save file that you use while you Temper.

Also, you might want to have a 3rd completely new file (different 
hero name) up to the point where you have access to Prof. Bombs 
Workshop.  Where you can sell items to other players for the Dupe 
Trick so you don't have to play LoM completely through 5 times to 
get all the necessary mirror pieces.

Works like this.

Original Save: Create Weapon, Do Tempering etc...

Temp Save: Save all your tempering process here, when outta 
materials that are hard to come by, go to Prof Bomb and put your 
Weapon up for Sale.

New Save: Purchase the Weapon from Prof Bomb, then sell it back to 
him, Save your Game in your Temp Save Spot.

Original Save: Purchase your weapon from Prof. Bomb and you have all 
your 2ndary materials to use all over again.  This also includes the 
Primary Material you used to initially make the weapon (like 
DiorWood and DragonScales so long as you didn't save over Original 
after you made the weapon)

If you get very serious about tempering, this is practically a must 
have :)

There are some rare Items that are hard to find in the game (example
'ash')  

Maybe one of these can "store" released energy... If you could store a
drained essence's energy into the first slot with a card then release
it when it leaves the last slot, (like a nymph of dawn leaving gives
192)  then wouldn't it be possible to level up those last few essences
to 15?

For example only, lets PRETEND that 'STORECRYS' is the item:

So we drain dryad and store it into STORECRYS

---   STORECRYS   GARLICCROWN
---   ---------   STORECRYS
---   ---------   -----------
---   ---------   -----------

Then (with the stats being 15/15/14/15/15/9/15/9) we release it into
Undine for 2 essence levels:

GARLICCROWN   UNDINESILVER   CHAOSCRYS      UNDINESILVER
STORECRYS     KING           UNDINE         ANCIENTMOON
-----------   STORECRYS      KING           UNDINE
-----------   ------------   STORECRYS      KING  (STORECRYS leaves)

When STORECRYS leaves it would level up undine 2 levels.
15/15/14/15/15/9/15/11

Wouldn't it be nice?  To get Undine from 14 to 15 all you need to do
is throw in the appropriate wizard card:

UNDINESILVER
ANCIENTMOON
WIZARDCARD
KING   (STORECRYS)

If my technique isn't quite accurate I'm sorry I haven't perfected it
yet but I think you get the Idea.  The idea is that you can get the
energy from a consumption as use it while an ancientmoon is in play so
you can level conflicting essences.

I will experiment.  If this isn't true, I believe there HAS to be a
way to max all levels otherwise why would they stop the levels at 15?
 Also this system is too complex for there NOT to be a way to get all
of the essences to 15.

----------------------------------------------------------------------

LOM is the best and SOM (Sword of Mana) is to be released soon!

Received: from unknown (HELO n28.grp.scd.yahoo.com) (66.218.66.84)
  by mta6.grp.scd.yahoo.com with SMTP; 25 Nov 2003 20:06:53 -0000
Received: from [66.218.67.154] by n28.grp.scd.yahoo.com with NNFMP; 25 Nov 2003 20:06:52 -0000
Date: Tue, 25 Nov 2003 20:06:51 -0000
To: LoM_Kitchen@yahoogroups.com
Subject: Re: Getting Every Essence to 15
Message-ID: <bq0cor+bjoc@eGroups.com>
In-Reply-To: <bq0c25+j0h3@eGroups.com>
User-Agent: eGroups-EW/0.82
MIME-Version: 1.0
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=ISO-8859-1
Content-Length: 1479
X-Mailer: Yahoo Groups Message Poster
From: "Myst Erik Ery" <tagged_jc@yahoo.com>
X-Originating-IP: 66.218.66.84
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=116656188
X-Yahoo-Profile: tagged_jc

"I will experiment. If this isn't true, I believe there HAS to be a
way to max all levels otherwise why would they stop the levels at 15?
Also this system is too complex for there NOT to be a way to get all
of the essences to 15."

There is no such item - all energy is discarded at the end of the 
tempering step.

Why can they go to 15?  Two reasons.  First, that's easiest to 
represent in the mechanics.  0 to 15 is actually 16 
different 'states' which is a half-byte of code.  This makes storing 
all eight essences in a row very easy, only taking up four bytes.

Secondly, you can raise any essence you want to, up to 15, pretty 
much.  You can easily raise a lower-row essence up to 15, and you 
can pick and choose which upper-row essences to get up to 15.  
Generally, raising the other lower-row essence involves complicated 
draining processes in the upper rows, where one level is drained to 
raise two different essences, but that leaves you short one point on 
one.  15/15/15/14/15/9/15/9.  The 9's are there due to conflicts - 
you can't raise them up without Ancient Moon, and you can't drain 
anything when Ancient Moon is there, so you'll never have enough 
energy to get past 9.  The 14 is there because in order to have 
raised Wisp and Salamander/Jinn to 15, you'll have had to drain 
something (in this case, Aura) from 15->14.  So you could probably 
have fiddled with it to make it Dryad, instead, but you really don't 
have much more options than that.

--- In LoM_Kitchen@yahoogroups.com, thereallarkas <no_reply@y...> 
wrote:
> I've just got the Heshishorin (for those who doesn't know, the

is an
> Altenna Alloy 2H Sword) and I don't have a clue on how to temper 
it.
> In fact, I don't know how to temper anything, and I don't want to
> screw up such a powerful sword just for tests... Can someone post a
> full recipe for me to temper it, or at least tell me where to get 
it?
> I'd be very grateful. Remember, I want to make it as powerful as
> possible, so I can make it deserve its name!

Then you should get some Diorwood, Forge a 2hander Sword, name it 
Heshishorin...

Seriously,  the moment you temper ONE item into Heshishorin, it'll 
revert back to a normal AltenaAlloy 2hSword losing any base bonuses 
it came with (and even that isn't a huge loss).

Crash Course in Tempering:  Attack power is determined by the TOTAL 
essence values (wisp through undine), so your first goal is to get 
them as high as possible (total essence acts like an overall 
multplier to the overall attack power)).  Once thats done, you can 
do anything extra (plunges, stat boosters) then add a Varnish 
(manipulations of the Material attack values, more effective with 
higher essence values).

Go to gamefaqs and read Marcus' tempering FAQ.  Then read it again.

Read this threads replies for slightly more info

http://groups.yahoo.com/group/LoM_Kitchen/message/415

From: ekm3777 <no_reply@yahoogroups.com>

X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=101367387; email=no
X-Yahoo-Profile: ekm3777

--- In LoM_Kitchen@yahoogroups.com, thereallarkas <no_reply@y...> 
wrote:
> Algebra??? Well, I guess I won't be very good at tempering... 
> Hahahaha, kiddin', I wasn't good but I wasn't that bad either... 
> Anyways, how do I use those resistance numbers?

Resistance Level * 2 ^ Current Essence Level = Energy Needed to Raise

So if the resistance level was 10, and the current essence level was 
3 it would be

10*2^3 = 80 Energy

Basically the Essence won't raise again till you direct an items 
energy into the Essence.  In this case, it would take a Glow Crystal 
since it holds 96 energy.

Go here for a list of all items and their Energy Values.

http://www.geocities.com/xo_pitseleh/lom2.html 

Bottom of this page shows the energy required for the first 9 Levels 
of Essence.

http://www.geocities.com/xo_pitseleh/lom4.html

(same list is in Marcus' Faq)

...

Actually, now that I look at those numbers, they're SOOO inaccurate 
at some parts its not even funny... So just use the above formula.  
Though the table there will give you the basic idea on how the 
Essence values increase.

Here's a list of Mystic Cards and what they do

http://www.geocities.com/xo_pitseleh/lom3.html

For the most part, these are fairly accurate with maybe 1 or 2 
mistakes.  (description for Moth Wing should say +50% to magic d for 
example)

There's also the Force Code.txt on this sight in the files section 
which is totally accurate, its just that the above web sight are 
easier on the eyes :)

X-Yahoo-Profile: nano_biquts

> What's the best armor you can get and still be able to 
> regenerate and revive?

Dragonscale armor with an evil god card and yggdrasil. Use 
dragonblood or toadstoolsheds to get stats up to +20. Just be sure 
not to use needle(ttuce) or springana.
Then use an adamantite pendant and a mantle or ring. Recipes for the 
last few things are listed at the end of the armor.txt file.

**RIDDLE**
Chumpy made a dragonscale armor like the one described above. What is 
the fewest number of dragonblood/toadstoolsheds he could have used?

> **RIDDLE**
> Chumpy made a dragonscale armor like the one described above. What 
is 
> the fewest number of dragonblood/toadstoolsheds he could have used?

Considering you can use Metropolis + Clown to raise your Bonuses to 
+12 with a Yggdrasil Card, you'd just have:

(Leviathan)Yggdrasil/Clown/Metropolis
with +12 all,

Then simply go:

(---)/Leviathan/Yggdrasil/Clown

And add two Dragon's Blood.  That's +15, then +20 all.  Ta da!

> That would end up +15 to all... not 20

Due to bonuses order, meh.  Go with:

(Metropolis)Clown/Yggdrasil/Metropolis
And then
(Leviathan)Metropolis/Clown/Metropolis
And then
(Yggdrasil)Leviathan/Metropolis/Clown (-1 all)
And then
(---)Yggdrasil/Leviathan/Metropolis
And then add three Dragon's Blood.

Three'd be the minimum, I suppose, due to the fact that item bonuses 
get applied first, and then cards from right to left (bottom to 
top)...

Really, two will get you two +20, it's just that it goes back down 
to +15 immediately after because it <i>should</i> be getting to a 
little MORE than +20, and then fall back down to +20...

Subject: Re: Heshishorin
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=116656188
X-Yahoo-Profile: tagged_jc

You must allow your game to 'see' a Saga Frontier 2 saved game, by 
going to a Save or Load screen (for example, a Save Statue's 'Save') 
and choosing a Memory Card Slot that has the Saga Frontier 2 saved 
game on it.  After that, when you defeat Deathbringer II, you'll get 
it automatically.

From: "nano_biquts" <jonh@polter.net>
X-Originating-IP: 130.207.140.184
Subject: FILE: armor.txt
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=22685443
X-Yahoo-Profile: nano_biquts

DragonScaleArmor and AdamantitePendants are the "best" armor because
they have the highest values for material and equipment type.
Pendants also allow you to get all of the status immunities on a
single item.

1. Max armor values
Great high defense, but you can't regenerate hp.
  DragonScaleArmor 98/98/99/6
    round seed
    3 needle(ttuce)
    sleepy eye
  AdamantitePendant 0/0/0/95
    stinky breath
    fire stone
    sulpher
    sulpher
    holy water
    zombie claw
    blackened Bat
    ghost howl
    sharp claw
    water stone
    fishy fruit
    squalphin
    round seed
    3 needle(ttuce)
    moth wing

2. High armor values
Pretty much the same as the first one but uses heaven scales card
from springana so you can regenerate hp (even while moving), but
now you can't revive.
  DragonScaleArmor 65/65/68/4
    round seed
    2 needle(ttuce)
    springana
    sleepy eye
  AdamantitePendant 0/0/0/78
    stinky breath
    fire stone
    sulpher
    sulpher
    holy water
    zombie claw
    blackened Bat
    ghost howl
    sharp claw
    water stone
    fishy fruit
    squalphin
    round seed
    2 needle(ttuce)
    springana
    moth wing

3. High stats
With a maxed out hp stat you'll regenerate damage faster than you can
take it in most situations. This setup also raises your luck more than
the others can. Since the armor values aren't critical to this setup
you can make the first three items out of anything (the shoes show 
what
needs to change to work on wood). The pendant recipe relies on the
particular resistances of adamantite in a number of places, but it can
be replaced with menos bronze and any other material with the same
resistances.
  Mantle
    round seed
    3 sulpher
    round seed
    sun crystal
    needle(ttuce)
    spiny seed
    poison fang
    spiny seed
    white feather (regen while moving)
    X meat
    lilipod
  Ring
    round seed
    3 sulpher
    round seed
    needle(ttuce)
    spiny seed
    poison fang
    spiny seed
    ear of wheat (exp share)
    X meat
    lilipod
  Shoes
    round seed
    3 sulpher
    round seed
    needle(ttuce)
    spiny seed
    poison fang
    spiny seed
    loquat-shoes or pear o'heels (extra exp crystals)
    X meat
    lilipod
  WoodenShoes
    3 sulpher
    needle(ttuce)
    loquat-shoes or pear o'heels (extra exp crystals)
    spiny seed
    poison fang
    spiny seed
    X grave dirt
  AdamantitePendant
    stinky breath
    fire stone
    sulpher
    sulpher
    holy water
    zombie claw
    blackened bat
    shade silver
    sharp claw
    water stone
    fishy fruit
    squalphin
    round seed
    sulpher
    sulpher
    gnome silver
    flaming quill
    wind stone
    sun crystal
    flaming quill
    flaming quill
    chaos crystal
    aura silver
    giants horn
    flaming quill
    sala gold
    needlettuce
    ghosts howl
    spiny seed 
    ghosts howl
    spiny seed
    virgins sigh (extra lucre)
    X meat
    moth wing

This isn't a very good walkthrough yet because a lot of it won't make 
sense if this
is your first time through the game, but I'll work on that.


------------------- 
|17|14|  |  |  |  |
|__|__|__|__|__|__|
|~~~~|13|15|  |  |  |
|__|__|__|__|__|__|
|  |12|  |  |  |~~~~|
|__|__|__|__|__|__|
|  |11|16|  | 8| 6|
|__|__|__|__|__|__|
|  |10|  | 9|  | 2|
|__|__|__|__|__|__| 
|  | 7| 5| 4| 3| 1|
|__|__|__|__|__|__|


1 Mailbox

2 Colorblocks
  get niccolo + Wheel

3 Wheel
  "Niccolo's Business Unusual" get Flame + Medallion, equip pot
  <-Domina- get deana
  "Geaus' Wisdom" equip ForbiddenRing
  <-Home- "Mana Orchards" grow orange (small or oblong+crooked)

<-Domina- "Little Sorcerors" get bud + lisa
<-Domina- "Monster Corral" get rabite

4 Medallion
  "Huntin' Du'Cate" get Sand Rose + Ancient Tablet

5 Ancient Tablet
  "Teatime of Danger" get Bottled Spirit + Rusty Anchor

6 Rusty Anchor

7 Bottled Spirit
  "Mine Your Own Business" get Moon's Mirror + Torch of Coral
  "Watts drops the hammer"
  <-Home- "Blacksmithing 101" improve ForbiddenRing

8 Torch of Coral

9 Moon's Mirror

10 Flame

11 Sand Rose
  "Reach for the Stars" get Broken Doll
  <-Home- "Music 101"

<-Domina- get elazul + Jade Egg

12 Jade Egg
  "The Lost Princess" get Stone Eye + Firefly Lamp

13 Broken Doll
  "The Infernal Doll" get Tome of Magic

14 Firefly Lamp
  "Faeries' Light" get Trembling Spoon

15 Stone Eye

16 Trembling Spoon

17 Tome of Magic

*** MAKE WEAPON ***
Have wisp+aura+sala silver from "Music 101"
Have sharp claw and acid from the jungle
<-Domina- buy 1 wind, 1 water, and 1 earth stone
<-Gato- buy 6 sulpher + 5 mercury (don't finish the quest you start 
there yet)
<-Lumina- buy 1 holy water, 1 chaos crystal
<-Geo- buy Altena  Felt, 56 power flute
<-Junkyard- play for a shade silver (maybe pick up a polter box while 
you're there)
Grow 3 bumpkin
Get 1 non-spiny seed and 1 spiny seed
Get 14 flaming quills from cocatrice/chocobos
Get 17 meats

There is a cardless tempering recipe floating around that uses 
Flaming Quills and other things found early. You can make a faily 
strong weapon using that. Some of the armor recipes here consist of 
easy to get items. Go to Gamefaqs.com and read the tempering guide 
there to get the gist (sp?) of the whole process and you'll start to 
understand how things work.

Here's what I need:  A recipe for CursedBone...
(Resistances 9/5/9/7/9/7/9/7)...
To reach EXACTLY 99 ESSENSE POINTS.

Doesn't matter about the material usage, but try to keep Mirror 
Piece losses as low as possible, of course - and try to use 
purchaseable or easy-to-get materials (ie meats), if you can, as 
opposed to rare things like Moth Wings or Electricity which I 
probably don't have much of.  ^_^

Final Essence numbers themselves don't matter, so long as the final 
total is 99.

It should be fairly easy, since it has a nice 9/7 thing going on 
(high and low resistance, making for nice draining).

with something that works nicely enough.  But if someone else gets 
it done first, that'd be perfectly fine, hehe!

From: "darkenesis" <darkenesis@yahoo.com>
X-Originating-IP: 65.176.105.248
Subject: Raising armor (mantle) defense
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=163805348
X-Yahoo-Profile: darkenesis

Well I have a little grasp in the ways of smithing weapons.  Recently 
(and FINALLY) got a hold of a little DiorWood.  After raising offense 
by essence levels, I capped my spear out with 
Bumpkin/Bumpkin/Bumpkin/Sharp Claw, and now it's sitting at 862 
offense.  Not too shabby.  Something I can most certainly live with.

However, my eyes hurt and it's quite late, and I did search a bit, 
and read up a bit, but I'm so gone right now.

Here's my dilemma.  I am wearing some DragonScaleArmor with 
65/65/68/4 defenses (I did the Needle/Needle/Springanana cap so it'd 
have high defense, but also the ability to regenerate.  My HP is 
capped out, so I enjoy regenning like a madman).  Currently I'm using 
my aptly named GigaRibbon (AdamantitePendant, 0/0/0/34, +20 all, 
immunities vs all, element defenses vs all) because well... It's just 
nuts on the stat and immunity bonuses.  And for the last piece, I 
have a re-created ForbiddenRing (Adamantite, 1/0/2/23 with minor stat 
boosts, but the ability to share xp).

Well, eventually I won't need to equip the ring because my Land 
Dragon will eventually be 99, and after raising various pets, I find 
I enjoy Land Dragons due to their breath weapon which causes 
Flameburst (the Sky Dragon's Freeze breath weapon is nice, but you 
can't continue doing damage when they're frosty'd, so I quickly 
dropped him after the hundredth time of having to wait the 10 seconds 
or however long for them to thaw).

So then I'm stuck with 66/65/70/61 armor values.  Not bad, but could 
be better.  Seeing how I'm wearing a full suit of armor, not much in 
the way of equipment I can create seeing how armor negates the use of 
many pieces of armor.

So I have one main question per se.  How does one raise base defense 
values *WITHOUT* the Bed of Thorns card?  With the spear, you simply 
raise the element essences up as high as you can, then cap it off 
with x3 Bumpkins and a Sharp Claw, and it's attack value sky 
rockets.  Not the case with armor...  I did some trial run essence 
raising, but that had no impact on the defense values what so ever.

I used DragonSkin for my Mantle material.  Partially because I have a 
ton from farming DragonScales, and partially because Aroma Oil gives 
+50% to Strike/Slash/Pierce values, and only works on Hide 
materials.  The starting defenses for a plain old DragonSkinMantle 
are 4/1/2/6.  I went Oblong Seed (for the Dryad essence) then Needle, 
Needle, Needle, Needle.  Armor values are 14/5/8/21.  Put in an Aroma 
Oil, and it's up to 15/8/13/21.  That's the highest I've been able to 
get the values on my DragonSkinMantle up to.  Bed of Thorns and Aroma 
Oil work off %'s...  Is there any way to permanently raise the 
defense values on armor (mantles more specifically) without the Bed 
of Thorns card and Aroma Oil?  Give the base defense a boost so that 
the Bed of Thorns and Aroma Oil give higher defense yields?

And here's a little 'sub' question.  I've thought about making the 
98/98/99/6 DragonScalesArmor suit, but then the pendant only gives 
0/0/0/34.  I'd be sitting at 98/98/99/40.  I suppose I could make a 
0/0/0/95 pendant, but I'd have no way to regenerate.  One conclusion 
was to make a mantle with the Nymph of the Sky card on it to override 
the no regen from the Bed of Thorns (how I got to being set on making 
a mantle in the first place), but then how could I possibly squeeze 
off 59+ magic defense in a mantle when the highest I could make was 
21?  Hehe.

So then in a way, the two questions correlate, and I'm sure I'm 
rambling like an idiot.  (It's been a very long day, and I'm quite 
tired at the moment).  If anyone can understand my tired-speak novel 
I just wrote, and may have some insight as to a fix on how to raise 
armor's base defense before the Bed of Thorns card and Aroma Oil, I'd 
appreciate any help I can get  ;)

> And here's a little 'sub' question.  I've thought about making the 
> 98/98/99/6 DragonScalesArmor suit, but then the pendant only gives 
> 0/0/0/34.  I'd be sitting at 98/98/99/40.  I suppose I could make

> 0/0/0/95 pendant, but I'd have no way to regenerate.

You already wouldn't.  Having 'No HP Regen' on ANY of your armors 
causes you to stop regenerating HP at all.

Yes, that means that 98/98/99/6 Armor will cause you to not 
regenerate any more, at all.

However, do note that you can always (a) use a Sword with the 
Vampsword Plunge Attack, (b) use Elysia the Succubus for her 
Synchro, (c) use a Lizardon for its Synchro, or (d) use a Candy 
Machine Golem.  That will allow you to heal even without automatic 
HP regeneration.

of Thorns and a Heaven's Scale.  Theory was that the Heaven's Scale 
card would overwrite the no regen effect regardless, but it wasn't 
working on a pendant.  So sad too, because 98/98/99/99 w/regenning 
would be pretty damn sweet.

Oh well, 65/65/68/99 is good enough I suppose.  Honestly can't 
remember the last time my hit points dropped below 90%, because with 
a maxxed HP stat, you regen like a mofo.

To: LoM_Kitchen@yahoogroups.com

User-Agent: eGroups-EW/0.82
MIME-Version: 1.0
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=ISO-8859-1
Content-Length: 1317
X-Mailer: Yahoo Groups Message Poster
X-eGroups-Remote-IP: 66.218.66.91
From: "Myst Erik Ery" <tagged_jc@yahoo.com>
X-Originating-IP: 24.67.253.204
Subject: Huh?  You didn't read.
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=116656188
X-Yahoo-Profile: tagged_jc

You say:

"But, however, it only appears to work for armor. I made the
98/98/99/6 DragonScaleArmor that had no regeneration flagged on it,
then made a 0/0/0/78 AdamantitePendant that was finished with 2 Bed
of Thorns and a Heaven's Scale. Theory was that the Heaven's Scale
card would overwrite the no regen effect regardless, but it wasn't
working on a pendant."

Heaven's Scale works for all armor.  It's simply an Effect that 
allows you to restore HP even while moving, but at the cost of 
losing the ability to Revive after you die.

However, if you still have the Bed of Thorn Effect ON ANY ARMOR, 
your HP Regeneration Rate is 0.  So, Heaven's Scale was working - it 
was letting you regenerate HP while moving.  However, you were 
regenerating 0 HP at those times, because of Bed of Thorn.

You must not have the Bed of Thorn effect on ANY of your armors if 
you want to regenerate ANY HP.

On Mantles, you can also use the Nymph of Sky, which is better than 
Heaven's Scale, because it allows HP regeneration without the No-
Revive Penalty.
On Rings and Pendants, you have a variety of different options.  So 
long as you don't end up with the No-HP Regen Effect, you'll be fine.

So you have to go Bed of Thorn / Bed of Thorn / Heaven's Scale on 
ALL of your armor, or you won't regenerate any HP at all...

regenerate.

defense values.  So made a mantle (3rd in base magic defense values 
of armor created, but it does give +strikes/slashes/thrusts too).  x4 
Needles and capped with a Creepy Eye, overall stats the mantle gives 
is 15/15/12/23.  The ForbiddenRing2.0 I'm wearing is 0/0/0/23, so 
definately happy to get some extra defense in melee situations 
without compromising magic defense from a new piece.

Man... I shoulda spent another day thinking on it.  Now I look like 
an idiot.  :P

Some people are still set to 'Moderate Me!' status, which would be 
from WAY WAY back before I realized that having everyone on Moderate 
status would force me to manually approve ever message.  For a 
while, the group was set to "Moderation: New Members"... I was under 
the assumption that after a few posts, it'd stop moderating 
everyone, but I guess not.

Hence, a great delay is sometimes found as to when you post 
something, and when it gets posted - if this is the case, it's my 
fault >_> I didn't see the little thing on the side that said '1 
Pending Messages' and so, it never got through.

I can set people back to being unmoderated, but I have to find you 
in the Members list >_> And if I can't find you in the Members list, 
I can't change your moderation status.  So, if you encounter this 
problem, please mail me directly and tell me the Yahoo ID or Email 
Address that you have in the Members list.  ^_^

Then I can fix the problem.  (There's just too many people still 
on 'moderate' to go through and change them all at once >_< ).

Sincerely,
JC Myst Erik Ery

Wooo

Answered my own question after a little playing around :) :) :)

NemesisRock 2hander Axe

Final Essence Values

15-15-15-15-13-13-15-14

Total Essence: 115!

Attack Power: 999

Bonus to stats: +9 to all

(Before Varnish essences were at 15-15-15-15-15-13-15-14)

I used a Varnish of 2x Volcano's, 1x Clown + Scissors

Recipe Consisted of about

33x Firestones *8250 Lucre
9x Earthstones *2250 Lucre
1x Windstone *250 Lucre
14x Spiny Carrots
1x Any Seed
1x Aura Silver
2x Shade Silvers
1x Wisp Silver
28x Sulphers *8400 Lucre
63x Meat (probably wasted a few)
6x Chaos Crystals *30000 Lucre
1x Bumpkin
2x Ash's
1x Scissor
7x Toadstoolsheds (just for the stat boosts)
3x Lucky Clovers *3000 Lucre (probably not neccessary, but used to
boost Gnome to 4 initially)

Total Lucre Cost: 52150 

No Glow Crystals were Harmed in the making of this weapon :D

The only thing I'm bummed out about was the fact I completely forgot
about the Treefeller Plunge. The easiest time to get the plunge
would be at the very beginning... get Gnome to 4 and add the
Leviathan card. Proceed to Focus on Sala from there. I might just
go and redo the whole thing just to get it, but oh well :) :)

The BiellaRock CrimsonGlare would only hit 907 attack power with
this recipe, much to my disappointment :/

From: "nano_biquts" <jonh@polter.net>
X-Originating-IP: 130.207.140.184
Subject: Re: RIDDLE: Best Varnish
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=22685443
X-Yahoo-Profile: nano_biquts

And if you want to check your answer or are wondering where how I 
made the tables, here is a sample program.

#include <stdio.h>

int a,b,c,d;

void a0(void){}
void a1(void){
        a=a*3/2;
        if(a>255)a=255;
        b=b/2;
}
void a2(void){
        b=b*3/2;
        if(b>255)b=255;
        a=a/2;
}
void a3(void){
        c=c*3/2;
        if(c>255)c=255;
        d=d/2;
}
void a4(void){
        d=d*3/2;
        if(d>255)d=255;
        c=c/2;
}
void a5(void){
        d=d*3/2;
        if(d>255)d=255;
        b=b/2;
}
void a6(void){
        c=c*5/4;
        if(c>255)c=255;
        d=d*5/4;
        if(d>255)d=255;
}
void a7(void){
        a=a*5/4;
        if(a>255)a=255;
}
void a8(void){
        b=b*5/4;
        if(b>255)b=255;
}

typedef void (*vvptr)(void);

vvptr act[9]={a0,a1,a2,a3,a4,a5,a6,a7,a8};

int mat[4]={48, 9,86,67};

int wep[4]={ 0,32,24,56};

int main(void){
        int c1,c2,c3,i,atk,max;

        for(c1=0;c1<4;c1++){
        for(c2=0;c2<4;c2++){
        for(c3=0;c3<4;c3++){
        for(i=0;i<9;i++){
          a=mat[0];
          b=mat[1];
          c=mat[2];
          d=mat[3];
          act[c1]();
          act[c2]();
          act[c3]();
          act[i]();
          atk=a*wep[0] + b*wep[1] + c*wep[2] + d*wep[3];
          if(atk>max){
            max=atk;
          }
        }}}}

        for(c1=0;c1<4;c1++){
        for(c2=0;c2<4;c2++){
        for(c3=0;c3<4;c3++){
        for(i=0;i<9;i++){
          a=mat[0];
          b=mat[1];
          c=mat[2];
          d=mat[3];
          act[c1]();
          act[c2]();
          act[c3]();
          act[i]();
          atk=a*wep[0] + b*wep[1] + c*wep[2] + d*wep[3];
          if(atk==max){
            printf("%d%d%d%d %d %d %d %d\n",c1,c2,c3,i,
              a*wep[0],b*wep[1],c*wep[2],d*wep[3]);
          }
        }}}}

        return 0;

}

Cleric + 1x Clear Feather.

three clerics, since the only other Card with a "beneficial" effect 
(ie not obviously detrimental) is Volcano, which, as was said, ends 
up worse, since Gloves' Tech is more than twice its Force.)

to 
> be a (members only person).  So if you would help me with that 
it'd 
> be great,otherwise please dont assume that im that dumb.  Thank 
you.

*points to Join This Group! link upper right corner*

Made a dummy account just for kicks, clicked the above link, got 
access in less than 15 secs.  No personal info was asked.  Simply 
whether or not I wanted Posts/Notifications E-Mailed to me (I chose 
no), or if I wanted posts viewed in HTML format.  (in other words, 
don't think this place is "select" members only)

Also, you can "leave" the group at any time by hitting the 
newly "Leave Group" link under membership

Seriously... Its in your best interest to join the group if only to 
have access to the Files Section.  Recipe's for all sorts of 
materials (Aerolites, Dragonscales, Diorwood (old and new)), Quick 
Recipes, Material stats + Growth Control.  And the ever Important 
Forge Code, which lays out the rules of tempering for all to see.

ANYWAY

Asiangrinch's Uber recipe for DragonScales and Diorwood uses Dryad, 
Aura, 1 Bottom Essence to drain off each other till they're all 15.  
Then proceed to raise the non-conflicting essences by passing the 15 
back and forth between Dryad/Aura while using the extra energy to 
raise something else.

Another "trick" is to Drain an Essence, lower the cost to raise 
the "Drained" essence, put the energy back into that essence, and 
use the rest of the energy to raise something else.  Aerolites are 
the greatest example of this since Sala is always draining, though 
the trick can still easily be pulled off with Wood materials.  Only 
works with Bottom essences.

Biquts already mentioned Cardless tempering (generally, good weapons 
that can be made in less than 30 minutes).

2 wizards and a tower(?) would lower resistance to 8, so NoD + a 
gold coin could get you to level 6. Replace a wizard with a chaos 
will get to 5.

there are probably quite a few reasons why that wouldn't work out.
So 98, but totally not worth it.

Cardless gets to 3/3/3/3/3/2/3/2=22

From: "Myst Erik Ery" <tagged_jc@yahoo.com>
X-Originating-IP: 24.67.253.204
Subject: Re: Seeds'n'Produce and the affects
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=116656188
X-Yahoo-Profile: tagged_jc

If I recall correctly, Squalphins also add Friendly and Lonely, and 
are easier to get than Boarmelons.

For produce/seed combinations, please see:
http://www.geocities.com/xo_pitseleh/lom.html
And choose the section on produce.

Save your game, and then add three Squalphins to your Polterbox's 
feed box, and immediately go out and pet your Polterbox.  If he's 
Lonely, yay.  If not, reload your save and try again.  Personalities 
are granted the instant you put the food in the feed box, rather 
than when they level up, and so you can just keep resetting until 
you actually get the personality (or not, if you want to feed them 
something that would ordinarily give a personality that you don't 
want).

> 15/15/14/14/15/5/15/5 would probably be the highest possible, but 
> there are probably quite a few reasons why that wouldn't work out.

That isn't possible, because Tower requires 0 Jinn and Wisp > 0.  You 
wouldn't be able to raise Shade much.

You can only get to 18 Resistance with two Wizard Cards (that is, 
when raising Shade at first or when raising Jinn at the end.

I believe you can get 4, tops, with 18 Resistance, and that's using 
Nymph of Dawn, too.

Hmm...  If you raise Shade and Wisp to 1, to start with, so you can 
raise Dryad and Aura and stuff...  Hmm... I dunno.
It might get to... uhh... 14/4/14/14/5/15/5/15 ?  I dunno... Kinda 
not worth it.  >_>  With 86 total essenses, that's still not even 3x 
attack power... >_<

Subject: Re: RIDDLE: Best Varnish
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=116656188
X-Yahoo-Profile: tagged_jc

The chart (varnish.txt) shows you the best varnish for every 
material and weapon.

Let's say you made a DiorWood Axe.  Now, how would you varnish it 
for best results?

Well, look at the chart. DiorWood Axe is listed as 3336.

Above the chart, it says that 3 = Volcano Card, and 6 = Dragon's 
Breath item.

So, you'd temper in three Ash (to make the Volcano Cards) and finish 
off with a Dragon's Breath item.

If you did this with 0 essenses (and somehow kept Dryad at 0, 
considering we're dealing with a Wood), you'd have 115 Attack 
Power.  If you raised your essenses up to 105 (the maximum for 
DiorWood), you'd end up with 1325 (or 999) attack power.  Woo!

The chart is just there to show you what varnish to use, to make 
your attack power the highest.

Its probably best to start small and on a Single Subjects.

Here's a small outline to help you choose a Subject.

Tempering:

I. Weapons
__1. Attack Formula
____A. Varnish's
____B. Total Essences & Growth Control
__2. Weapon Values
__3. Material Values
__4. Plunges

II. Armor
__1. Defense Formula
____A. Varnish's
__2. Armor Values
__3. Material Values
__4. Status Protection
__5. Special Effects

III. Essence Raising
__1. Material Resistance
____A. Wizard Cards
__2. Energy
____A. Items
____B. Nymph of Dawn Card
__3. TP's
____A. Elemental Cards
____B. Innate Item TP's
__4. Conflicts
____A. Wisp/Shade Conflicts
____B. Wisp/Shade Relations to Dryad/Aura
____C. Sala/Gnome/Jinn/Undine Conflicts
____D. Ancient Moon Card
____E. Mirrored World Card
__5. Draining
____A. Drained Energy Management
____B. Mirrored World Revisted


IV. Attribute Raising
__1. Attribute Ranges
____A. Mystic Cards
__2. Raising Attributes
____A. Mystic Cards
____B. Items

V. Appendix
__1. Benificial Weapon Effects
____A. Plunges
______a. Mystic Cards
____B. Manipulation of Material Values (aka Varnish)
______a. Mystic Cards
______b. Items (aka Cappers)
__2. Benificial Armor Effects
____A. Status Protection
______a. Mystic Cards
______b. Items
____B. Special Effects
______a. Mystic Cards
____C. Manipulation of Material Values
______a. Mystic Cards
______b. Items
__3. Benificial Attribute Raising
____1. Items with +All
____2. Mystic Cards with +All
____3. Evil God Mystic Card Uses
__4. Material "Rules"
____1. Woods
____2. Aerolites

... Well it seemed small when I first thought of typing it 8)

I like that Table of Contents.  Mind if I take it, and write a huge 
FAQ with it?

There's a couple things missing, though:

> IV. Attribute Raising
> __1. Attribute Ranges
> ____A. Mystic Cards

B. Items --- some items give temporary Limitations.  In addition, 
there are things called 'Bonus Limitations' or special Minimum 
Limitations that some Mystic Cards have.  An example of this is the 
+15 that an Evil God Card gives.  They really do give -1 All, it's 
just that there's a new minimum for one stat.


The other thing is a section just on Mystic Cards and how they 
work.  Dealing with Essense Requirements, and the Invisible Slot.

From: "Myst Erik Ery" <tagged_jc@yahoo.com>

Subject: Re: RIDDLE: Maia Lead
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=116656188
X-Yahoo-Profile: tagged_jc

The cards present on the item before adding 4 Lilipods were as 
follows:
(Nymph of Dawn)
Wisp
[doesn't really matter]
Mirrored World

The Mirrored World is there because at this moment, Wisp remains at 
0.  It is very difficult (ie. impossible unless Shade uses up ALL of 
the energy with a Shade Card, which is unlikely at this point) to get 
a Wisp Card without having enough energy for Wisp to raise to 1, so 
having the effects of Mirrored World prevents Wisp from raising, 
allowing the conditions presented at the time of adding the four 
Lilipods.

As the four Lilipods are added, this is what happens:
First: Mirrored World leaves.  Unfortunately, there's not enough 
energy in the Lilipods to raise Wisp to 1.
Second: Nymph of Dawn leaves prematurely due to Lilipods giving a low 
energy.  Wisp raises to 1.
Third: Nothing special.
Fourth: Nothing special.

After that, the following items are added:
1. Shade Silver = (Shade)EN/EN/EN
2. Mirror Piece = (MW)Shade/EN/EN (Note that Mirrored World still 
isn't in effect yet)
3. Rocket Papaya = (Tower)MW/Shade/EN (At this point, Wisp drains to 
zero, due to there being a Shade TP and Mirrored World present)
4. Mercury = (Witch)Tower/MW/Shade
5. Shade Silver = (Shade)Witch/Tower/MW
6. Earth Stone = (Gnome)Shade/Witch/Tower

Upon adding the Earth Stone, which has a Gnome taint, Sala drains, 
due to Mirrored World still being in effect, from 14 to 13, releasing 
262144 energy (32 * 2^13).  Meanwhile, Shade resistance has dropped 
to 16 (32/2, due to the Tower+Witch combination).  Shade requires 
262144 energy (16 * 2^14) to raise to 15.  Well, what do you know?  
That's exactly how much energy you got from Salamander!  Shade raises 
to 15.  Earth Stone doesn't add enough energy to raise Gnome to 1, so 
it remains at 0, which is fine.

Ending Essenses: 0/15/14/15/14/0/0/0

My only question is how he got to 0/14/14/15/14/0/0/0 in the first 
place.  ^___^

Sincerely,
JC

Anyway, I'll think about it some more.  :P  If none of the cards 
before matter, that helps a little.  Only have to figure out three 
items, basically.
Of the six, one is a Mirror Piece, one is definitely a Mercury, and 
one is definitely a Shade Silver/Gold.
Since I'm fairly certain you'll want to have 18 resistance instead 
of 24, that implies another Mercury.

That's two items, other than those, to help get something drained 
properly.  Mind you, that means something must go from 15 to 14, and 
that'd be Aura.  However, Aura would be the one to drain Dryad.

Thus, I think we're going to drain Aura to Dryad under Mirrored 
World, and then drain Dryad to Shade.

It could go nicer, if I had one more item I could use (preserving 
Aura would be nice), but...

Items to add:

1 Mirror Piece = (MW)EN/EN/EN
1 Non-Spiny Seed (Dryad=15, Aura=14) = (Dr)MW/EN/EN
1 Mercury (Aura=13) = (W)Dr/MW/EN
1 Mercury (Aura=12) = (W)W/Dr/MW
1 Shade Silver = (S)W/W/Dr
1 Aura Silver (Shade=15, Dryad=14, Aura=13?) = (Au)S/W/W

Actually, now that I think of it, the Mercury isn't entirely 
necessary, is it?  Since you're draining from something that's at 
15, to something that's at 14 and wanting to go to 15, which has the 
same resistance.  I suppose it's okay.  :)

I'm pretty sure this will work.

I'll name that riddle answer in *5* items.

Um... yeah.

Anyways.

Firestone
Waterstone
Mercury
Shade Silver
Waterstone

'course, you can do it in 3 without the 'don't drain Aura/Dryad' 
restriction that got added late :P  (Mirror Piece, Shade Silver, Non-
Spiny Seed)  Name the restrictions in the riddle next time, huh?

 ---

Quick explanation on how the above works:

Firestone: Adds Sala card and TP: (Sala)/EntN/EntN/EntN
TP doesn't do anything, of course.

Waterstone: Adds Undine card and TP: (Undine)/Sala/EntN/EntN
Undine TP drains Sala, but the Sala TP takes it all back.

Mercury: Adds Witch card: (Witch)/Undine/Sala/EntN
Undine drain and Sala reraise occurs again.  Nothing special.  Undine 
doesn't get to raise at all yet because of the lack of energy.

Shade Silver: Adds Shade card and TP: (Shade)/Witch/Undine/Sala
Undine drain and Sala reraise occurs YET again.  However this time, 
the Shade Silver allows Undine to raise a level after Sala returns to 
L14.

Waterstone: Adds Undine card and TP: (Undine)/Shade/Witch/Undine
Sala TP vanishes, but we don't care.  Didn't matter either ways.  
*Two* Undine TPs drop Sala by two levels, releasing 393216 energy, 
and the Witch card before the Shade drops Shade Resistance to 24.  
393216 is thus *exactly* what's needed to get Shade to 15, so... up 
it goes.  Undine also has enough energy to raise to L2 afterwards.

Final essense totals: 0/15/14/15/12/0/0/2

Guess you could play with it to get the 6 items the riddle asked for 
and utilise the hint to its intended effect... but eh.  Too 
bothersome.

  by mta5.grp.scd.yahoo.com with SMTP; 4 Feb 2004 02:14:37 -0000

From: tf_faq <no_reply@yahoogroups.com>
Reply-To: no_reply@yahoogroups.com
Subject: Re: RIDDLE: Maia Lead
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=174770107; email=no
X-Yahoo-Profile: tf_faq

--- In LoM_Kitchen@yahoogroups.com, "Myst Erik Ery" <tagged_jc@y...> 
wrote:
> > Shade Silver: Adds Shade card and TP: (Shade)/Witch/Undine/Sala
> > Undine drain and Sala reraise occurs YET again. However this time,
> > the Shade Silver allows Undine to raise a level after Sala returns
> > to L14.
> 
> Shade TPs are dealt with before Sala TPs...
> 
> Thus, Sala drains one level, from 15 to 14, and has energy released 
> directly to Shade, who goes from 14 to 15.  At this point Undine 
> raises to 1, due to the Shade Silver's energy.
> 
> At least, that's as far as I know...  Item Wisp/Shade TPs are dealt 
> with after draining, right?  I hate Wisp and Shade.  So evil.

Only Aerolite draining can possibly occur before the Tempered Item's 
properties are done.  And the Tempered Item's special properties are 
done before *any* Card on the item.  Draining occurs immediately when 
called by *any* special effect, while raising only happens 
immediately for Wisp and Shade (which is why they're "evil").

And Sala's still at L14 at that time.  So, what happens is (skipping 
a few non-relevant parts):

1. 48 energy in the bank, Shade Silver is looked at, Shade card put 
into PreHidden slot, not enough energy to raise a level so nothing 
happens.

2. Push in the cards: (Shade)/Witch/Undine/Sala

3. Go through the cards from top to bottom, so Enticed Nymph first, 
which has no effects when in the Pushed Off slot, so we dump it.

4. We still have 48 energy and Sala isn't in conflict (Undine's at 
0), so we flag Sala to *attempt* to raise.  Not enough energy yet to 
actually do a raise, but that's where the deferral comes in.

5. Undine TP triggers a Sala drain, releasing 262144 energy.  We've 
got more than enough energy to flag Undine to attempt to raise, defer 
to end as usual.

6. Witch drops Undine and Shade resistances to 24 (among other 
elements).

7. Elemental raising!  Out of the two we've flagged, Sala takes 
priority.  262192 energy in the bank, more than enough to push Sala 
back up to 14.  We have 48 energy left.

8. Undine.  It was at 0 until now, but 48 (plus an unneeded reduction 
to 24 Resistance) is all it takes to bring it up to 1.  NEXT TURN, 
SALA WILL BE IN CONFLICT... but it's alright, because we got Sala to 
survive long enough anyways.  (And we need the second Undine TP on 
the card list *BEFORE* the Shade, because of deferral stuff... gotta 
love it)

That explain it satisfactorily?

*doesn't even read the lower portion* >_> I already get it :P

I just needed to refresh my memory, and wake up.  Being up all night 
drains you.  Lots.

>_> >_> >_>

Anyway, yeah.  Draining happens the moment a TP is found which 
allows a drain, so you *can* drain before raising the tempered item, 
obviously (as when you add an Undine Silver to something with 
Salamander).  Of course, normally the energy just builds up waiting, 
but if it's Shade or Wisp, the Raising is used right away, if able, 
and doesn't wait for more draining.

Isn't it a little sad how draining Shade from 14 to 0 doesn't give 
enough energy to raise Wisp from 14 to 15? :P

Anyway, yeah.  I understand, I'm just sleepy and brain-fried.  
Gooooooo ANTH!!!!  >_<

*sobs*

Anyway, do we really have an uberrecipe for MaiaLead now?  Is that 
actually the maximum possible, do you think?

How much suckage would your equipment suck if your equipment sucked 
of MaiaLead? ^_^

Gee you tossed out that idea fast :P

Minor Mistake, but the idea remains the same.

We have

14-14-15-15-15-0-0-0

<Earth Stone>
Sulpher
Sala
Shade
Mirror World --> Leaving

Earth Stone Drains Sala from 15 -> 14

10*2^14 = 163840

Gets directed into Shade

163840 - 8*2^14 = 32768 Energy Left

Shade goes to 15, Wisp to 0

Here comes the part I'm unsure about, so I refer to the forge code.

5E8E - Wisp/Shade Consumption
If Active World Card != Ancient Moon Then:
If Active World Card != Mirrored World Then:
If Wisp EssLv > Shade EssLv Then:
While Shade EssLv > 0:
Call Reduce Shade
WEnd
End If
Else If Shade EssLv > Wisp EssLv Then:
While Wisp EssLv > 0:
Call Reduce Wisp
WEnd
End If
End If
End Sub

5DAE - Reduce Wisp
Decrease Wisp EssLv by 1 --> Energy
End Sub
5DBE - Reduce Shade
Decrease Shade EssLv by 1 --> Energy

If I read that correctly, there should be an ADDITIONAL 114681
Energy on top of 32768. Would that Energy direct itself back into
Salamander to raise it to 15. Salamander certainly isn't consider
in Conflict yet till the next temper turn anyway so it CAN raise of
the energy is there.

Which should at the time only require 6*2^14 = 98304 energy to get
back to 15.

After all that

0-15-15-15-15-0-0-0 would be the supposed essence if the above
worked.

Which point you'd Raise Wisp to 9, Jinn to 12, Undine enough to
Drain it into Wisp making Wisp 12, Drain Dryad ONCE to make Wisp 14.

Which point results would end up

14-15-14-15-15-0-12-0

I know I celebrate early at times, but I believe that this will 
work.  Did a Test run.

Essences

4-4-9-0-5-0-0-0 (raised Dryad high enough so it wouldn't interfere 
with the test)

Goal is to raise shade to 5 using Draining but Sala must remain 5

added in

Mirror Piece
Shade Silver
Fire Stone
Sulpher
Earth Stone

Cards

<Earth Stone>
Sulpher
Sala
Shade
--> Mirror World Leaves

Earth Stone Drains Sala

10*2^4 = 160 Energy

Shade Raises to 5 using 128 energy

32 Energy Left, Wisp Drains to 0 (7*2^4) - 7 Energy is added making 
our total now 137

Gnome raises to 1 using up 3 energy (134)

Sala required 6*2^4 = 96 Energy to raise Leaving 38 Energy, (plus 
the original 32 from the Earth Stone, but didn't want to use that in 
the calculations, wanted to make sure that everything could rise 
with just draining energy alone)

Final results

0-5-9-0-5-1-0-0

Does ANYONE seen any possiblity that I may of MIS-CALCULATED and 
would not work in the 14's and 15's.

However those WERE the final essences after my test and thus gives 
me hope that the Diorwood formula has been improved yet again :)

14-14-15-15-15-0-0-0

> 
> added in
> 
> Mirror Piece
> Shade Silver
> Fire Stone
> Sulpher
> Earth Stone
> 
> Cards
> 
> <Earth Stone>
> Sulpher
> Sala
> Shade
> --> Mirror World Leaves
> 
> Earth Stone Drains Sala
> 
> 10*2^4 = 160 Energy
> 
> Shade Raises to 5 using 128 energy
> 
> 32 Energy Left, Wisp Drains to 0 (7*2^4) - 7 Energy is added making 
> our total now 137
> 
> Gnome raises to 1 using up 3 energy (134)
> 
> Sala required 6*2^4 = 96 Energy to raise Leaving 38 Energy, (plus 
> the original 32 from the Earth Stone, but didn't want to use that 
in 
> the calculations, wanted to make sure that everything could rise 
> with just draining energy alone)
> 
> Final results
> 
> 0-5-9-0-5-1-0-0
> 
> Does ANYONE seen any possiblity that I may of MIS-CALCULATED and 
> would not work in the 14's and 15's.
> 
> However those WERE the final essences after my test and thus gives 
> me hope that the Diorwood formula has been improved yet again :)
> 
> Biquts, you're a genious ;)
> 
> Apply the same thing to
> 
> 14-14-15-15-15-0-0-0

Subject: Re: diorwood 106? Possible BOOYA
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=116656188
X-Yahoo-Profile: tagged_jc

Well, of course it goes into Salamander.

You can drain **Salamander** to raise Salamander, even.

Energy is generally released long before it gets to a Taining Point, 
excepting Wisp and Shade as they're dealt with as they come.

The only reason I said it was pointless was because it's a bit of a 
waste to drain something from 14 to 0.  It's especially sad how 
draining it from 14 to 0 STILL doesn't give enough energy to raise 
something to 15, without a Wizard Card, at equal essenses, without a 
bit of help from the item's energy.

This is because the sum of energy from 1 to 13 is just a little short 
of the energy from 13 to 14.  And you need twice the energy it took 
from 13 to 14 to get from 14 to 15.  So it's just really sad, how 13 
consecutive drained levels gives just about as much energy as one 
drained level, but not even that much.

^_^ Now, if 106 is possible on DiorWood, then is it possible on all 
Woods?  In any case, 106 would grant 999 Attack Power 1HSwords, too, 
wouldn't it.

That just makes Staffs, Gloves, and Knucks unable to reach the 
maximum, and the latter two have 0's in their multipliers so it's not 
a huge surprise, whereas Staffs... well... have really terrible 
weapon attributes >_<

:D

Subject: Re: A few questions...
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=22685443
X-Yahoo-Profile: nano_biquts

> 1-What is Mercury and Sulpher for?

They create wizard cards which lower resistances, which then allows 
you to get to higher essence levels with the same energy.


> 2-Where can I find Spiny Seeds?

Lullabuds, malboros and shrieknips will drop them. Treant gives them 
out randomly, and since I usually don't need more than two thats fast 
enough. 

> 3-I put in 3 coins (like Sala Silver), one Glow Crystal, another
> coin (or any other thing. What I want is to push the Nymph of Dawn
> card out) and the corresponding mana stone after that (in the case,
> a Fire Stone). This way I get 5 essences. Isn't there any faster way
> to do that?

Most likely. It depends on the material which way is best. Cardless 
tempering will get to 5s even with high resists and only uses one of 
each coin.


> 4-Let's suppose I have 5 Undine and want to raise Salamander and
> drain Undine completely. What I did was use 3 Wind Stones, 3 Earth
> Stones and 2 or 3 Fire Stones (can't remember the exact number here,
> and can't rememebr if I used something BETWEEN the different stone
> types, but I think not.). Good, I got Undine to 0, as I intended,
> but I could only raise Salamander to 3 (I think that I lost some
> energy, using your terms ^_^). Isn't there any more efficient way
> to do that(), or at least a faster way?

Using a mirror piece would be faster, because salamander drains 
undine under mirrored world, but don't waste your mirror pieces on 
that. Once you understand how to use wizard cards getting a 5 is very 
easy, so don't worry about the efficiency.


> 5-I added the Flame Tongue plunge to my sword, great, but when I
> went and tried it on, it looked like a regular uppercut attack to
> me. Is that right?

Yes


> 6-Some cards, like the Wolf, doesn't show any picture in my game. Is
> that right?

Yes and no. Its like that in everyones game, but I wish they made art 
for it.

From: "Myst Erik Ery" <tagged_jc@yahoo.com>

Subject: Re: New question...
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=116656188
X-Yahoo-Profile: tagged_jc

I'm not sure what you mean by 'Plunge Table'.

You could go to http://www.geocities.com/xo_pitseleh/lom.html and 
choose 'Tempering for Bonus Effects and Plunges', though.

Raising Essenses above 9 requires consumptions.  You can only get to 
11 on High-Resistance ordinarily, since you have to drain another 
essense which must raise in conflict.
So, here's an example.  Raise Salamander to 9.  Now, under Ancient 
Moon, raise Gnome to 7.  Now, with three Wizard Cards present, drain 
Gnome with Salamander.  Salamander 10!  Now, raise Gnome up to 7 
again.  Drain Gnome with Salamander again.  Salamander 11!  
Unfortunately, I think this is the limit, if you're doing it this 
way...

With Wisp and Shade, the main thing to remember is that ordinarily, 
if Wisp > 0, then Shade can't rise.  If Wisp > Shade, then adding 
either Wisp OR Shade will cause Shade to drain away to 0.

Really, a 7/7/9/9/9/7/9/7 Heishishorin would probably be quite 
powerful anyway, although metal swords SUCK TERRIBLY >_>;;;

Subject: Re: Increasing Luck in the Polter Box Pet...
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=116656188
X-Yahoo-Profile: tagged_jc

Mush-in-a-Boxes do nothing for pets.  Gold Clovers, however, WILL 
raise Luck.

However, Luck is completely useless on a Polterbox.  Luck is only 
useful when that character kills something, and you don't want your 
Polterbox killing things.  It's you who wants to be killing things, 
while in Synchro with the Polterbox

Received: from [66.218.67.178] by n11.grp.scd.yahoo.com with NNFMP; 11 Feb 2004 21:25:42 -0000
Date: Wed, 11 Feb 2004 21:25:40 -0000
To: LoM_Kitchen@yahoogroups.com
Message-ID: <c0e6kk+uqk0@eGroups.com>
In-Reply-To: <c0e5ii+vjub@eGroups.com>
User-Agent: eGroups-EW/0.82
MIME-Version: 1.0
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=ISO-8859-1
Content-Length: 1496
X-Mailer: Yahoo Groups Message Poster
X-eGroups-Remote-IP: 66.218.66.66
From: "Myst Erik Ery" <tagged_jc@yahoo.com>
X-Originating-IP: 24.67.253.204
Subject: Re: Hmmmm... I wonder...
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=116656188
X-Yahoo-Profile: tagged_jc

You can drain Shade from 14 to 0, and just BARELY not have enough 
for Wisp to 15.  However, if there's a single Wizard Card present, 
or you're adding an item with 8 or more energy (that is, any time), 
then you'll be able to raise Wisp.

You can redirect Sala's draining into the upper-row essenses by 
adding a Spiny Carrot (cardless, Undine essenses) while there's two 
Wizard Cards and an upper row essense card present.

Getting Sala higher than 11 or so requires you drain upper-row 
essenses to it, after you raise them up.  That's complicated, too 
complicated even for me, right now >_< , and probably uses some 
Mirror Pieces.

Your best bet is to drain Sala from 11 to 10, until you get all 
upper-row essenses to 13 (which I believe is what they can get to, 
if Sala is 11), then raise Sala and Jinn to 11, if you can, and the 
remaining two to 7...

From: "nano_biquts" <jonh@polter.net>
X-Originating-IP: 199.77.207.14
Subject: Re: Hmmmm... I wonder...
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=22685443
X-Yahoo-Profile: nano_biquts

> I think I can get Sala up to 11 this way, right?

gnome 7->6 = 10*2^6
sala 10->11 = 1*2^10 (with three wizards)
You are short by 384 which is more than NoD + gold coin can give you.

If sala was a low resist this would work because you'd only need two 
wizards and so could double drain gnome.


> But how the hell do I max it out? (15)???

Hehe, try doing it on maia lead. =_=
But seriously try looking at the uber recipes. Getting a 15 by 
multistep draining is a real pain.


> Other question: can I drain, like, Sala into Shade or Wisp?

Yes. On dragonscale, 9 in undine will give you 12s in jinn, which 
can give you a 14 in dryad, which can give you a 15 in shade...


> I'm asking this because of something I read earlier:
> you can drain 14 Shade directly to 0 and you still won't be able
> to raise Wisp by one point... Is that right?

Yes and no.
If shade and wisp have the same resistance and you don't use any 
wizard cards then draining shade from 7->0 wouldn't have enough 
energy to get wisp to 8. (but you only need an item with an energy 
equal to the resistance to make up the difference)

Shade would only drain if wisp was already higher than shade. But 
with favorable resistances and proper use of wizard cards you could 
have shade 7->0 raise wisp 8->9.

From: "nano_biquts" <jonh@polter.net>

Subject: Re: Improving Attack power on a weapon
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=22685443
X-Yahoo-Profile: nano_biquts

> I currently have a DragonScale Sword, with an attack power of 100.
> Is it possible to increase the attack power?

Yes, increase essences then varnish.


> If so, what do temper it with to increase it?

Thats a very complicated question. There are many recipes on this 
site if you want a specific answer. Otherwise read the FAQ (MMajarra 
on GameFaqs is the best one so far...) and then ask more questions.


> Will this work for my IshePlatinum Spear (currently with an attack 
> power of 70)?

The best method of raising essences changes from one material to the 
next, but cardless tempering is generally good (QuickTemper, 
Tempering_1.0, weapon_first_walkthrough). The best varnish depends 
on material and weapon (varnish.txt).

From: "Myst Erik Ery" <tagged_jc@yahoo.com>
X-Originating-IP: 24.67.253.204
Subject: Re: Luck Question
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=116656188
X-Yahoo-Profile: tagged_jc

> Are there any formulas that will boost luck extremely(!) high.

The highest Bonus of any single piece of equipment is +20, and it's 
actually easier to obtain +20 All than it is to just get +20 Luck 
(in fact, it's impossible to have just +0/+0/+0/+0/+0/+0/+0/+20).  
So yes, there are formulas that allow a piece of equipment to raise 
your Lucky by 20...

Subject: Re: Varnish question
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=167319030

If I get it right, varnishing is like a finishing touch to the 
weapon/armor. You make all the essence raising, plunges, etc, and 
then varnish the weapon/armor. Varnish greatly increases the 
efficiency and stats of a piece, like augumenting Slash Attacks (in 
wpns) or Defense agains them (in armr).

Subject: Re: ash question
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=116656188
X-Yahoo-Profile: tagged_jc

There are three Ash in the game.

One is in the White Forest, one is in the Bone Fortress, and one is 
at Madora Beach.

You only get three per game, so use them well!

(Note that AshWood is a completely different item, and is dropped by 
Woodings - it's a Primary, and not a Secondary.)

Date: Thu, 19 Feb 2004 20:11:27 -0000
To: LoM_Kitchen@yahoogroups.com
Message-ID: <c1359f+jfkt@eGroups.com>
In-Reply-To: <c12p5b+4dm5@eGroups.com>
User-Agent: eGroups-EW/0.82
MIME-Version: 1.0
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=ISO-8859-1
Content-Length: 598
X-Mailer: Yahoo Groups Message Poster
X-eGroups-Remote-IP: 66.218.66.65
From: "nano_biquts" <jonh@polter.net>
X-Originating-IP: 130.207.140.184
Subject: Re: Hey nano
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=22685443
X-Yahoo-Profile: nano_biquts

> I have a question on your weapon formula text. I dont completly 
> understand what capping means, and i somewhat dont know about
> growth control.

The varnish (capping) is the three visible cards and the last item 
tempered. Each of these can change the material values. Different 
material values lead to a different (hopefully better) attack value.

Raising essences multiplies the attack value by an additional factor. 
Growth control determines how effective the essence total is. An 
essence total of 12 may double the attack power of one item, but only 
be a 25% increase on another item.

Basically its possible to max out a material stat. After its maxed 
then trying to increase it anymore won't be helpful. That is the 
usual reason when things aren't four of a kind in varnish.txt.

--- In LoM_Kitchen@yahoogroups.com, "nano_biquts" <jonh@p...> wrote:
> I'm working on a tempering program. What I have so far is gold 
coins 
> on obsidian. (try it out and see if you can find any bugs)
> 
> Challenge: Try to get dryad to 5. =_=

Well, I haven't checked to see if resistances are correctly working, 
or energy levels, but here's how I got Dryad to 5:

Dryad Gold (Dr 1)
Dryad Gold (Dr 3)
Aura Gold (Au 1)
Aura Gold (Au 3)
Wisp Gold (Wi 1, Dr 4, Au 2)
Undine Gold (Wi 2, Dr 4, Au 2, Un 1)
Undine Gold (Wi 3, Dr 4, Au 2, Un 2)
Undine Gold (Wi 4, Dr 4, Au 2, Un 2)
Undine Gold (Wi 4, Dr 4, Au 2, Un 3)
Undine Gold (Wi 4, Dr 4, Au 2, Un 4)
Dryad Gold (Wi 4, Dr 4, Au 1, Un 4)
Jinn Gold (Wi 4, Dr 4, Ji 1, Un 4)
Jinn Gold (Wi 4, Dr 5, Ji 2, Un 2)

13 Gold Coins.

Question: What will you do when three cards leave at once?  ^_^
That is, are you going to simulate the game?  Because the game makes 
the 'leaving' animation for Sacrificed Nymphs and Pixies.

For example (Ragnarok)Pixie/Pixie/Pixie, upon adding an Odd Meat, 
becomes (---)Wings of Darkness/Beast-Headed God/Fallen Angel.
However, each Pixie leaves, too, and then the three Evil Gods 
enter.  That's a total of six card movements.  Quite a long step! ^_^

Energy of item:
Energy from draining (XXX) with (XXX):
...
Energy used by (XXX):

don't really care.

would be very interesting.

World Card: Bed of Thorn, Mirrored World
or
World Card: Heaven's Scale
and so on, so you can (a) see whether Mirrored World or Ancient Moon was in 
effect that step, and whether you have a World Card problem or not.

invisible slot.  ^_^

--- In LoM_Kitchen@yahoogroups.com, "nano_biquts" <jonh@p...> wrote:
> Oh and I found a couple errors in the forge code.
> 1. Jinn Taint shouldn't call test dryad dominance, and as far as I 
> can tell it doesnt.

Got fixed ages ago after a report on GameFAQs.  I guess Myst put up 
the old version I originally sent out.

> 2. When a NoD leaves because of lack of energy it gets rid of the 
> current, not the topmost NoD.

Not an error.  It is most certainly the "topmost" NoD; it uses the 
*same* code that the Evil Gods call when they leave and replace 
Sacrificed Nymphs.

Perhaps the definition of 'topmost' I've used in the code is slightly 
confusing... of course, considering it was mostly made for my own use 
and wasn't really tidied up, that's understandable.  For some reason, 
I like to think that you're adding the hidden card to the 'bottom' of 
the card heap, and they get pushed up, and when they reach the very 
top, they're taken off.  Kind of the reverse of stack theory... 
perhaps it should be changed to 'bottommost' to reflect LoM's 
graphical implementation and stack theory.  Eh.

I really should just release the spreadsheet program I made to 
simulate tempering in the first place sometime.

I use topmost and bottommost to refer to the in-game representation 
of the Mystic Card list, which lists them from top to bottom.  Thus, 
I assume the Invisible Slot is above this list.  ^_^

--- In LoM_Kitchen@yahoogroups.com, "nano_biquts" <jonh@p...> wrote:
> Is it possible for "topmost" to refer to anything other than the 
> current pixie/NoD?
> 
> Hum maybe
> 
> (Wisp) arranged to give 0 energy
> pixie
> NoD
> pixie
> >ragnarok>
> >>ancient moon>>
> 
> That might make only one EGC. I'll have to try that.

Won't work.  Leaving card is cleared (and reset to Empty Slot) 
immediately after its effects are looked at and calculated.  By the 
time it looks at the second Pixie, that Pixie will be the 'topmost' 
(or 'bottommost', if you prefer) Pixie on the item.

NoDs are a lost cause for the same reason, since they only do their 
check when they're in Slots 2 and 3, and there's no way to lose 
energy between those.  (And by the time you *get* to Slot 3, 
whatever's in the Leaving slot has vanished)

Sacrificed Nymphs are the only ones you can actually test in the game 
without hacking the cards to work differently (which is fun, but 
kinda beyond most people's capability)

X-Mailer: Yahoo Groups Message Poster
X-eGroups-Remote-IP: 66.218.66.67
From: "Myst Erik Ery" <tagged_jc@yahoo.com>
X-Originating-IP: 24.67.253.204
Subject: Re: "topmost"
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=116656188
X-Yahoo-Profile: tagged_jc

In-Game, I'm left with:
(---)
Pixie
---
Witch of Moon

Adding two Lilipods gives me:
(Enticed Nymph)
Enticed Nymph
Pixie
Witch of Moon

(Which answers a question I was wondering about some time ago - 
empty cards don't push! ^_^ Although, I guess that's a little 
obvious with how the Invisible Slot doesn't push when you happen to 
put World Cards in there and then destroy them...)

A little strange.  It must go from bottom to top, of course, since 
all card-things work backwards.  The first Pixie sees that there 
isn't enough energy to transform; however, it still calls the Witch 
of Moon Code (Ragnarok is the current World Card).  Then, the Nymph 
of Dawn leaves and there's plenty of energy.  The topmost Pixie then 
realizes that transformation can occur, so it replaces the 
bottommost Pixie with Witch of Moon and runs the Witch of Moon code 
herself.

Mind you, this little 'irregularity' normally wouldn't happen except 
under these very specific conditions - normally, all of them are 
able to transform, so they all just happen to transform themselves.  
And even if they don't transform, USUALLY Ragnarok is around next 
step, and since they already are acting like Witch of Moon, there's 
no difference.  Except they remain sticky for one step.  ^_^

By the way, from now on, 'topmost' shall refer to the newest Mystic 
Card present, and 'bottommost' shall refer to the oldest Mystic Card 
present.  Since that is, after all, how the game represents it.

I think I'll edit ForgeCode.txt to reflect this, if it needs it, and 
fix those other mistakes while I'm at it (and I'll change the names 
of the Pixies to their more-fitting names!).

And bug fixes, yes? ^_^; I think you've got a few problems in your
attack/defense calculation, for starters. And it crashes when I try
hitting '/' before any item is tempered in.

Not that I can talk... I've just found another bug in my own
implementation (had Peach Puppy increasing Heavy and decreasing Sharp
when it's obviously the other way around).

Would there be any complaints to me putting my own Excel spreadsheet-
based tempering program up into the Files section? It's more
restrictive on what machines it'll run on, obviously, but I'd like to
think it's slightly easier to get to grips with.

Problems with it is that, like all things, it could have the odd bug
still lurking in it (though I think I got most of them), and you
obviously need Excel to run it, and on top of that, it uses macros.
And it's like four times bigger than Calc.exe to boot. On the other
hand, it does allow a possibly quick and easy way (though confusing)
of transferring item stats and recipe lists, since it's possible to
save both into a 'code' that can be pasted in and loaded up.

Anyways, so long as it's okay (and I'm not stepping on anyone's
toes), I can put up the zip file with the two spreadsheets and the
accompanying readme file, and we can see how it goes.

> > attack/defense calculation, for starters.
>

Try looking at a Wisp Silver + Peach Puppy added to an AlteGlove, as 
a simple example.

> > And it crashes when I try
> > hitting '/' before any item is tempered in.
> 
> Then don't do that. =_=
> Its trying to pretty print uninitialized values. Doh.

Indeed.  But it's nice to be able to see what the starting stats of 
an item is.

> > Would there be any complaints to me putting my own Excel
> > spreadsheet-based tempering program up into the Files section?
> 
> None from me.

Fair 'nough.  I'll try and get it up tonight.

> > On the other
> > hand, it does allow a possibly quick and easy way (though 
confusing)
> > of transferring item stats and recipe lists, since it's possible 
to
> > save both into a 'code' that can be pasted in and loaded up.
> 
> You can cut and paste into calc.exe too. Is that what you meant?

Not entirely, though the fact that calc.exe can parse multiple 
additions in a single line *is* good.  The code I developed for it 
was more meant to help compress a recipe, so that a single step would 
be no more than 3 characters (first a two letter code for the item, 
and then a single letter code for the number of times it was added).  
On the other hand though, it's kinda confusing to debug if something 
goes wrong with it... thankfully, the proggie does decompress it to 
readable form when you enter it in and load it into the recipe area.

Eh, you'll prolly be able to see and comment on it tomorrow, anyhow.

Subject: Don't worry about high mirror piece recipes
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: public

I know mosr of you probably know this but, you can temper your 
weapons and not lose the stuff you tempered in to it by creating two 
save files with the mirror pieces and use up the pieces in one file 
than trade the weapon your tempering to the next file add the mirror 
pieces from that file and so on, you can keep copying your game in 
chains giving you unlimited of any item that you have at least one 
of.  So don't fret when you see an 18 mirror piece recipe, don't 
waste countless hours going through the game getting mirror pieces.

five each.

To get the Revive Effect, you need to have a Phoenix AND a Volcano 
Card on your Ring or Pendant, without having a Phoenix Card in the 
Invisible Slot.

Well, that's easy enough.  Now, how does it work?

Okay, equip your ring.  Now, die.

If you're the last character on your side to die, your ring will 
revive you.  However, it can only do this once.  Once you've died, 
the Phoenix Card present will be removed and you'll lose the Revive 
effect forever.  If there's multiple Phoenix Cards present (that is, 
two), then one will be removed.  However, you'll still not have the 
Revive effect until you temper your item with at least one more item.

This can be a costly thing to do, since there's limited Ash each 
runthrough.

You're best to set up something where you end with:

Spiny Seed
Ash
Flaming Quill*
Grave Dirt*
Any Meat (or Grave Dirt on Woods)*

And then, once you revive, go back in and add the three items marked 
with an asterisk (*) again.

> volcano card.  Its suppose to to auto ressurect you sometimes?

--- In LoM_Kitchen@yahoogroups.com, "underworldlegion" 
<underworldlegion@y...> wrote:
> I have a dragon scale 2H Sword that has essence levels of
> 
> 14/15//14/15/8/14/7/15
> 
> what formula do i need to increase these levels further.  I got 
the 
> sword from my older brother who hasn't played it in a long time 
and 
> forgets how to increase its essence levels.
> 
> Im guessing i'll need mirror pieces, chaos crystals, glow 
crystals, 
> gold coins, sulpher and mercury.

You can squeeze 4 more essence points outta it to make

15/15/14/15/9/14/9/15.

You won't be able to get Gnome to 15 because it needs an Ancient 
Moon card to not be in conflict, in order to actually get the energy 
to raise Gnome to 15, you'd have to drain the 15 from Dryad/Aura.  
But since you need the Ancient Moon, you can't drain at all :)

So...

Mirror World the 15 from Aura to Dryad.

Have Wisp, Sorc, Witch cards on the weapon (at the time of the 
drain) and drain Dryad with a Garlic Crown.  Which'll make Wisp/Aura 
15

Then just do normal Ancient Moon raising of Sala/Jinn to get them to 
9.

Varnish with Ash's and Scissors and done.

So you'll need

1 Mirror Piece
3 Chaos Crystals
1 Sala Gold
1 Jinn Gold

And however many other Glow Crystals, Sulphers and Mercury's you'd 
need.

--- In LoM_Kitchen@yahoogroups.com, "underworldlegion" 
<underworldlegion@y...> wrote:
> In order for me to get my gnome on my dragon scale weapon to 15 
sala 
> or jinn has to be at essence level zero depending on if mirror 
world 
> is gonna be used, which it will.  Is there a way to to just

> drain an essence, besides using garlic crown for dryad draining?

Once Sala, Gnome, Jinn, Undine > 0 then you can no longer drain any 
of em.

Other than draining  Dryad/Aura, the only other possible essense you 
could drain is Wisp, and I wouldn't suggest that...

You won't be able to drain Shade
You won't be able to drain Sala
You won't be able to drain Gnome
You won't be able to drain Jinn
You won't be able to drain Undine

... with that current essense setup.

When you're finished with the recipe, Salamander would be 13 if you 
did it right.  

You can probably keep Salamander at 12, but you won't be able to 
salvage it any higher than that.

Fire Stone
Fire Stone (Ancient Moon card Leaves)
Chaos Crystal (Sala Drains to 14)
Ash
Ash
Ash (Sala Drains to 13)
Fire Stone
Scissors (Sala Drains to 12)

Should still come out to be a 999 2Hand Axe.

> Will having a high essence in my armor at least give a high 
> resistance to that magic, or is it pointless to have armor with
> high essence levels?

I've heard you get a 10% reduction in damage from elemental magic if 
you have the resistance marker. But the most you need is 3 in an 
essence to get the marker. So high essences are pointless unless you 
need them to produce a card.

This recipe has a nice way of getting a conflicted low resist to 9.

glow crystal
chaos crystal
2x jinn silver [1,2,3
mercury [4,5
3x glow crystal [6
jinn silver
chaos crystal
mercury
glow crystal [7
mercury
windstone [8
4x glow crystal
chaos crystal
2x mercury
jinn gold [9

I'd been using

glow
chaos
2 jinn
4 glow
mercury
chaos
wind
4 glow
2 mercury
chaos
wind
4 glow
chaos
2 mercury
jinn gold

2 moon crystal
2 sun crystal
4 holy water
dragons breath (76)
clear feather (75)

So the lesson is that with integer math multiplication isn't always 
communitive.

--- In LoM_Kitchen@yahoogroups.com, "underworldlegion" 
<underworldlegion@y...> wrote:
> Ok I'm pretty sure about this but I just want to make sure.  Is the 
> reason for getting +20 stats because you have 2 yggdrasil cards and 
> each allows a +10 max across the board and together is +20?  Im 
> trying to make a +20 all stat all status protectio pendent with 
> quite high mdef, all though I'm sure the one in the armor.doc is 
the 
> result of countless hours of striving for the same thing.

No.

This is a theory, but I THINK it's accurate, from what I've read.  
Can someone confirm?

With limits, the highest possible applies.  They don't combine as you 
suggest.  The Cards that give the highest limits are the cards from 
the '7 Evil Gods' set-Fallen Angel, Witch of Moon, Lord of Flies, 
Wings of Darkness, God of Destruction, Beast-Headed God, and 
Leviathan.  Their limits are -10 to +20 to stats.  Their effect on 
attributes is to raise one stat by 15, but put the rest down.

The way the recipies for stat equips work is to combine one of those 
cards with Yggdrassil, which allows items tempered in to raise stats 
as long as the card is present.  Thus allowing you to hit the maximum 
limit via items that don't produce cards, like Meat.

I think having two Yggdrassils is to double the amount tempering an 
item raises stats by.

Your question has a complicated answer.

To put it simply, it's draining that gets it higher than 9.

In order to raise higher than 12ish, you have to use advanced 
draining techniques that end up draining something in order to raise 
two other things, and other strange things like that.

I really don't have an Adamantite Uberrecipe (mostly because it's 
inferior to DiorWood or Dragonscales), but since it's ALSO high 
resistance, it would probably work exactly the same as AltenaAlloy...
